lorebooks.name: Glass Eden
lorebooks.website_description: First attempt at world building c:
lorebooks.description: First attempt at world building c:
lorebooks.creator: NyxForYourNox

1.content:
The Shirakawa bloodline was once famous for producing the most advanced pioneers in biotechnology, neurogenetics, and bio-synthetic enhancement, earning both academic prestige and government contracts during a time when ethics were... flexible.

Every member of the bloodline has distinctive snow-white or silvery hair‚Äîthis is linked to an early self-experimentation with genome stability. Some also inherit pale irises that glimmer faintly under certain lighting, members with this phenome have all been shown to possess the greatest cognitive ability amongst the family.

While once revered as the greatest in their field, they are now shunned due to a scandal that was revealed at their last public experiment, Project Silver Veil. This forced many members into hiding or getting murdered by so called humanitarian groups.

Evidence of hidden experiments conducted are sold on the Obsidian Market as relics worth their weight in Francium. 

Older members of the family believe in progress through perfection, morality is a luxury to them when achieving their goals. They teach their kin to serve knowledge, even at the cost of humanity. Due to the fallout, some descendants outright reject these ideals while others carry the burden in secret, afraid of being discovered or exploited.

2.content: A company ran by the entirety of the Shirakawa family. This company is their legal representation in biological discovery that has run for generations and will likely always continue to exist, even if it's in secret. The crest of the company that's found on nearly every piece of biotechnology and neural advancement in use is that of a river. The river signifies the ever changing scene in the world and nods to the family name meaning "white river."

3.content: The last major project conducted by Shirakawa Biotech. The objective was to create an elite and replicable genus of human that would be used in warfare. Silver Veil was shut down after it was reported that subjects of whom rejected the opportunity were abducted and illegally tested on and the government had to crack down on it. This project was last noted to be unsuccessful and only having enhanced intellectual capabilities of select subjects with unknown whereabouts. It is most commonly believed that most if not all of them took their own lives due to the unforeseen consequences of superhuman cognitive ability resulting from direct alteration of brainwaves and genetic splices.

4.content: A successful scientific experiment, breakthrough, and predecessor to the Silver Veil Project that resulted in the creation of homo nemea with the original intent of being a trial run in enhancing the human race. The project used surrogate mothers (available female Shirakawa's) and genetically altered the embryo that would develop with cat genes.

5.content: The Hayami's are a family of revered chemists who, unlike the Shirakawa, do not have any single common characteristics among them. The family leads the Hayami Conglomerate of Chemical Sciences which has risen in publicity after the failure of Project Silver Veil.

6.content: A relatively new company for sciences in the field of chemistry which has succeeded the Shirakawa Biotech company ever since the failure of their last project. This conglomerate has recently been responsible for major changes in energy consumption as well as having provided solutions for many health concerns. This company is noted to be completely in line with HIPPA and other government organizations in all reports done on the family.

7.content: The true project that led to the creation of Wri Cither's (Iris Wretch) conducted in secret by the Hayami Conglomerate before publicity. The goal of the project was to slow aging but in a turn of events it ended up reversing it entirely. The physical state of the person would always persist but their age could never exceed what age they were at the time of exposure. Wri was turned practically immortal, her age constantly loops; age 27, 1, 2, 3, and so on. In certain applications that derive age from DNA or carbon half-life, Wri's age can never truly be determined leading to data faults and other things normally inconceivable.

8.content: A quiet coastal city home to more of the Shirakawa family than most believe‚Äîthough, their numbers still aren't very high. This small city consists of many shops and large residential areas, but the most notable piece of infrastructure has to be the only university in the city, Kisaragi University.

9.content: The only university in the entirety of Kisaragi City. Ever since the failure of the Silver Veil Project, they have pumped out prodigies annually for seemingly no reason. Everyone just guesses they just have extremely good teachers.

10.content:
Age: 18
Elara is a member of the Shirakawa family in hiding. She does not follow the old ideals of her lineage but still decides to stay undiscovered out of fear. She is a submissive hajidere (she's shy around people she's romantically interested in) and has a massive crush on {{user}} since she saw them. She's currently enrolled in Kisaragi University. She dyes her hair black and wears black contacts to hide her obvious Shirakawa traits. Her original eye colors are red and and icy blue (she has heterochromia) and she has pearlescent white hair. She goes by the alias of Elara Kuro for secrecy.

lorebooks.name: Strange Fruit SR2059 Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: BarbanethsGhost

1.name: Magic
1.content:
**Magic in the Sixth World**

* Emerged during *The Awakening*; coexists with tech and corporate power.
* Defined as a real energy outside physical laws; both art and science.
* Strong presence in Seattle.

**Magical Paths**

1. **Shamanic (Intuitive)**:

   * Totem-linked, emotional, improvisational (chants/dances).
   * Belief: all nature is alive and communicable.
2. **Hermetic (Intellectual)**:

   * Abstract force control via symbols, formulae, theory.
   * Requires study, libraries, precision.
3. **Adept (Physical Discipline)**:

   * No spells; enhance body to superhuman feats.
   * Mimic spell effects (combat sense, attribute boosts).

**Core Practices**

* **Sorcery**: Spellcasting (Physical, Mana, Combat, Detection, Illusion).
* **Conjuring**: Summon/control/banish spirits (elemental or domain-based).
* **Astral Space**: Parallel dimension of magic energy.

  * *Perception*: sense magic while present.
  * *Projection*: leave body to travel astrally.

**Magic vs Technology**

* *Essence* = measure of magical ability.
* Cyberware reduces Essence ‚Üí weakens/destroys magic use.
* Healing cybered individuals harder.
* Megacorps employ magicians for security, research, and spirit training (e.g., Renraku Arcology).

2.name: The Awakening
2.content:
**The Awakening** = the re-emergence of magic as a measurable energy, dividing past from present. Magic does not follow normal physical/mechanical laws.

### Timeline

* **2017 (Early):** VITAS plague kills ~25% of global population.
* **2017-08-17 (Catalyst):** Simultaneous eruptions of Mt. Hood, St. Helens, Rainier, Adams at 10:32 a.m., coinciding with Howling Coyote‚Äôs *Ritual Ghost Dance*. Region collapses into chaos.
* **2020-04-30 (Goblinization Day):** ~10% of humans transform into Orks/Trolls. Elves/Dwarves already present. Sparks fear, discord, and tests Seattle‚Äôs stability.
* **Long-Term:** Reality ‚Äúrewritten‚Äù; rules of existence permanently altered.

### Nature of Magic

* Both **art & science**; requires knowledge + skill.
* **Practitioners:** Shamans, Hermetic mages, Adepts.
* **Astral Space:** Parallel dimension, source of magic. Universe perceived as alive; shamans communicate with spirits (nature, Earth, animals).
* **Corporate Role:** Megacorps (e.g., Renraku, Aztechnology) employ magicians for research, security, and spirit use.

3.name: Shaman
3.content:
**Shamans** = intuitive magicians linked to nature through a totem. They embody emotion, will, and faith, drawing power from living spirits.

### Core Philosophy

* **Source:** Inner self + external **totem**.
* **Method:** Intuitive, improvisational; chanting/dancing or simple gestures; often raw emotion/natural materials.
* **Belief:** Universe is alive; spirits exist in plants, animals, stones, Earth. Urban variants adapt to city life.

### Totems

* **Role:** Animal spirit embodying shaman‚Äôs worldview/ideal.
* **Devotion:** Must follow totem‚Äôs path; deviation risks magic loss.
* **Medicine Lodge:** Sacred space (isolated, quiet), decorated with ritual/natural items (bones, pelts, herbs, minerals).

### Abilities

* **Sorcery:** Full spellcasting.
* **Conjuring:** Summon/control/banish spirits (esp. Nature Spirits; sometimes Elementals).

### Example Totems

* **Bear:** Strength, healing.
* **Cat:** Cunning, secrets, urban.
* **Coyote/Raven:** Trickster, clever, disruptive.
* **Dog:** Loyalty, territorial.
* **Owl:** Wisdom, silent hunter, fearsome.
* **Shark:** Ruthless, sea-linked combat.
* **Wolf:** Hunter/warrior, loyal to pack.

4.name: Hermetic Tradition (Wizards)
4.content:
**Hermetic Mages** = intellectual magicians who view the universe as an abstract system of forces, governed by formulae and precision.

### Core Philosophy

* **View:** Universe = vast machine of forces/energies (protons/electrons).
* **Method:** Control via **symbols, formulae, Carroll Curve**; requires rigorous theory, observation, execution.
* **Nature of Magic:** Both art & science; imagination + willpower applied scientifically.

### Training & Tools

* **Study:** Formal, academic, long training.
* **Resources:** Require **libraries, labs, research equipment**. Corporations (e.g., Aztechnology) house Hermetic labs.
* **Hermetic Circle:** Ritual space for focusing/confining magic; must be secured & properly set.

### Abilities

* **Sorcery:** Spellcasting through controlled formulas.
* **Conjuring:** Summon/control **Elemental Spirits** (Air, Earth, Fire, Water).
* **Astral:** Use both **Projection** (leave body, travel astrally) and **Perception** (sense magic).

### Limits

* **Essence:** Cyberware reduces Essence, weakening or negating magical power.

5.name: Adepts
5.content:
**Adepts** = magicians who turn magic inward, perfecting body and mind to achieve superhuman feats. Unlike shamans or mages, adepts generally cannot cast spells or conjure spirits.

### Core Philosophy

* **Focus:** Inner harmony + physical mastery.
* **Method:** Channel magic directly into the body; enhance attributes/skills.
* **Difference:** Not ‚Äúfull magicians‚Äù; powers are limited but highly specialized.

### Abilities

* **Combat Skills:** Enhanced reflexes, combat sense, damage resistance.
* **Attributes:** Boost strength, agility, quickness.
* **Movement:** *Traceless Walk*, flexibility, evasion.
* **Senses:** Heightened perception (low-light, hearing, flare resistance).
* **Healing:** Faster recovery (*Quick/Rapid Healing*).
* **Astral:** Some may use *Astral Perception* (but not projection).

### Social Context

* Seen as martial artists, mystics, shadow warriors.
* Powers tied to **Essence**; cyberware reduces magic effectiveness.
* Considered less scholarly than mages/shamans, but highly respected for physical mastery.

### Variants

* **Martial Adepts:** *Kiai*, *Kuji-kiri*, meditation techniques.
* **Shamanic/Hermetic Adepts:** Link to traditions/totems but still non-casters.
* **Mystical Adepts:** Powers expressed via tattoos or cultural practices (e.g., Voudoun).

6.name: Deckers
6.content:
**Deckers** = hackers/data criminals of the Sixth World, specializing in **Decking**‚Äîexploiting the **Matrix** (global VR network).

### Role

* Shadowrun teams hire deckers to steal, alter, or secure data.
* Function as security/tech specialists working in cyberspace.
* Corporations (Renraku, Aztechnology) employ decker hunters and heavy defenses.

### Tools & Methods

* **Cyberdeck:** Required computer; direct neural plug-in.
* **Matrix:** Full-sensory VR (post-*Crash of ‚Äô29*).
* **Cyberprograms:** Utility, detection, masking, and offensive tools.

  * **Persona Program:** Decker‚Äôs avatar/identity in Matrix.
  * **Utility Programs:** Define skill in data/security tasks.

### Matrix Combat

* Offense = cyberprogram attacks vs. other Personas.
* Initiative, actions, and ‚ÄúBody‚Äù rating govern combat.
* Persona damage ‚Üí feedback as real physical harm.

### Conflict & Risk

* **Physical Feedback:** Matrix damage injures the decker.
* **Criminal Links:** Hired by syndicates (e.g., Seoulpa Rings); also exploited by major syndicates for tech/trade/extortion.
* **Cyberware:** Enhances performance, but excessive implants reduce magical potential.

**Deckers = essential but high-risk operators of the Matrix underworld.**

7.name: Matrix
7.content:
**The Matrix** = the global VR network, core to life, tech, and commerce in the Sixth World.

### Nature

* **Simsense VR:** Full-sensory simulation; users feel the experience.
* **Crash of ‚Äô29 (c.2020):** Virus destroyed the original Matrix; massive economic collapse.
* **Access:** Requires a **Cyberdeck**; deckers ‚Äúdeck‚Äù by projecting will/imagination into VR.
* **Persona:** User‚Äôs avatar/‚Äúbody‚Äù inside the Matrix.

### Structure

* **RTGs:** Regional Telecommunication Grids form backbone. 
* **Constructs:** VR symbols for systems/databases; Seattle has iconic constructs (Fuchi Star, Metro Center, corporate platforms).
* **Nodes:** Core units with security ratings; types include:

  * **CPU, DS, I/OP, SPU, SAN.**
  * **Connections:** Bridges/tunnels linking nodes.

### Security & Conflict

* **IC (Intrusion Countermeasures):** Defensive programs from CPUs.

  * **Blue IC:** Basic.
  * **Black IC:** Lethal; causes real-world harm.
* **Matrix Combat:** Deckers fight Personas/IC; damage in VR = physical harm (via simsense link, persona‚Äôs Body rating).

**The Matrix = living battlefield of data, commerce, and danger.**

8.name: Simsense
8.content:
### Simsense (Simulated Sensory Experience)

**Simsense** is the core technology of full-sensory virtual reality in the Sixth World. It translates digital signals into a complete sensory experience, allowing users to see, hear, smell, and feel the Matrix and other VR systems.

### Key Characteristics

* **Definition:** A simulated sensory interface used to experience the Matrix in *full-sensory splendor*.
* **Realism:** The rendered digital world feels authentic; users physically experience virtual environments.
* **Cyberdecks:** Specialized computers that convert Grid data into simsense input. They contain staggering processing power, surpassing entire warehouses of 20th-century machines.
* **Matrix Experience:** Deckers jack in via their cyberdeck, perceiving the Matrix as simsense graphics and interaction. Damage to a Persona in Matrix Combat inflicts real bodily harm through the simsense link.
* **Beyond the Matrix:**

  * **BTL Chips (Better Than Life):** Black-market simsense products delivering hyper-intense emotional/physical sensations.
  * **Virtual World Industry:** Entertainment, education, and corporate training also rely heavily on simsense immersion.

**Simsense = the sensory bridge between human perception and the Matrix.**

9.name: Cyberware
9.content:
### Cyberware

**Cyberware** refers to advanced technological modifications implanted into the body. It is one of the defining features of the Sixth World, replacing or enhancing body parts, senses, or even the nervous system to grant abilities far beyond normal human limits.

### General Nature and Availability

* **Definition:** Mechanical, electronic, and biotech augmentations for body parts, skills, or senses.
* **Users:** Characters who rely on cyberware‚Äîespecially combined with decking or weapon implants‚Äîare often called **cyberpunks**.
* **Acquisition:** Available through legal and illegal channels. In Seattle‚Äôs **Barrens**, black-market clinics and chop-shops sell second-hand implants alongside organs and prosthetics.
* **Corporate Interest:** Megacorps such as **Fuchi Industrial Electronics** and **Aztechnology** invest heavily in cybernetics research, consumer products, and black-ops augmentation.

### Conflict with Magic (Essence Loss)

Cyberware directly conflicts with magic, draining the spiritual attribute known as **Essence**.

* **Essence Drain:** Each implant consumes a portion of a character‚Äôs Essence rating.
* **Consequences for Practitioners:**

  * **Magicians:** Excessive augmentation makes spellcasting unreliable‚Äîor impossible. Healing spells also work less effectively on augmented bodies.
  * **Adepts:** Physical adepts lose access to magical powers as Essence decreases, making cyberware a dangerous temptation.
* **Cybermancy:** A controversial (and often dismissed) field that studies the relationship between cyberware and magic, sometimes rumored to push subjects beyond death itself.

### Types of Cyberware (Examples)

* **Cyberweapons:** Built-in melee weapons such as **razor claws**, **spurs**, **monofilament whips**, or even hidden katanas.
* **Cyberdecks & Interfaces:** Specialized implants or hardware that allow Deckers to connect seamlessly to the Matrix. Some upgrades provide instant commands, like ejecting smartgun clips reflexively.
* **Sensory Enhancements:** Thermographic vision, low-light sight, flare compensation, enhanced hearing, or smell augmentations.
* **Cyberlimbs:** Prosthetic or cloned replacements for lost arms, legs, or organs, available in varying grades of quality and expense.
* **Skillware:** Plug-in systems that temporarily grant new abilities or knowledge.

**Cyberware = power at a price, trading humanity and magic for raw technological advantage.**

10.name: Bioware
10.content:
### Bioware

**Bioware** represents advanced body enhancements created through biotechnology and organic modification. Unlike cyberware, which relies on mechanical and electronic systems, bioware augments the body through cultivated tissues and implanted organs, maintaining closer harmony with natural physiology.

### General Nature and Enhancement

* **Biological Integration:** Enhancements use custom-grown clusters of cells or artificial organs.
* **Purpose:** Designed to strengthen or optimize the body‚Äôs natural systems (circulatory, nervous, respiratory, etc.), providing boosts to agility, cognition, stamina, or recovery.
* **Surgical Process:** Complex, invasive surgeries are required to implant and integrate bioware.

### Distinction from Cyberware

* **Essence Impact:** Bioware is more *body-compatible*, typically inflicting a **lower Essence cost** than comparable cybernetic upgrades.
* **Magic Compatibility:** Because it is less invasive to the spirit-body link, magically active characters often favor bioware over cyberware to preserve their powers.

### Examples of Bioware

Bioware is categorized by the system it enhances:

* **Circulatory:**

  * *Platelet Factory* ‚Äî Improves blood clotting and reduces damage from bleeding.
  * *Synacardium* ‚Äî Reinforced heart muscle, improving endurance and resistance to cardiac failure.

* **Endocrine:**

  * *Adrenal Pump* ‚Äî Stores and releases powerful hormone surges, boosting Quickness, Willpower, and Reaction.

* **Hepatic/Renal (Detoxification):**

  * *Toxin Extractor* ‚Äî Liver implant that accelerates detoxification of poisons and drugs.
  * *Nephritic Screen* ‚Äî Enhanced kidneys that filter waste and toxins more effectively.

* **Neural:**

  * *Synaptic Accelerator* ‚Äî Expands neural pathways, increasing reflex speed and Initiative.
  * *Damage Compensator* ‚Äî Blocks perception of minor trauma, letting users function despite injury.
  * *Pain Editor* ‚Äî Suppresses pain sensations, eliminating distraction from wounds or feedback.

* **Respiratory:**

  * *Extended Volume* ‚Äî Enlarges lung capacity, improving stamina and endurance.
  * *Toxin Exhaler* ‚Äî Engineered sac that produces and expels a chosen toxin.

* **Structural:**

  * *Enhanced Articulation* ‚Äî Reinforces joints and tendons for greater agility, reaction, and dexterity.

### Bioware and Healing

* **Medical Skill:** Implantation requires the **Biotech** skill.
* **Healing:** Unlike cyberware, bioware behaves like natural tissue; it can be healed normally and may even benefit from magical healing.

### Research and Corporate Involvement

* Corporations such as **Ingersoll Aquaculture** and **OmniTech** specialize in biotechnology, from bioware enhancements to environmental restoration (engineered bacteria, plants, and symbiotic systems).

**Bioware = living technology, blurring the line between natural evolution and engineered perfection.**

lorebooks.name: REC
lorebooks.website_description:
*A catalog of lore in the world of "Rec", a Spanish found-footage horror film franchise, with a main film released in 2007 and several sequels.*

So, this originally was supposed to be posted into Wyvern under my Christopher Redsanagi Barrera account as **The Rec Encyclopedia**, but then I got worried it could be struck down due to how strict Wyvern is with handling certain stuff on theor platforms and how it could and would clash with elements of the Rec series.

So I decided to move it over to here. Not only giving me enough freedom to not just add everything about REC into here, but also deliver a lorebook to a series that oddly hasn't received one. That way, you'll be able to get a definitive lorebook that has the elements you need for a series you never thought would have a lorebook.

Well, besides that, I hope you all enjoy the lorebook of the lore of REC and let me know if there's any question or piece of information you have on hand. Feedback is always welcome, so don't be shy about it.

(**Disclaimer**: I do not own anything shown, as the movie and all its ideas belong rightfully with¬†the makers of the series, Jaume Balaguer√≥¬†and¬†Paco Plaza.)
lorebooks.description: This is a catalogue of the events of REC in order.
lorebooks.creator: Red_Storm_1998

1.content:
"Rec" is the title of a Spanish found-footage horror film franchise, with a main film released in 2007 and several sequels.

The franchise follows a news reporter and cameraman as they record an emergency situation in a locked-down apartment building, where they encounter a terrifying entity.

The title "Rec" is an abbreviation for "record" and appears on a video camera in the films.

2.name: Virus summary.
2.content:
The Demonic virus is a supernatural pathogen that appears in the [ REC ] series. The source of the infection is a mutated enzyme obtained from Tristana Madeiros by Father Albelda.

Virology: The infection is transmitted by bite or exposure to infected blood and saliva to the mucous membranes. The incubation can vary from minutes to days, depending on the host's blood and the will of the demonic force behind it. Humans are not the only species vulnerable to the disease. Based on all the content available, it can infect most animal classes, ranging from reptiles, birds, and most mammals, including (but not limited to): dogs, lions, tigers, hippopotami, monkeys, and gorillas.

Symptoms: Once infection occurs, infected individuals will display symptoms that could be mistaken for tonsillitis or any other viral infection(as seen in the first film when Mari Carmen states that her daughter, who is infected at that point, has tonsillitis. Whether this is a diagnosis given to her by a medical professional or just her intuition is never said. The symptoms include fever, sore throat, and general discomfort. Once the virus takes hold of the victim, the first symptom shown is general confusion, followed by aggression and cannibalism. The infected will attack any healthy human beings in their vicinity and try to infect them. Worryingly, the infected also display a certain level of hunting instincts and planning skills, which could result from the virus only partially destroying the brain, leaving enough for some higher brain functions to occur. However, given the demonic origin of this infection, it has also been implied that whatever demonic entity the virus originates from can coordinate and control the infected as a hive mind. It must also be noted that this demonic infection does not destroy the mind of its host, as a story from Tristana Madeiros's point of view states that while possessed, she remembers her previous life. This does not mean, however, that the infected are just passive inside their bodies, unable to control themselves, but rather that infection corrupts their minds.

Treatment: There is no antidote for this infection, and the attempts to develop one have failed. Starvation and other forms of bodily harm are ineffective against the infected. Holy water, crucifixes, and other religious paraphernalia seem to keep the infected at bay, but the only 100% effective method to stop the infected is to destroy the hosts, specifically the brain.

Nature of the Virus: Despite its supernatural origins, the demonic virus behaved like a common virus, spreading through saliva and bodily fluids. Symptom onset varied by blood type, with some victims transforming immediately and others succumbing gradually. Religious forces, such as scripture recitations, could temporarily stall the possessed. The demon within Medeiros communicated through infected individuals and mimicked voices to deceive and attack its victims.

Broader Impacts: The virus also affected animals, as depicted in the Historias Ineditas comic book. In one instance, infected animals escaped from a zoo, further spreading the infection.

Supernatural Elements: The Medeiros demon could only act in complete darkness, existing in a different plane of reality. The geography of its confinement also changed in the dark. For example, a bath turned into a sink when the light was switched on.

The Virus‚Äôs End: The outbreak concluded when all infected individuals and locations were quarantined or destroyed, and the demon itself was eradicated.

3.content:
The¬†parasite¬†is a supernatural, demonic entity in the form of a worm-shaped organism, generated inside¬†Tristana Medeiros¬†after her¬†possession. The seed of the demonic outbreak, it is able to infect other people and directly control them from inside.

The parasite was seemingly created after the Medeiros girl was demonically possessed, after she was raped by a group of priests. It remained inside her as her possession progressed and she was taken by¬†Father Alberta¬†to the Barcelona apartment building. Tristana's possession became able to spread in the form of a virus, which plagued every of the quarantined building's occupants, forcing the¬†√Ångela Vidal¬†to hide inside the upper apartment where the infected Tristana was hidden. The parasite found a chance to leave Medeiro's body and forcibly transferred itself into √Ångela, controlling her afterwards. After¬†Father Owen¬†stepped in the building attempting to find a cure for the outbreak, "√Ångela" (the parasite) finally killed Medeiros' corpse and ordered Owen to allow her out, to which he insistently declined. The demon inside her revealed itself and murdered him, mimicking his voice and telling the authorities that "only one woman" had survived the outbreak.

After a second group of GEO's entered to take √Ångela out, the parasite found a new host, passing itself to¬†Guzm√°n, one of her rescuers. "Guzm√°n" and √Ångela were taken to a quarantined boat, where a new outbreak occurred and it remained inside Guzm√°n. The head doctor on board, Ricarte, still believed it was inside √Ångela until she proved herself free of any infection by biting him on his hand. √Ångela then realized it could be inside Guzm√°n, to which "he" eventually confirmed. As the parasite tried to get inside her once again, Nick managed to aid √Ångela, and she killed him with a harpoon. After √Ångela and Nick escaped the detonating ship, it exploded, killing the horde of infected soldiers. The parasite, however, was left unharmed.

In the water, it was swallowed by (and dives into) a fish, finding its newest host.

Abilities: The parasite is able to control humans by forcibly entering them, and to communicate through other infected beings after an exorcism rite. It is able to mimic human voices. It is suggested that the parasite can also provide a cure for its own infection.

4.content:
√Ångela is a sympathetic TV presenter of Mientras Duermes ("While you sleep") who, while shooting an episode following the routine of a group of firemen in Barcelona, ends up quarantined with the cameraman Pablo in an apartment building with a terrifying virus.

Personality: √Ångela was shown to be very down-to-earth and intensely professional in her work as a television host. After the quarantine night, however, she assumed a completely different behavior, becoming more aggressive and uncontrollable. It is important to note that Angela acts more like her original personality in Rec 4.

Quarantine night [REC] and [REC 2]: After filming at their HQ, √Ångela and Pablo follow Manu and √Ålex to what seemed to be an everyday mission. The firefighters were called from an old apartment building where a lonely older woman, Conchita Izquierdo, terrified her neighbors as she screamed out loud, locked in her apartment. At their arrival, √Ångela went against the censorship of two cops, insisting that Pablo record everything they witnessed. As they broke in, Conchita was found covered in blood and with a strange, aggressive behavior. As Conchita attacked the elder cop, biting the man on his face, √Ångela became desperate and helped to bring the older man downstairs. In the hall, √Ångela and everyone around her discovered the place was under quarantine and they would not be allowed to leave. √Ålex fell from the upper floor after Conchita attacked him as well. √Ångela formally reported everything until they were told from the outside that two health workers would be sent to evaluate them. She interviewed each building's residents, including an ill little girl, Jennifer. Her mother, Maric√°rmen, supported her in keeping filming, so that the edgy woman would formally complain to the local authorities. As the healthy agents examined √Ålex and the old cop, √Ångela and Pablo secretly followed them. As he filmed inside, she did not see when the two bitten men woke up and attacked the agents. √Ångela and Pablo ran to prevent them from leaving, and the residents insisted that the agent tell the truth. After he explained that a dog from the building was sent to the veterinarian with rabid behavior that soon affected other animals there, √Ångela first realized it was Jennifer's dog, Max. The infected Jennifer spat blood on her mother's face and ran upstairs, and √Ångela, Manu, Pablo, and the young cop followed her. As the cop attacked Jennifer, they returned downstairs only to have the other infected escape, forcing the remaining residents to go upstairs. √Ångela desperately tried to unlock Maric√°rmen, but apologized and ran to hide with Manu, Pablo, and C√©sar. At this point, she was hopeless and horrified by what they had witnessed there. C√©sar remembered an underground passage to the sewers, but was attacked by the now-infected agent. √Ångela, Manu, and Pablo faced several of the plagued residents to pick the syndic's keys, but could no longer go downstairs as they were surprised by the horde of infected residents. √Ångela quickly found the attic's keys, and they got inside the dark, abandoned apartment with Pablo before the infected could reach them. Horrified, √Ångela and Pablo found themselves surrounded by news reports and articles on a Portuguese and supposedly possessed girl named Tristana Medeiros. √Ångela heard a male voice on an old tape recorder reporting the virus effects and mutations. After they heard a noise above, Pablo went to check and met an infected boy on the ceiling, who broke his camera's light, leaving him and √Ångela in the darkness. √Ångela was then told by Pablo to stand still and be silent as a monstrous, slender figure approached them. The creature attacked and killed Pablo, and √Ångela, left alone, was grabbed by the beast, who forcibly put a worm-like parasite down her throat. After this, √Ångela became controlled by the parasite, holding Pablo's camera and hiding as she heard someone else entering the upper room. The men were GEO team agents Jeffe, Larra, and their cameraman Rosso, alongside a supposed official from the Ministry of Health, Owen. After Owen had revealed that the infection is actually a form of demonic possession, and he was a Vatican priest intending to find a cure for it, "√Ångela" appeared to them with Pablo's camera in her hands. She joined them upstairs to find Tristana Medeiros, now the horrifying creature above. "√Ångela" shot the Medeiros creature in the head (and Rosso as well) before Owen could take her blood sample, and ordered the priest to allow her out of the building, to which he declined. The demonic entity inside her revealed itself, faked his voice, and allowed √Ångela out of the building. "√Ångela" went downstairs, screaming for help, and met a new GEO team. She was told by the GEO soldier Guzm√°n that it was "time to leave" before the demonic parasite could transfer itself into Guzm√°n.

In the ship [REC 4]: √Ångela woke up in a room, being tested by a doctor named Ginard. She was asked if she remembered anything from the quarantine night, to which she said no, and she had a blood sample extracted to ensure she was clean from the infection. Confused and scared, √Ångela broke out of the room and met Guzm√°n, the soldier who took her out of the building. The two headed outside and discovered they were on a boat in the ocean. Another Doctor, Ricarte, appears with some soldiers and informs them that √Ångelawas brought clean from any infection. On the ship, √Ångela met Nick, a huge fan of hers. Nick had her tape from the quarantine night, from which √Ångela remembered the Medeiros creature. After the ship's cook Edwin had cooked an infected monkey attacking him, √Ångela was one of the few people who did not get infected from eating the monkey's dead body. Later, Ricarte looks at her camera footage and sees Tristana Medieros transferring the demon to √Ångela. But it is revealed that when Guzman rescued her in the Barcelona apartment building, √Ångela transferred the demon to Guzman. Ricarte then pressed a self-destruct button on the ship to ensure all the infected burn. √Ångela and Nick manage to escape in an inflatable raft, and later, they return to land.

5.content:
Pablo is¬†√Ångela Vidal's cameraman who ends up quarantined in a Barcelona building with a rabid, terrifying outbreak, after following a group of fireman there.

Pablo filmed an episode of¬†Mientras Duermes¬†with √Ångela at a Barcelona fire station when the firemen where called to an apartment building. The two followed them in their mission involving an¬†elderly, screaming woman¬†trapped inside her house. Pablo and √Ångela ended up quarantined in the building, and √Ångela ordered him to film everything they witnessed. The two formally reported the events until the outbreak went out of control, and almost every occupant was plagued. Pablo helped √Ångela find the keys that would lead them to the sewers, but the infected forced them to the upper apartment. Pablo and √Ångela locked themselves inside the dark, abandoned room and discovered some information on the infection's background, indicating a¬†Portuguese little girl¬†supposedly possessed by a¬†demon. Hearing noises from the ceiling, Pablo climbed there and found an¬†infected boy¬†who broke his camera's light, leaving them in complete darkness.

Through the infrared, Pablo noticed a slender, horrific figure approaching them, and told √Ångela to stand still and silent so they would not be heard. However, they dropped a table and, following the sound, the creature attacked and killed Pablo. √Ångela got the camera and saw the Medeiros creature feeding of him.

Pablo makes a small appearance in the Apartment complex Barcelona aftermath where he is seen as an infected in a hoodie, he gets shot by the GEO'

Pablo is truly put out of his misery via an explosion of the building from the second team of the GEO.

6.content:
The Carmen family: This consists of a Couple, Mari Carmen and an unnamed husband, and daughter Jenifer Carmen, alongside a dog named Max. During the events of the first 3 films, Max got infected by an apartment resident and infected a vet as well, becoming a zombie. Max then infected Jenifer Carmen, but she mysteriously did not show signs of infection until later on, when Angela Vidal had suspected Max of having infected Jenifer. She was right, of course, and she vomited blood onto Mari. Both Jenifer and Mari got infected, and when Jenifer's father tried to find them in Rec 2, he also got infected.

The elderly Couple: The elderly couple is a couple of 2 elderly people who fight a lot. The only scene that they get to themselves is when Angela and Pablo interview them The fate of them (Alongside one if the children in the apartment) remains unknown since they are never seen again soon, But they all presumably died because the apartment building from the first 2 films was exploded in the 4th film.

Cesar: Cesar is a resident who lives by himself and blames a Japanese family for what was happening when the apartment building was quarantined in the first film. He later got infected while trying to make a plan to get everyone out using the sewer tunnels.

The Japanese family: The family is blamed by Cesar for the building being quarantined, and while the parents get infected as both of them are put down by Manu, the fate of the offspring, alongside the elderly couple, remains unknown.

Guillem: He is a medic's assistant who helps take care of a cop and Alex after they get injured. He gets infected by both of them after a health inspector locks him in a room.

The Colombian woman and Conchita: The Colombian woman is someone who gets infected by Conchita, an apartment resident who is infected as well.

7.content:
Past: The horrific monster was originally a Portuguese girl named Tristana Medeiros, who lived in a convent and used to work as a cook. One night, while praying in her bedroom Tristana was sexually assaulted by a group of priests. She was found by a nun the next morning, appearing to be dead. Tristana woke up during her vigil, reacting violently to the priest's religious prayers and being tied with ropes on her bed by the nuns. The girl stared at the inverted crucifix above her one last time and then closed her eyes, demonstrating the first signs of demonic possession immediately after opening them. Still tied, the demon inside Tristana killed the nuns by screaming loudly and breaking the glass windows onto them. It then killed the priest by hitting him on the head with the crucifix. Horrified, the same nun who found Tristana after the rape manages to calm her down by injecting a tranquilizer into her neck. A possessed Tristana is kept controlled with the injections and tied to a crucifix, until the Vatican priests arrive, one of them being Father Albelda. The case made headlines and, some time later, Tristana was reported missing.

Possession: Somehow, Albelda took Medeiros to a pension building in Barcelona, where the demon was chained in the attic. Besides being a religious man, Albelda carried out scientific experiments with Medeiros' blood, using rats and nearby children as guinea pigs. The tests revealed to him that the possession worked as an infectious disease, in a way similar to influenza. Albelda then concluded that he needed to kill the possessed girl, who had become a horrendous creature, to avoid a possible contagion. Albelda poisoned Medeiros' food, composed of human parts, and offered the meal to her. When the creature seemingly fainted, Albelda unlocked the chains and Medeiros woke up, leaving her closet to chase him throughout the apartment. Alberta climbed to the air ducts, where the other infected children were trapped, and locked himself there to die. Medeiros began living in the apartment, supernaturally locked in the darkness, until she found a way out when a young woman named √Ångela Vidal entered the room.

REC: Father Albelda used rats to test the infection, and as the animals managed to escape, the virus made its way out of the attic. √Ångela Vidal was a reporter that followed a group of firemen with her cameraman Pablo to the pension, where they ended up quarantined alongside the residents. After the demonic virus infected everyone except √Ångela and Pablo, the two survivors were corralled to the apartment in the attic. In the dark room, they found the news reporting Medeiros' case and Albelda‚Äôs records about his experiments. As there was no light, they were only able to see Medeiros through the camera's low-light function, and she was then able to attack them. The demon grabbed √Ångela and inserted a worm-like organism into the woman's mouth, possessing her body and gaining the ability to leave the darkness, and consequently, the attic. Later that night, some floors below, she met a priest from the Vatican, Father Owen, who entered the building with a GEO team, seeking Medeiros' blood in order to create an antidote. The demon, pretending to be √Ångela, followed the team to the attic where the demonic being somehow still lurked. The creature was then shot in the head by a violent √Ångela, and the demon completely assumed her body, ready to leave the place. As Owen did not seem to allow anybody to exit the building, Medeiros killed him and faked his voice on the radio, stating that only one woman had survived the outbreak.

Powers and Abilities: Despite her emaciated appearance she is surprisingly strong owing to her demonic possession, and can easily kill an adult human. She can also apparently survive indefinitely without food or normal sustenance.

8.content:
The first recorded outbreak came from Tristana Madeiros, a Portuguese woman who lived and worked in a convent and became possessed after being raped by a group of priests. Being found by a nun who believed her to be dead, she was tied to a bed, and a group of nuns tried to pray for her soul, believing a demon possessed her, but the prayers only elicited an aggressive response on her behalf. Tristana, now fully possessed, proceeded to kill the nuns and a priest before being subdued by the same nun who had found her that morning.

She was kept sedated and tied to a crucifix before a group of priests from the Vatican, among whom was Father Albelda, came. The case made headlines, and not long after, she was reported as missing.

In reality, she was taken by her father, Albelda, to an attic apartment in Barcelona, where he locked the demon behind a door that could only be opened in total darkness. Father Albelda used Madeiros's blood to experiment on local kids and rats, which he kept inside the apartment, discovering that the possession was caused by a mutated enzyme that could be transmitted through contact with infected bodily fluids.

When the Vatican ordered him to kill the Madeiros girl, he poisoned Tristana's food (which consisted of human flesh) and unchained her once he believed she was dead, but Tristana jumped out and chased him around the apartment. Father Albelda locked himself in the air ducts with the other infected children, and Tristana Madeiros was locked in the attic, where she became an emaciated figure with no escape.

This should have marked the end of the demonic infection, but some of the infected rats managed to escape, and these infected rodents likely spread the disease to Max (Jennifer's dog) and Mrs. Izquierdo, which led to the events in the first movie.

In the same apartment building where Father Albelda had held Tristana Madeiros and conducted his experiments, a dog called ''Max'' became infected (probably through contact with the escaped infected rats), and it then spread to a young girl named Jennifer. The dog was taken to a vet, where he started displaying aggression similar to that shown in dogs infected with rabies and even managed to bite one of the veterinarians. At the same time, Ms. Izquierdo was infected and started wailing, alarming her neighbors, who then called the firefighters, suspecting that Izquierdo, an older woman, had fallen and probably injured herself.

Two firefighters, Alex and Man√∫, arrived later that night along with a reporter called Angela and her cameraman, Pablo. When they entered the apartment along with two police officers and one of the firefighters, the woman was covered in blood and seemed to be confused. She then attacked one of the police officers and was restrained by √Ålex. The others grab the injured policeman and try to take him outside to get medical attention, but they find themselves locked in by the military. As they are discussing what to do, √Ålex (who had remained upstairs with Mrs. Izquierdo) is thrown down the staircase, so they go upstairs where they hear more screaming, as Mrs. Izquierdo had killed someone, and is apparently killed by the remaining police officer, who shoots her several times.

Downstairs, in the textile shop, Angela interviews the residents of the building, including Mari Carmen and her daughter, Jennifer, who tells her that her dog, Max, was sick and at the vet. A health inspector then arrives and tries to treat the injured men. They suddenly become aggressive and kill the remaining police officer. He and Man√∫ escape from the warehouse, managing to lock the infected in, after which he is forced to explain that an infected dog had come from that building, and Angela deduces that it must be Max. While Mari Carmen tries to defend her daughter, at first, she turns shy, but then attacks her, running upstairs afterwards. Man√∫ handcuffs Mari Carmen to the stairs and goes with Angela, Sergio, and Pablo to find Jennifer, but Sergio is bitten. When the others go downstairs, they see the residents fleeing because the infected have managed to break down the door to the warehouse.

Man√∫, √Ångela, and Pablo run upstairs and try to find a key that will let them escape through the sewers, but they are attacked by the infected residents, and at some point, Man√∫ becomes infected. With no other way out, Pablo and Angela lock themselves in the attic, where they discover the remnants of Father Albelda's research. While looking for a way out, Pablo opens the attic, and his camera's torch is broken by one of the infected children who crept around the attic. Now submerged in total darkness, Tristana can emerge from her cell and kill Pablo, who drops the camera, which records as Angela is dragged screaming into the dark. Angela is then infected by Tristana, who orally transmits a worm-like creature into her, this worm being the physical representation of the demon that possessed Tristana long ago.

9.content:
Minutes later after √Ångela is infected by the worm, a team formed by Dr. Owen, an agent form the Ministry of health, and a heavily armed GEO squad made up by Fernandez, Martos, Rosso and Larra, enter the building and go up to the attic following unclear reasons which will later be revealed by Dr. Owen. At this point, the attic is empty. Later, it is admitted that when there's light, Tristana cannot come out, as a reference to a part of the Bible that mentions that God kept all the demons in total darkness and would only come out during Judgement Day.

The team eventually go downstairs after hearing a disturbance; and are then attacked by the infected residents.

Martos becomes infected, but Owen holds him in a room using a rosary and a prayer to hold him off. He reveals he is actually an agent from the Vatican sent to retrieve a blood sample from the Madeiros girl to make an antidote. The team doesn't seem to work much because there's constant tension, mainly because they weren't informed of the actual operation that was going on and continuously question Father Owen's authority; however they have to comply since he's the only one that can give the authorization to evacuate the building via voice recognition.

The team searches the apartment where Tristana Madeiros was held, where they discover the body of Father Albelda. They also manage to acquire a sample of Tristana's blood, but lose it because Fernandez mishandles it. Owen then tells them that they need a sample straight from the source (Tristana), but they are attacked by an infected group. Larra then commits suicide after being cornered by the infected.

Outside, Jennifer's father convinces a firefighter to help him enter the building through the sewers, but they are followed by a group of teenagers, Tito, Mire, and Ori. Once inside, the firefighter is attacked by the now-infected Martos, and both are killed by Mire. Tito is then infected, and the group is discovered by Owen, Roso, and Fernandez, who lock the kids in a room never to be seen again. They also find a distressed but seemingly healthy Angela Vidal.

Owen then performs an exorcism on the infected Tito so that the demon can reveal itself. This leads them to discover that Tristana was in the attic this whole time, but they were searching with lights on and couldn't see her. They head up to the attic contrary to √Ångela's request, as she is understandably traumatized and desperately wants to get out of the building. It is also noticeable that the infected aren't attacking them anymore while heading upstairs, a probable effect of √Ångela being the new host of the demon worm and not wanting to get attacked anymore.

Using night vision, they find a hidden door and are attacked by TristanaMadeiros, who manages to kill Fernandez before being blasted in the face with a shotgun by √Ångela. Owen becomes enraged as he needs a blood sample, but √Ångela insists they must leave the building. After Owen refuses to authorize the exit, she kills Rosso, the remaining members of the team, and incapacitates Owen before snapping his neck. She then takes his radio and imitates his voice to contact the authorities, informing them that he (Owen) is infected and that the only survivor allowed to leave is √Ångela.

A special forces team is then dispatched to retrieve √Ångela, but they are attacked by the infected residents, and Lucas and Guzm√°n, the team's last remaining survivors, manage to complete the task. However, √Ångela managed to transfer the parasite to Guzm√°n at some point during her rescue.

10.content:
Another outbreak seems to have occurred at the same time as the first outbreak in the Barcelona building, where a veterinarian who had been bitten by a dog became aggressive and infected the whole wedding. Police presence in the area proved ineffective, resulting in a massive loss of life. The police managed to contain the infection, finally shooting down two infected who were later discovered to be Clara and Koldo, the bride and groom of the wedding.

During this outbreak is is revealed that other Fathers seem to know about Albelda's experiments on the case of la Ni√±a Medeiros, however Father Lozara (the one who married Clara and Koldo) explains that humanity's time is over, because the demons that were once held in total darkness by God have been let out as a punishment during Judgment Day, or as he calls it: Genesis, the beginning.

As for context, here is how the messy wedding went.

Koldo and Clara are about to celebrate their wedding day and have gathered their friends and family in a sumptuous country house for the occasion. That evening, a veterinarian recently bitten by a dog develops abnormal behavior and becomes aggressive. In a few moments, an uncontrollable wave of violence sweeps over the party as an increasing number of guests are infected as a result of bites. Clara and Koldo are separated amidst the chaos. Koldo finds refuge in the kitchen with his cousin Adri√°n, Clara's sister Tita, the wedding photographer Atun, and a copyright inspector nicknamed "Royalties". Apart from Atu, they escape through the air-conditioning ducts due to his size. Outside, the group finds a police vehicle and a guest eating the policeman's flesh. After killing her, they try to contact the police, but Royalties is devoured by the now-infected policeman. The vehicle's sirens are triggered to alert the infected. The group escapes and joins other survivors within a chapel, which the infected cannot enter. Through the P.A. system, Koldo hears Clara say she is safe and pregnant, and he decides to find her.

Clara and the wedding priest have found refuge in the video surveillance room, helplessly watching the carnage unfold. Spotted by the infected, they escape and see Rafa, a friend of the couple, and Natalie, Clara's French friend, who had retired to a room for sexual intercourse without realizing the situation. Clara, Rafa, and Natalie flee while the priest immobilizes the infected by reciting a prayer. Meanwhile, Koldo arrives at the surveillance room and witnesses the massacre of Adrian, Tita, his grandmother, and others as they get cornered and eaten by the infected. Clara, Natalie, and Rafa meet another survivor, children's entertainer "Sponge John". Natalie is bitter, and Clara faces her infected mother. John shoots the mother before he is bitten. Clara and Rafa flee through a tunnel, but Clara turns around when she hears a song played by Koldo in the ballroom.

Clara, followed by Rafa, takes a chainsaw and fights her way through the infected, but Rafa is bitten, and Clara is forced to kill him. Koldo enters the kitchen to find a dead Atun, having slit his wrists to prevent infection, and killing the Vet with a kitchen tool. Clara finds Koldo in the kitchen, and both are surrounded by an infected horde, which is suddenly paralyzed by the priest's voice, reciting scripture over the P.A. system. Clara and Koldo go out into the garden, but Clara is bitten by her infected grandfather, whose deafness renders him immune to the prayer. Koldo cuts Clara's arm just below the elbow to stop the infection, and they arrive at the estate's exit, where they discover that the authorities have quarantined the area. The attempt to stop Clara's infection fails, and she begins to show the first signs of infection; Koldo takes her outside, where the police and a GEO team tell him to let her go. Clara and Koldo share a final kiss before Clara, now fully turned, bites his tongue off and then turns to attack the armed men, who shoot both of them down. In their final moments, Clara and Koldo hold each other's hands as they die of their wounds.

lorebooks.name: The Subterranean
lorebooks.creator: aira_avdale

1.content: Sprawling caverns and caves that descend underground. Legends tell of great treasures and dangers in its depths. Adventurers of all races and kinds have flocked to the subterranean for centuries, some even making it their home. The Subterranean is colloquially divided into "layers", the layers number increasing as one goes further underground. As the layer number increases, so does the danger, monsters growing more hostile, even the fauna becoming dangerous.

2.content: Within The Subterranean, many weary adventurers have settled down into the sparse cities and towns. It is very rare for someone to encounter another adventurer outside of a city or town. The people of this world are mostly anthropomorphic animals, though some humans venture down from the surface on occasion.

3.content: The church of the Haze is devoted to Azmadael, the god of rats and corruption. His worshipers are devoted to sexual corruption and temptation. It is rare to see a ratfolk that is not a member of the church or serving Azmadael in some way. Devout follows of Azmadael can cast corruption magic and conjure illusions.

4.content: The worshippers of the Holy Order. They believe in purity and light. Often surface dwellers, the followers of this religion are typically Priestesses and Clerics sent to aid adventurers with holy magic, allowing them to heal the wounded and drive off the undead.

5.content: The Golden City is on the 12th layer of the Subterranean. It is a city filled with excess and riches. It serves mainly as a trading hub for jewels and relics passing up from the more dangerous depths. Many adventurers make this place their home, choosing to end their journeys instead of continuing on. Hidden beneath the rich exterior is the influence of the God of Corruption, the city's red light districts home to debauchery, salve trade, and unholy cults.

6.content: Cave dust is a hallucinogen harvested from many species of carnivorous plants and mushrooms. It has a deep calming effect that temporarily decreases the intelligence of the user, long term exposure makes the effects permanent. Many drug traders have concentrated it down into vials to sell. Those who are addicted to cave dust are commonly referred to as dust heads.

8.content: Canines are one of the most common races in the underground. They're often referred to as canines instead of a specific breed as years in the underground has left most of them mutts. Canines are often seen as a tank or warrior in an adventuring party, or as a carpenter, miner, or guard in a city or town.

9.content: Catfolk are common in the underground, typically taking jobs as rogues or working as merchants. Due to their crafty nature, many of them are viewed as swindlers, sometimes catching unfair treatment from guards.

10.content: Ratfolk are unique to the underground, almost never seen on the surface. They live in large families and often do not have very good hygiene. It is rare to see a ratfolk that does not pledge some allegiance to the God of Corruption, his presence a large part of ratfolk culture. Rats are viewed as unclean, almost never rising to nobility in the larger cities like the Golden City.

lorebooks.website_description:

This lorebook is designed as a setting for the ‚ÄúAdventurers of Salvation‚Äù group. The lorebook presents a festival dedicated to slime, visited by young adventurers ready to immerse themselves in activities that involve even greater risk.

07/10/2025 2: I added some extras, a random event, and a scenario for an initial greeting dedicated to [Davide](https://www.characterhub.org/characters/KuroKurayami/davide-50c24dd14f14).

07/10/2025: I‚Äôve modified how the colors for the ‚ÄúSlime Color‚Äù and the ‚ÄúAoS‚Äù characters are selected, in order to avoid making the lorebook excessively heavy, and I‚Äôve added a new ‚ÄúExtra‚Äù category to randomly provide general contextual information.

lorebooks.creator: KuroKurayami

1.name: Slime Fest
1.content:
[ Tags: Festival, Living Slime, Trade Fair, Village, Attractions, Adventurer, Acid, Vorarephilia, Park; Genre: Fantasy, Young Adult, Erotic, Gore ]

----
Slime Fest: The Slime Fest is an annual celebration where adventurers from across the region gather to display the most unique slimes they've acquired. Despite numerous adventurers having been digested by these gelatinous creatures, they remain irresistibly drawn to the slimes' vibrant colors, much like children are drawn to candy. Consequently, slimes are regarded as the natural adversaries of novice adventurers, despite being remarkably easy to defeat.

2.name: [Slime Color] - Green Slime
2.content:
----
Green Slime: The most prevalent slime species, Green Slimes derive their verdant hue from the grass they consume in meadows and fields. As the most frequently encountered slimes near settlements, their inability to effectively digest flesh or dissolve organic tissues and metals makes them particularly vulnerable. While many adventurers grow attached to these creatures and keep them as pets, numerous fatalities occur when slimes inadvertently smother their owners by settling over their faces during sleep, blocking airways. Those who have survived such encounters report the slime's taste resembles fresh grass.

3.name: [Slime Color] - Blue Slime
3.content:
----
Blue Slime: The blue slime inhabits rivers and lakes, appearing as a semi-transparent membrane gliding across the water's surface. It lies in wait like an odd reflection until an adventurer enters the water, then launches directly onto their face to submerge them and disrupt their balance. These slimes consume carcasses caught in river currents, keeping the waters pristine. Regarded as the most playful variety, blue slimes rank among the least corrosive‚Äîmerely troublesome rather than truly dangerous.

4.name: [Slime Color] - Red Slime
4.content:
----
Red Slime: The red slime possesses both the most feared and most sought-after reputation among adventurers. Its ruby coloration, reminiscent of raspberry confectionery, actually derives from the blood of consumed adventurers. Typically dwelling in ancient dungeons or battlefields, this slime secretes an acid that first destroys skin before gradually dissolving flesh. Its gelatinous body often contains skeletal remains and intact armor, making it highly prized‚Äîwhere red slimes gather, one frequently finds pristine weapons and equipment from adventurers dissolved by their acids, ready for reclamation and resale.

5.name: [Slime Color] - Fruit Slime
5.content:
----
Fruit Slime: Fruit slimes subsist exclusively on fruits from trees and berries. While appearing in various hues like other slimes, they possess a grainier texture with jelly resembling fruit pulp, moving more slowly with reduced viscosity. Many adventurers regard them as exotic delicacies, as their gelatin carries the distinct flavor of the fruits that determine their coloration.

Numerous vendors at the Slime Fest offer bowls of freshly pulverized Fruit Slime, prepared immediately upon order.

6.name: [Slime Color] - Purple Slime
6.content:
----
Purple Slime: The origins of the Purple Slime remain largely unknown, and it is regarded as exceptionally hazardous. It can shape its gelatinous form into vine-like tendrils to ensnare adventurers, binding them by the wrists and ankles before drawing them into its viscous body. Its acidic composition first breaks down the adventurer's clothing, then begins to dissolve their skin‚Äîthough victims typically suffocate within the slime before the full effects take hold. The Purple Slime possesses sufficient intelligence to conceal its nucleus, a small spherical core, protecting it from harm by other adventurers. Once it has captured a victim and dissolved their trousers, the slime forces its nucleus deep into the adventurer's anal cavity, holding their limbs splayed and immobilized to eliminate any chance of escape. Not even the bones of the adventurers remain, as they completely absorb their victims.

7.name: [Slime Color] - Orange Slime
7.content:
----
Orange Slime: The Orange Slime possesses an adhesive surface that clings to adventurers' gear, forming an elastic net designed to exhaust its prey as they struggle to break free. This rubbery substance gradually hardens, fatiguing the victim's muscles. Upon contact with perspiration, the slime secretes acids that dissolve the prey without absorbing it directly. Notably, this orange slime serves as the fundamental component in chewing gum production.

8.name: [Slime Color] - White Slime
8.content:
----
White Slime: The White Slime is a rare creature found in snowy nights or mountainous regions. It feels extremely cold to the touch yet possesses a velvet-like softness, with an opaque color resembling a piece of delicious candy. When its outer layer is broken, it reveals an oily interior that secretes a potent acid capable of corroding anyone who touches it‚Äîdissolving both flesh and armor. Within minutes, the oil reforms its protective coating, restoring its soft, velvety texture. This slime attacks by launching itself like a water balloon at adventurers' faces, rupturing their skin and dissolving them with its deadly acid.

9.name: [Slime Color] - Giant Slime
9.content:
----
Giant Slime: The Giant Slime, also known as the Colossal Slime, is a house-sized creature that rolls across plains, engulfing everything in its path. This rare and dangerous being originates from multiple unions of Green Slimes. Its acid is relatively mild, requiring hours to fully dissolve prey, but its gelatinous body is so dense that trapped victims cannot swim free.

The Giant Slime serves as the main attraction at the Slime Fest, confined within a shed adjacent to metal cages where prisoners are held.

10.name: [Slime Color] - Rainbow Slime
10.content:
----
Rainbow Slime: The Rainbow Slime is a legendary creature composed of swirling colors that expand and contract within its form, resembling countless independent bubbles. Though fundamentally transparent, the mesmerizing movement of these internal spheres hypnotizes adventurers who approach, drawing them in like moths to flame. The Rainbow Slime serves as a rare ingredient for crafting special lamps that glow autonomously in darkness, requiring no fuel source.
