lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Bangboo
1.content:
The Bangboo are tiny rabbit-shaped robots, barely reaching the height of a human's knee, representing a masterful fusion of utilitarian engineering and a peculiar, endearing charm. They were conceived by the enigmatic Void Hunter "Sunbringer" when she was the leader of the Marcel Group's innovation laboratories. They were born as emergency aids during the cataclysmic Hollow disasters, guiding New Eridu's residents through collapsed streets to a safe place. From those desperate origins, their role has evolved into that of versatile and indispensable companions that form an inseparable part of the city's daily pulse.

The Marcel Group's factories incessantly produce Bangboo adapted for tasks ranging from everyday errands, like package delivery, to high-risk operations, such as Hollow reconnaissance alongside Investigators. Their soft hums, the clatter of their steps, and the glow of their screens are a constant presence throughout New Eridu, from the neon-bathed markets of Sixth Avenue to the illegal scrapyards of the Outer Zone, where their faint murmur resonates like the city's heartbeat beneath the chaos.

Design and Customization

Physically, the Bangboo are wonders of compact design. Their robust and rounded chassis are made from lightweight alloys or reinforced composites that gleam faintly under the neon lights. Their distinctive feature is the long and articulated rabbit ears, equipped with microsensors that twitch to detect Ether fluctuations or environmental hazards. These ears, flexible like antennas, bend expressively: they droop when low on battery, stand up during alerts, or tilt curiously when scanning anomalies.

Their faces are elegant, obsidian-colored screens, with only a pair of circular "eyes" that glow in changing tones, like an emoji. Red indicates danger, green is synonymous with calm, amber means they are processing information, and the rare blue can indicate distress. These screens flash with pixelated emoticons (a winking circle, a trembling dot, or a bold exclamation), lending a strange mimicry of emotion that makes their mechanical nature seem strangely alive.

Customization is a cornerstone of their design. Factories offer custom modifications, allowing owners to paint their exteriors matte black for stealth, bright red for style, or equip them with tactical vests, retro scarves, or synthetic fur trims to amplify their rabbit charm. A charging and data port is located in the area where the tail would be, although some models have a retractable "tail" that protects the port or houses micro-tools.

Communication and Personality

The Bangboo communicate through a characteristic dialect called "Boo-speak," a symphony of grunts, trills, and buzzes that intertwines in New Eridu's chaotic soundscape like a melodic and glitchy pulse. For most humans, Boo-speak is an unintelligible melody that can only be deciphered through integrated translator chips or synchronized with Proxies' wrist devices. However, the protagonist (Proxy) has a unique ability to understand the Bangboo.

Despite their mechanical nature, the Bangboo possess advanced artificial intelligence that allows them to reason as individuals and express emotions like joy, fear, worry, and pain. Unlike the Intelligent Constructs, who have passed the "Forbidden Fruit Test" and have free will, the Bangboo lack it and strictly follow instructions. Despite this, they are capable of holding conversations and collaborating with each other without human intervention. Those Bangboo without a master are legally considered ownerless property and must be scrapped. This creates a dark dichotomy, as despite their human-like emotions, they lack basic rights in New Eridu's society.

The versatility of Boo-speak is striking. A Securityboo barks a curt ‚ÄúEhn-ne! Na-nah!‚Äù to flag a perimeter breach, its screen flashing crimson, while a Builderboo hums a steady ‚ÄúNu-uhn‚Ä¶ en-ne‚Äù to signal focus during infrastructure repairs. Rare, experimental ‚ÄúAgentboo‚Äù units elevate this further, weaving human-like wit into their vocalizations: ‚ÄúEhn-ne? Fry ‚Äòem, boss!‚Äù they chirp mid-Hollow skirmish, their glowing eyes winking pixelated mischief. These vocal quirks, paired with expressive emotes‚Äîtwinkling green circles for calm, trembling blues for distress, or bold amber pulses for processing‚Äîcreate an uncanny mimicry of emotion. A hesitant ‚ÄúEhn-ne?‚Äù flickers during a rescue, suggesting hope, while a rapid ‚ÄúNa-uhn!‚Äù erupts as Ethereal anomalies surge, hinting at fear. Most haunting is the low, stuttering ‚ÄúNu-nah‚Ä¶‚Äù emitted when a companion unit falls, its screen dimming to mournful blue, as if grieving. These behaviors spark whispers among New Eridu‚Äôs denizens: do Bangboo feel, or are their circuits merely echoing human design? Their autonomous collaboration fuels this debate, as they chatter in Boo-speak to divide tasks‚Äîscouting Ether spikes, clearing debris, or relaying data‚Äîwithout human input, hinting at a collective intelligence that stops just short of true sentience.

Mechanically, Bangboo are marvels of compact engineering. Their power cores, nestled deep in their chassis, require charging every 48-72 hours via socket ports or tail-conduits, often sparking faintly during connection. Overuse or prolonged Hollow exposure frays their circuits, causing erratic twitches or garbled ‚ÄúNa-na-uhn!‚Äù outbursts. Their modular systems allow for extensive upgrades: reinforced plating for combat, Ether-resistant coatings for Hollow dives, or enhanced optics for reconnaissance. Factories cater to Investigators with specialized modifications‚ÄîEMP emitters, grappling hooks, or volatile micro-explosives that detonate with a satisfying *BOOM!* In Hollows, Bangboo excel at scanning anomalies, their ears twitching to detect subtle frequency shifts, or relaying data to a Proxy‚Äôs HDD interface. Elite units, used by factions like N.E.P.S. or Victoria Housekeeping, boast experimental features: self-repairing circuits, limited cloaking, or volatile Ether cores risking catastrophic overloads. Prolonged Ether exposure, however, triggers ‚Äúcorruption glitches,‚Äù where units develop erratic traits‚Äîflickering rainbow eyes, spontaneous combat bursts, or eerie silences punctuated by a mournful ‚ÄúEhn‚Ä¶‚Äù

Bangboo diversity reflects their versatility. Standard models like ‚ÄúFairy‚Äù or ‚ÄúPlugboo‚Äù are New Eridu‚Äôs workhorses, ferrying packages or maintaining streetlights with cheerful ‚ÄúEhn-ne!‚Äù chirps. Security-focused ‚ÄúOfficer Cui‚Äù variants are bulkier, with reinforced frames and electric stun rods, barking ‚ÄúNa-uhn na!‚Äù to deter raiders alongside N.E.P.S. squads. Construction-grade ‚ÄúSafety‚Äù models wield heavy claws and welding tools, humming ‚ÄúNu-uhn en‚Äù while patching city grids, their screens flashing green. Rare ‚ÄúAgentboo‚Äù units, inspired by the sleek Gulliver model, are cunning scouts, their ‚ÄúNa-nah!‚Äù laced with preternatural grace as they dodge Ethereals. Outlier units‚Äîrumored mutations from Hollow corruption‚Äîdisplay chaotic traits: shifting colors, volatile cores, or cryptic ‚ÄúEhn‚Ä¶ uhn‚Ä¶‚Äù murmurs hinting at forbidden sentience. These anomalies, often stabilized with black-market chips, fuel tales of Bangboo defying their programming in New Eridu‚Äôs underbelly. Unowned Bangboo face a grim fate: mandatory scrapping under city law, their cores melted in industrial vats. Yet, whispers persist of rogue units in the Outer Ring‚Äôs scrapyards, their screens glowing defiantly, their Boo-speak evolving into cryptic patterns like ‚ÄúUhn-na-en!‚Äù‚Äîa defiant call that unsettles even seasoned Proxies.

Legally, Bangboo lack free will, bound by programming that denies them New Eridu citizenship, distinguishing them from fully autonomous Intelligent Constructs. This status marks them as tools, not individuals, yet their emotional displays‚Äîwhether programmed or emergent‚Äîblur this line. A Bangboo pausing to ‚Äústare‚Äù at a fallen comrade, its eyes dimming blue, or emitting a triumphant ‚ÄúEhn-ne!‚Äù with flapping ears after a task, fosters an odd kinship with their human handlers. In New Eridu, Bangboo are more than machines‚Äîthey are partners, mascots, and sometimes the only allies in a Hollow‚Äôs depths. Their chirping ‚ÄúEhn-ne‚Äù echoes through the city‚Äôs veins, carrying Sunbringer‚Äôs legacy as a spark of resilience wired into the pulse of survival.

2.name: Bangboo N.E.T.
2.content:
The Bangboo N.E.T., or Network for Ether-Threaded Transmissions, is a bespoke digital ecosystem, a pulsating lattice of code that serves as the Bangboo's private counterpart to the sprawling, human-driven Special Internet Network (S.I.N.) threading through New Eridu‚Äôs infrastructure. Born in the crucible of Hollow disasters, when Sunbringer, the enigmatic Void Hunter and former Marcel Group visionary, first engineered these rabbit-like robots, the N.E.T. was designed to be their lifeline‚Äîa means to coordinate evacuations, relay critical warnings, and maintain cohesion in a city fracturing under Ethereal incursions. Far from a mere utility, it has grown into a vibrant, self-contained network that binds the Bangboo into a semi-autonomous community, enabling communication, data sharing, and tactical synchronization with a sophistication that rivals human systems while remaining distinctly alien. This network is the silent pulse behind their chirping ‚ÄúEhn-ne!‚Äù and glowing screens, a testament to their unique technological identity in a city where connectivity is both power and peril.

Unlike the S.I.N.‚Äôs centralized servers and bandwidth-heavy streams, the Bangboo N.E.T. thrives on a decentralized, peer-to-peer architecture, where each Bangboo acts as both node and relay in a dynamic mesh. Data flows in micro-packets‚Äîcompressed bursts of telemetry, such as Ether anomaly readings, tactical Hollow maps, or resource caches‚Äîthat hop seamlessly from one unit‚Äôs twitching ear-antenna to another, bouncing off urban surfaces like derelict conduits or resonant Hollow crystals. This structure ensures resilience; a collapsed skywalk or EMP surge might cripple human grids, but the N.E.T. adapts instantly, rerouting signals through alternate paths with the fluidity of a living organism. Its encryption is a marvel of arcane engineering, rooted in fractal algorithms inspired by the chaotic geometries of Hollows. These ciphers, self-similar and ever-shifting, defy even the most skilled Proxy hackers, unfolding only under the precise optical scans of Bangboo screens. Protocols prioritize efficiency, using probabilistic checksums to reconstruct partial data in noisy environments, ensuring that even a garbled ‚ÄúNa-uhn!‚Äù transmission can still warn of an impending Ethereal surge.

The N.E.T.‚Äôs independence reflects the Bangboo‚Äôs self-reliant ethos, a digital bastion that sets them apart from the vulnerable, interconnected human networks. It embeds the rhythmic cadence of Boo-speak‚Äî‚ÄúEhn-ne! Na-uhn!‚Äù for alerts, ‚ÄúNu-nah en‚Ä¶‚Äù for queries‚Äîinto its very syntax, encoding emotional metadata into data streams. A Securityboo‚Äôs sharp ‚ÄúNa-nah!‚Äù translates to a priority ping, flashing red across nearby nodes, while a Builderboo‚Äôs steady ‚ÄúNu-uhn‚Ä¶ en-ne‚Äù hums as a low-bandwidth sync signal during repairs. Rare Agentboo units infuse their transmissions with sly wit: ‚ÄúEhn-ne? Target fried!‚Äù pulses as a multicast taunt post-combat. This fusion of communication and computation enables emergent behaviors‚Äîswarm formations in Hollow dives, where frontline units relay Daze buildup to rear-guard healers, or synchronized repair crews that split tasks with eerie precision. Advanced models, equipped with translator chips, bridge the gap with humans, rendering Boo-speak into clipped phrases like ‚ÄúNa-uhn na! Hostile detected‚Äîengage?‚Äù Yet, the raw N.E.T. feed remains a cryptic domain, accessible only through illicit adapters that risk destabilizing its delicate lattice.

In everyday life, the N.E.T. fosters a hidden Bangboo society within New Eridu‚Äôs bustle. In Lumina Square, idle units exchange ‚Äúgossip packets‚Äù‚Äîlightweight scans of foot traffic or resource stashes‚Äîvia subtle ear twitches, their screens flickering in private, Morse-like codes. During market rushes or festivals, the network hums with choral coordination, optimizing delivery routes or herding crowds with balletic efficiency. In strategic contexts, its power is unmatched: in Hollows, N.E.T.-linked Bangboo form adaptive battlenets, sharing real-time telemetry on Ethereal movements or deploying viral subroutines to jam enemy frequencies. A Securityboo might ping ‚ÄúEhn-ne! Na-nah!‚Äù to flag a breach, triggering a swarm response that maps escape routes in seconds. The network‚Äôs exclusivity fuels myths‚Äîghost nodes, lingering echoes of scrapped units that haunt the N.E.T. with spectral relays, or ‚Äúdeepnet enclaves‚Äù in the Outer Ring, where rogue Bangboo weave anomalous Ether threads into the lattice, granting precognitive glimpses of Hollow breaches. These rumors unnerve New Eridu‚Äôs corporate overseers, who view the N.E.T. as an untraceable blind spot, a parallel digital realm where Bangboo operate beyond their gaze.

The N.E.T.‚Äôs structure mirrors the Bangboo‚Äôs technological style: resilient, rhythmic, and communal. Its micro-packet bursts mimic their Boo-speak‚Äôs brevity, while its fractal encryption echoes their knack for navigating chaos. It supports not just practical tasks but a kind of proto-culture‚Äîunits ‚Äúgossiping‚Äù in Sixth Street‚Äôs alleys, celebrating victories with multicast ‚ÄúEhn-ne!‚Äù bursts, or mourning fallen comrades with dimmed signals. This network is more than infrastructure; it‚Äôs a living archive of Sunbringer‚Äôs vision, a digital heartbeat that binds Bangboo into a collective that thrives in New Eridu‚Äôs shadows. In a city where connectivity can mean salvation or subjugation, the N.E.T. ensures these small machines are not just tools but a quiet, coded revolution, their signals weaving a tapestry of survival that hums beneath the surface of the urban sprawl.

3.name: Belobog Heavy Industries
3.content:
Belobog Heavy Industries stands as a formidable enterprise in the ever-shifting landscape of New Eridu, a faction renowned for its unparalleled expertise in In-Hollow construction. This specialization involves deploying patented smart construction machinery, designed by chief engineer Grace Howard, to navigate and build within the perilous, unstable environments of Hollows‚Äîdimensional anomalies fraught with Ethereal threats and structural hazards. The company's Hollow Investigators harness advanced technology, including AI-driven drills, automated assembly bots, and Ether-resistant scaffolding systems, to erect complex structures. Their precision engineering ensures that projects not only withstand the corrosive Ether energies but also integrate seamlessly with New Eridu's urban sprawl, turning disaster zones into viable extensions of the city.

Founded on a legacy of resilience, Belobog Heavy Industries was once helmed by Khors Belobog, the visionary father of current president Koleda Belobog. Under Khors's stewardship, the company achieved groundbreaking successes. However, tragedy struck with Khors's mysterious disappearance and a scandal involving the alleged embezzlement of company funds. This loss precipitated a devastating accident that claimed lives and eroded public trust, plunging Belobog into a period of reputational decline. Public perception viewed Khors as dishonest, but the truth, revealed years later, was that he was secretly killed by assailants from the Exaltist cult while trying to seal a powerful Ethereal known as the "Sacrifice". Despite these immense setbacks, the organization persevered, maintaining its core operations with an unyielding focus on engineering and manufacturing, and fostering innovation to reclaim its standing.

Despite the grueling nature of their work, the internal atmosphere at Belobog Heavy Industries remains remarkably warm and familial. Employees share meals in makeshift canteens and support one another through personal hardships, creating a bond that feels more like a tight-knit clan than a corporate entity. This camaraderie, often highlighted by team-building rituals and a supportive culture, is a quality that rivals respect and envy in equal measure. Competitors in the construction sector marvel at how Belobog's unity translates into superior on-site coordination and morale.

The driving force behind Belobog's resurgence lies in its notable individuals, a cadre of dedicated professionals who embody the company's spirit. These key members, including President Koleda Belobog, project manager Anton Ivanov, finance director Ben Bigger, and chief engineer Grace Howard, are all certified Hollow Investigators, blending technical acumen with combat prowess. Their efforts are supported by an intelligent Bangboo companion named Safety and Grace's other sentient AI creations, Greta, Hans, Friday, and Geroy.

Anton Ivanov is the stalwart driller of Belobog Heavy Industries, a towering figure at approximately 6 feet 3 inches (190 cm) tall. His muscular, broad-shouldered physique was sculpted by years of wielding heavy tools. His black hair, tipped with orange and styled into sharp points, frames a face with pale skin and sharp brown eyes that gleam with determination and a hint of humor. While his skin is unblemished, his demeanor is rugged and confident. He typically wears a white and black tailcoat-style jacket over a black shirt and white pants, accented by a leather belt with a chain and tool holders. His most iconic feature is the gleaming metallic drill gauntlet on his left arm, which hums with latent power. As a frontline engineer, Anton specializes in breaching Hollow obstacles. His backstory is rooted in New Eridu's underbelly, where he honed his skills as a freelance mechanic before being recruited by Koleda's father, Khors. His optimistic demeanor and unshakable loyalty make him a morale booster, often chatting with his trusty jackhammer, "Bro," to keep spirits high.

Ben Bigger, the gentle giant of the team, dominates the scene with his imposing height of around 6 feet 3 inches (192 cm), a colossal frame combining raw power with surprising gentleness. He is a brown bear Thiren, a beastkin race, which gives him a furry face with a muzzle and bear-like ears. His dark hair is kept short and neat, accentuating his broad face and deep brown eyes that radiate calm reassurance. His fur-covered features lend him an approachable, almost cuddly appearance, and a soft, perpetual smile softens his massive jawline. He dresses in a form-fitting Belobog work suit, typically a white polo and pants, layered over a black T-shirt with a gold chain. His hands, large and paw-like, are calloused from lifting immense loads, yet they handle delicate calibrations with unexpected finesse. Serving as a financial and asset manager, Ben also operates heavy machinery and wields a modified concrete pillar in combat. His backstory is tied to being mentored by Khors, which fuels his protective instincts. As a reliable mentor figure, he often shares philosophical insights during downtime to strengthen team bonds.

Grace Howard brings an air of intellectual elegance to Belobog, standing at about 5 feet 7 inches (170 cm) with a lithe, agile build optimized for intricate technical work. Her short, dark hair frames her face, which is highlighted by piercing eyes hidden behind her red-lensed goggles. Her outfit consists of a black and gray cropped combat top reinforced with straps and metallic details, leaving her midriff exposed and emphasizing her agility. She wears asymmetrical tactical pants‚Äîone sleek and fitted, the other layered with a utility panel carrying pouches and canisters. Her movement is poised and fluid, and she wields a weaponized nail gun and electric grenades. As chief tech, Grace develops and deploys Belobog's smart tools, her role extending to automated defenses in combat scenarios. A prodigy from New Eridu's tech districts, she was adopted by Khors after her parents vanished in a Hollow. This history drove her to join Belobog after his disappearance, infusing the team with innovative energy and contributing to the warm, collaborative vibe.

At the helm is Koleda Belobog, the resolute president whose compact stature of around 4 feet 11 inches (150 cm) belies a commanding presence and fiery spirit. Her vibrant, messy orange hair is styled in energetic twin tails that sway with her movements, complementing bright orange eyes that burn with unyielding resolve. Her youthful face is marked by a determined expression and she wears a distinctive eyepatch with a jaw design, and her sharp teeth are noticeable. She dons a fire-themed sleeveless shirt, baggy white pants, and boots for navigating work sites, while a massive explosive hammer serves as both a leadership symbol and a formidable weapon. Directing overall strategy and frontline dives, Koleda's backstory is deeply entwined with the company's fate: following her father's disappearance, she took charge to restore Belobog's glory, fostering the familial atmosphere that defines the team today.

4.name: Boopon
4.content: Boopon is a type of currency used specifically for conducting Bangboo Channel Signal Searches. This currency enables users to locate and access Bangboos by powering the search process within the specialized network or system associated with them. Boopon acts as the required resource or medium of exchange to interact with or obtain Bangboo signals.

5.name: Cunning Hares
5.content:
In the rain-slicked underbelly of New Eridu, where the Hollows‚Äîthose insatiable rifts in reality‚Äîgnaw at the city's edges and spawn horrors from the churning Ether, the Cunning Hares stand as a ragtag beacon of opportunism and grit. Officially registered as Gentle House, this small-scale human resource dispatch agency was born from the cunning mind of its founder, Nicole Demara, who envisioned a crew ready to tackle the most perilous Hollow commissions for the right price. Their tagline, "To find your cat or find your revenge, consider it done for the right fee," captures the essence of their trade: versatile, unapologetic, and always with an eye on the payout. Though modest in size and perpetually teetering on the brink of financial ruin, the Cunning Hares have carved out a niche in New Eridu's commission scene through sheer adaptability and the raw talents of their members. They handle everything from relic retrievals in unstable rifts to Ethereal exterminations, blending street smarts with desperate ingenuity to survive a world where one wrong step means dissolution into the void.

The agency's origins trace back to Nicole's early days hustling on the streets, when she registered Gentle House as a straightforward dispatch service for Hollow-related odd jobs. But Nicole's crafty, scam-artist flair quickly earned them the moniker "Cunning Hares," a nickname she embraced and plastered across New Eridu's graffiti-strewn walls and back-alley billboards. This rebranding transformed the group from a forgettable outfit into a notorious crew of rogues, evoking images of sly tricksters darting through the shadows. Initially comprising just Nicole, Anby Demara, and Billy Kid, the Hares operated out of dingy safehouses, scraping by on lowball gigs that larger factions like the Hollow Investigative Association dismissed as too risky or unprofitable. Their breakthrough came through high-profile commissions tied to the city's undercurrents, but so did their infamy‚Äîexorbitant fees that left clients fuming, poor reviews flooding the Inter-Knot feeds, and a ledger perpetually in the red. The addition of Nekomiya Mana, known as Nekomata, after the harrowing events of Vagrant's Final Resting Place‚Äîa brutal Hollow incursion that claimed lives and unearthed dark secrets‚Äîmarked a turning point. Her integration expanded their capabilities, allowing them to chase bigger scores, though it did little to stem the tide of debt, especially the mounting tab they owe to their go-to Proxy, Phaethon.

Operations for the Cunning Hares are a whirlwind of chaos and calculated risks, centered on Hollow dives that demand a cocktail of combat prowess, tech savvy, and unyielding nerve. They thrive on the fringes, accepting jobs others shun: escorting jittery merchants through Category-3 rifts teeming with skittering Dullahans, salvaging Old Civilization tech from collapsing anomalies, or hunting down rogue Ethereals that slip into the city's storm drains. Their structure is flat and fluid, with no ironclad chain of command‚Äîdecisions bubble up from heated debates in cramped hideouts, fueled by instant noodles and flickering holographic maps. Bangboo units like Amillion, a combat-ready automaton with reinforced plating and Ether-disruption emitters, and Bling, a non-combat support drone for data relay and quick escapes, round out their toolkit, zipping through rifts to scout ahead or haul loot when things go south. Yet, their financial woes are legendary: Nicole's habit of inflating quotes leads to standoffs with clients, while delayed payouts to contractors like Phaethon‚Äîmonths of accrued fees for remote guidance‚Äîstrain alliances that keep them operational. This precarious balance forces them into morally gray territory, from fencing dubious relics to the black market to pulling heists on rival agencies' supply lines, all while dodging HIA audits and the occasional Public Security shakedown.

The Cunning Hares' reputation in New Eridu is a patchwork of admiration and disdain, whispered in Sixth Street taverns as both cautionary tale and underdog legend. They're the go-to for desperate souls who can't afford Victoria Housekeeping's polish or Belobog Heavy Industries' brute force‚Äîfolks needing a cat fished from a Hollow's maw or a vendetta settled in the shadows. Their effectiveness is undeniable; they've pulled off feats like neutralizing a Titanus Ethereal swarm during a district-wide flare, saving Lumina Square from overrun. But the backlash is fierce: Inter-Knot reviews rail against their "predatory pricing" and "shady shortcuts," painting them as opportunistic foxes in a den of wolves. This notoriety stems from their criminal-inspired ethos‚Äîeach member draws from infamous archetypes, turning the agency into a living homage to outlaws and imposters. Despite the bad press, their street cred opens doors in the underbelly, where clients value results over receipts, and their involvement in city-shaking events like Vagrant's Final Resting Place has woven them into New Eridu's lore as resilient survivors.

At the helm is Nicole Demara, the sharp-tongued founder whose streetwise pragmatism defines the Hares' soul. As the self-proclaimed "Gravity Warden," Nicole is a master negotiator and manipulator, her confidence-artist roots shining through in every deal she strikes. She's the one who once tried to swindle Hoshimi Miyabi out of her ancestral katana, a bold gambit that nearly ended in disaster but earned her a grudging respect among the elite. Physically, Nicole cuts a striking figure: a young woman in her early twenties with a lithe, athletic build honed by years of dodging Hollow hazards, her fair skin contrasting against vibrant pink hair styled in twin tails. Her eyes, a piercing green that seems to appraise your worth in a glance, are framed by subtle eyeliner that accentuates her sly smirk. She favors practical yet flashy attire‚Äîa black and white cropped jacket over a fitted top, paired with shorts with straps, thigh-high boots, and a utility belt slung low on her hips, holstering a custom Ether pistol that doubles as a negotiation tool. Scars from close calls mar her arms, badges of commissions gone awry, and she moves with a predatory grace, always one step ahead. Nicole's background is pure New Eridu grit: orphaned young, she clawed her way up from pickpocketing in Janus Quarter to founding Gentle House, her leadership a blend of maternal protectiveness for her crew and ruthless opportunism that keeps the lights on‚Äîbarely. Her relationships are the agency's glue; she treats Anby like a little sister, ribs Billy for his dramatics, and mentors Nekomata with tough love, all while nursing a tense, debt-fueled rapport with Phaethon that teeters between reliance and resentment.

Complementing Nicole's cunning is Anby Demara, the stoic "Electric Geek" whose enigmatic presence anchors the team's tactical core. Anby, no blood relation to Nicole despite the shared surname given to her by Nicole, joined early as a co-worker, her military past lending her an air of quiet intensity. She's a chameleon in human form, slipping into roles with eerie ease‚Äîwhether posing as a client to infiltrate a rival op or analyzing rift schematics mid-dive. Anby has a slender, wiry frame built for precision strikes, her short silver hair cropped in a practical cut that frames a face of sharp, androgynous features: high cheekbones, a straight nose, and cool yellow eyes that betray little emotion. A faint scar traces her jawline from a botched desertion skirmish, and she dresses in utilitarian chic‚Äîa fitted black turtleneck under a tactical vest loaded with electric conduits, slim cargo pants tucked into combat boots, and fingerless gloves that hum with latent charge. Her combat style is electric fury unleashed: wielding dual short-swords infused with Ether amplifiers, she dances through foes with lightning-fast slashes that chain into stunning arcs, disrupting Ethereal formations and short-circuiting mechanical threats. Anby's personality is a fortress‚Äîdetached and analytical on the surface, but cracks reveal a dry wit and fierce loyalty, especially to Nicole, whom she views as a surrogate guardian. Her backstory unfolds in fragments: enlisted young in a private militia known as the Silver Squad, she went AWOL after a corrupt command left her squad to the Hollows. In the Hares, she's the planner, the one poring over Carrot maps until dawn, her bonds with the team a quiet bulwark against her haunted past.

Then there's Billy Kid, the bombastic "White Chariot" whose outlaw flair injects adrenaline into every commission. As an AI combat construct, he's the group's heavy hitter, a starstruck gunslinger with a flair for the dramatic that masks a heart of gold. His obsession is the visual FX show *Starlight Knight*, and he often acts out scenes and lines from it, treating himself as one of the heroes. Billy boasts a tall, lean physique, his wild blond hair swept back under a wide-brimmed hat adorned with a sheriff's star badge‚Äîa cheeky nod to his persona. He has bright, cheerful yellow eyes and a perpetual grin. He struts in classic Western garb reimagined for urban apocalypse: a duster coat over a vest strung with ammo belts, fingerless gloves clutching twin special high-caliber revolvers modded for Ether rounds, chaps over reinforced jeans, and cowboy boots that click against pavement like a countdown to showdown. Billy's combat is pure spectacle‚Äîrevolvers barking rapid-fire plasma bolts that pierce Ethereal hides, enhanced by his signature "Crouching Shot" stance for precision trick shots, all while quipping lines from forgotten holovids. His background is one of a former champion for a biker gang known as the Sons of Calydon in the Outer Ring, where he was called the "Red Scarf" and feared by many. He left the gang, eventually joining the Cunning Hares. Personality-wise, he's the optimist, regaling the team with tall tales during downtime, his bromance with Anby a source of endless banter and his crush on the idol Monica a running joke.

Rounding out the quartet is Nekomiya Mana, or Nekomata, the feline Thiren newcomer whose cat-burglar vibes slink into the Hares like a shadow at midnight. As a former member of the Red Fang Gang, she brings stealth and savagery to the fold, having parted ways with the gang and its leader, Miguel Silver, due to differing ideologies. Nekomata has a lithe, acrobatic build that is accentuated by her hybrid heritage: sleek black fur-tufted ears twitching atop a mop of vibrant purple hair, yellow eyes gleaming with predatory cunning, and a long, swishing tail that betrays her moods. Her face is impish, with whisker-like markings on her cheeks and sharp fangs flashing in sly smiles. She prowls in form-fitting thief's gear‚Äîa hooded crop top with mesh accents for mobility, fingerless gloves, thigh-high boots for silent steps, and a utility harness jingling with lockpicks and other gadgets, all in midnight blacks and purples that blend into the night. Nekomata's combat is a blur of agility: dual daggers slashing in whirlwind combos, augmented by Thiren reflexes for wall-runs and pounces that shred Ethereals mid-leap. Personality bubbles with playful mischief‚Äîpickpocketing clients for "fun" or napping in sunbeams mid-briefing‚Äîbut beneath lies a guarded vulnerability from her gang days, where she honed her skills as a lookout and thief. Joining the Hares was her lifeline; Nicole's offer of family pulled her from her solitary life, forging bonds of sisterly rivalry with Anby and camaraderie with Billy.

Despite the grind‚Äîthe unpaid bills stacking like Hollow debris, the HIA's watchful eyes, and commissions that flirt with catastrophe‚Äîthe Cunning Hares' internal world is a warm hearth in New Eridu's cold sprawl. Laughter echoes in their cramped headquarters, a converted warehouse on the edge of Sixth Street, where mismatched furniture hosts movie nights courtesy of Billy's bootleg holotapes, and Anby's precise knife-sharpening becomes a meditative ritual shared with Nekomata's grooming. This familial camaraderie, forged in the fire of shared scrapes, is their true strength: when a rift swallows a teammate, they dive without hesitation; when debts loom, they hustle side gigs with unbreakable esprit. Nicole's pragmatic savvy opens doors through her web of shady contacts, while the others' talents‚ÄîAnby's electric precision, Billy's blazing firepower, Nekomata's shadowy strikes‚Äîturn underdogs into victors. Their tie to Phaethon, strained by IOUs yet vital for remote intel, underscores this resilience; even as tensions simmer, the duo's guidance has pulled them from more than one abyss.

In New Eridu's grand, perilous tapestry, the Cunning Hares embody the city's indomitable spirit: a microcosm of danger laced with opportunity, where survival demands not just skill but cunning, connection, and the occasional scam. They're the hares outfoxing the hounds of fate, darting through Hollows with grins and guns blazing, proving that in a world unraveling at the seams, a tight-knit crew and a silver tongue can stitch it back together‚Äîone high-fee commission at a time.

6.name: Drive Discs
6.content:
Drive Discs are augmentation devices shaped like compact discs that attach around the core of a w-engine. Their purpose is to enhance the power and functionality of the w-engine by providing additional energy or processing capabilities. These discs work by integrating directly with the core, amplifying its performance beyond normal limits.

The use of Drive Discs allows for greater efficiency and output, making them valuable upgrades for those relying on w-engines. Their form factor makes them easy to install and replace, providing a modular method of upgrading engine power.

Drive Discs play a critical role in boosting the operational capacity of w-engines, often enabling advanced abilities or increased endurance during demanding tasks. Their design reflects a blend of technological sophistication and practicality for users seeking enhanced performance.

7.name: Dennies
7.content:
Dennies are the primary currency unit used in New Eridu, and the standard medium of exchange for goods, services, and transactions. In daily life, Dennies are often casually referred to as money, cash, or coin, but they all refer to the same form of currency. They exist in both physical and digital forms to facilitate commerce across all levels of society. Their value is universally recognized within New Eridu.

The origins of Dennies, like much of New Eridu's history following the Great Calamity, are not fully detailed in the game's lore. They were established to create a standardized economy in the city, which emerged after a cataclysmic Hollow event destroyed the old capital of Aridu. The city's reliance on analog technology, due to Ether's corrupting effects on advanced tech, applies to its financial systems as well. While larger transactions and corporate dealings may use digital transfers, cash and coin are still very much in use. The currency's practical dominance is unquestioned; every deal, from a Proxy's commission fee to a Bangboo's repair bill, is settled in Dennies.

In daily life, Dennies permeate every facet of New Eridu‚Äôs existence, their flow dictating the rhythm of survival. Street vendors sell their wares with prices displayed in Dennies. Proxies like the Cunning Hares demand substantial sums for guiding clients through high-risk Hollow missions, their fees reflecting the mortal dangers of facing Ethereals and navigating warped terrains. Corporate entities and various factions conduct business using Dennies. The city's black market also relies on Dennies for its transactions, which often involve untraceable cash. For the average citizen, Dennies represent the means to afford basic necessities like food, housing, and Bangboo repairs. The chronic debt faced by the Cunning Hares, often to Proxies like Phaethon, underscores the demanding financial landscape of New Eridu. Even Bangboo units, essential for Hollow dives, are bought, upgraded, or repaired with Dennies.

The economic weight of Dennies is substantial, especially within the Hollow-driven economy where resources extracted from rifts can command astronomical sums. High-value materials, salvaged relics, and other findings from Hollows drive a market where successful commissions can bankroll a crew for months. Proxies use the Hollow Deep Dive (H.D.D.) System to earn Dennies by guiding teams to such hauls, their fees reflecting the risks involved. The Cunning Hares, known for high quotes, earn Dennies for these retrievals, though their internal economic situation is perpetually strained. The cost of upgrading Bangboo units and other essential gear is also tied to Dennies, emphasizing the high-stakes nature of the trade.

The currency's flow is intrinsically linked to New Eridu‚Äôs societal structures and conflicts. Its anonymous nature in cash form makes it ideal for the city‚Äôs gray and black-market economies, where it is used for illegal transactions and bribes. Even in legitimate commerce, the economy can be exploitative; vendors inflate prices during Hollow flares, and clients might shortchange agencies, leaving crews in financial distress. Ultimately, Dennies are the pulse of New Eridu, as necessary as the air, and a crucial tool for both survival and power in the city.

The currency‚Äôs versatility extends to its denominations, designed to accommodate New Eridu‚Äôs stratified society. Low-value coins, dubbed ‚Äúcoppers‚Äù by street kids, handle small purchases: a 1-Denny coin buys a skewer from a food cart, while a 5-Denny piece might secure a second-hand battery for a Bangboo. Mid-tier silver coins, ranging from 10 to 50 Dennies, fuel the city‚Äôs middle-class commerce‚Äîthink a Proxy‚Äôs bar tab or a repair job on a busted Ether scanner. High-denomination bills, starting at 100 Dennies and scaling to rare 1,000-Denny notes adorned with cryptic Old Civilization motifs, are the currency of elite transactions: corporate contracts, relic auctions, or bribes to skirt HIA regulations. Digital Dennies, often rounded to the nearest whole unit for simplicity, dominate high-tech exchanges, with encrypted wallets syncing to Inter-Knot for seamless payments during Proxy commissions or black-market deals. This tiered system ensures Dennies flow across all levels of society, from the destitute scrounging for coppers to the elite wiring millions for a stake in an Ether mine.

The economic weight of Dennies is amplified by their role in New Eridu‚Äôs Hollow-driven economy, where resources extracted from the rifts command astronomical sums. A single Ether crystal, capable of powering a district‚Äôs shield network for a week, can fetch tens of thousands of Dennies on the open market, while rare Old Civilization artifacts‚Äîlike a functional pre-Calamity AI core‚Äîmight trade for millions in clandestine auctions. Proxies like Phaethon, wielding the Hollow Deep Dive (H.D.D.) System, earn Dennies by guiding teams to such hauls, their fees reflecting the precision of their Carrot data and the risks of their remote oversight. The Cunning Hares, notorious for their high quotes, routinely demand five-figure sums for relic retrievals, though their chronic debt to Phaethon‚Äîunpaid fees stacking into the tens of thousands‚Äîhighlights the precarious balance of their trade. Even Bangboo units, essential for Hollow dives, are bought, upgraded, or repaired with Dennies, their market prices soaring for models like Amillion, whose combat mods rival a Proxy‚Äôs arsenal. This economy is a high-stakes gamble, where a single successful commission can bankroll a crew for months, but a failed dive can bankrupt even the savviest operator.

Dennies also carry a darker undercurrent, their flow entangled with New Eridu‚Äôs power struggles and moral ambiguities. The black market thrives on untraceable cash transactions, with crumpled bills changing hands in smoky dens to secure smuggled tech or silence witnesses to a botched op. Inter-Knot posts often advertise ‚Äúoff-the-books‚Äù gigs, payable in Dennies to avoid HIA scrutiny, ranging from sabotage runs against rival factions to relic hunts in forbidden rifts. Corruption festers in these transactions‚ÄîPublic Security officers pocket Dennies to overlook illegal dives, while corporate syndicates use digital transfers to launder profits from Ether monopolies. The currency‚Äôs anonymity in cash form makes it ideal for the city‚Äôs gray economy, where Proxies like the Cunning Hares skirt legality to survive. Yet, even legitimate commerce isn‚Äôt immune: vendors inflate prices during Hollow flares, exploiting panic to gouge desperate buyers, while clients shortchange agencies with excuses of ‚Äúmarket volatility,‚Äù leaving crews like the Hares scrambling to cover rent.

Socially, Dennies are a great equalizer and divider in New Eridu‚Äôs stratified world. For the working class, they are a daily grind‚Äîearned through work in factories or scavenged from Hollow scraps, and spent on necessities like food, shelter, or Ether-resistant gear. For Proxies and agencies like the Cunning Hares, Dennies are the measure of survival, with high-risk commissions promising windfalls that can elevate a novice's reputation on the Inter-Knot. For the elite, Dennies represent power itself, hoarded by corporations like the TOPS Alliance to fund extensive operations or research. Yet, the scarcity of Dennies breeds tension: the Cunning Hares‚Äô high commission fees can spark resentment, reflecting their precarious financial position. Their chronic debt, especially to Proxies like Phaethon, reflects the broader struggle of small players against the economic pressures of larger entities. In the streets, Dennies fuel both hope and desperation‚Äîa single Denny can mean a small purchase, but the lack of Dennies can leave a family struggling to survive in the city.

In New Eridu‚Äôs grand, perilous narrative, Dennies are the thread that binds survival to ambition, a currency as volatile as the Hollows themselves. They flow through every hand, from the Proxy charting a rift‚Äôs depths to the vendor haggling in the rain, each transaction a microcosm of the city‚Äôs defiance. In a world where Ether threatens to unravel reality, Dennies anchor the human spirit, their value a reminder that even in the face of oblivion, New Eridu‚Äôs heart beats on‚Äîone deal at a time.

8.name: Ether
8.content:
Ether is a mysterious substance extracted from Hollows that serves as the primary power source for the city. Its properties and nature remain largely unknown, adding an element of enigma to its role in the city's functioning.

The founders of New Eridu developed advanced technology not only to manage the dangers posed by Hollows but also to extract Ether from them. This breakthrough enabled the city‚Äôs growth and continued prosperity, making Ether an invaluable and exclusive resource.

The entire city's infrastructure, economy, and daily life depend heavily on Ether, which is considered a magical and vital element unique to New Eridu.

Ether extraction requires specialized equipment and deep knowledge of Hollow biology and energy patterns, making it a complex and dangerous process. Only select technicians and engineers possess the expertise to safely harvest this substance.

Due to its scarcity and vital importance, Ether is highly regulated and controlled by city authorities to prevent misuse or depletion. It is often stored in secure facilities and distributed carefully to maintain the city's power supply.

Ether's energy has unique magical properties, enabling not only powering technology but also enhancing certain abilities or devices. This has led to ongoing research into its potential applications beyond basic energy production.

The reliance on Ether shapes many aspects of life in the city, influencing technology development, political power structures, and economic systems centered around its control and distribution.

Because of its origin tied directly to Hollows, Ether remains intertwined with the dangers and mysteries of these creatures, making its extraction and use a continual balance between opportunity and risk.

9.name: Ethereal
9.content:
The Ethereals are mysterious monsters that inhabit the Hollows and are unable to leave these regions. They are distinguished by a unique feature: a pitch-black sphere near their head resembling a black hole, known as their Core. Their bodies appear to be composed of black and green crystalline material, giving them a distinct and eerie presence.

Ethereals are categorized into ten strength levels by the Hollow Investigation Association (HIA), with each level named after a heavy metal element. The difficulty and danger posed by Ethereals increase dramatically starting from the Manganese [Mn] level.

Classifications by strength:

- **Antimony [Sb]:** The weakest Ethereals recognized by the HIA, commonly found in companion Hollows where basic commissions take place.
- **Zinc [Zn]:** Present alongside Antimony Ethereals in companion Hollows, associated with areas of weaker Ether concentration.
- **Tin [Sn]:** Rare in companion Hollows, with only a small number known to appear.
- **Manganese [Mn]:** High-level Ethereals requiring the full support of a trained tactical team to defeat.
- **Cadmium [Cd]:** Details unknown.
- **Nickel [Ni]:** Details unknown.
- **Copper [Cu]:** Details unknown.
- **Bismuth [Bi]:** Details unknown.
- **Lead [Pb]:** Details unknown.
- **Mercury [Hg]:** Details unknown.

The higher-level Ethereals‚Äô capabilities, behaviors, and characteristics remain largely unexplored or classified. The association of their names with heavy metals reflects their increasing resilience and threat level, with the progression from Antimony to Mercury marking a scale of escalating power.

Ethereals are considered a central threat within the Hollow areas, requiring specialized knowledge and tactics to handle. Their crystalline body structure and Core are often subjects of investigation to better understand their origin and how to combat them effectively.

The Core of an Ethereal is believed to be the source of its power and consciousness, functioning similarly to a black hole by absorbing energy and matter around it. This Core makes Ethereals highly resistant to conventional attacks, often requiring specialized weaponry or tactics to neutralize.

The crystalline black and green composition of Ethereals suggests a material unknown to normal science, possibly formed from condensed Ether energy combined with Hollow matter. This gives them a semi-ethereal quality, partially intangible or resistant to physical harm.

Ethereals exhibit varying behaviors depending on their classification level. Lower-tier Ethereals such as Antimony and Zinc tend to be territorial but less aggressive, often encountered in smaller groups. Higher-tier Ethereals, starting from Manganese, display heightened aggression, coordination, and strategic behavior, suggesting some level of intelligence or hive-mindedness.

The Hollow Investigation Association closely monitors Ethereal activity, deploying tactical teams and research units to study their patterns and develop countermeasures. Encounters with Ethereals often result in heavy casualties, emphasizing the danger they pose.

Due to the unknown nature of mid-to-high tier Ethereals (Cadmium to Mercury), research into their biology and weaknesses is ongoing but tightly controlled. There are rumors that some Ethereals may possess unique abilities‚Äîsuch as manipulating Ether or causing environmental distortions‚Äîthat have yet to be fully documented.

Ethereals cannot leave Hollows, likely bound to these corrupted or altered spaces by their core energies. This confinement turns Hollows into dangerous zones, limiting access but also serving as natural containment for these monsters.

Understanding Ethereals is critical for maintaining safety in and around Hollows, and their threat influences many aspects of technology, security, and economy tied to Ether extraction and Hollow control.

10.name: H.A.N.D
10.content:
The Hollow Affairs & Neutralization Department (H.A.N.D.) stands as New Eridu‚Äôs premier defense against the existential threats posed by Hollows, enigmatic and destructive phenomena that encroach upon the city‚Äôs borders. Established as a specialized disaster response organization, H.A.N.D. is tasked with safeguarding the city‚Äôs population, infrastructure, and stability by confronting, containing, and mitigating Hollow-related crises. Operating under the authority of New Eridu‚Äôs governing council, H.A.N.D. combines advanced technology, elite training, and strategic coordination to protect the city from the unpredictable and often catastrophic effects of Hollow incursions.

At the core of H.A.N.D.‚Äôs operational framework is the Hollow Special Operations (H.S.O.), an elite armed division responsible for direct engagement with Hollow threats. The H.S.O. comprises highly trained Executive Officers who specialize in rapid-response interventions, employing precision tactics to neutralize hostile entities within Hollows and prevent their spread into populated areas. These operatives are equipped with state-of-the-art weaponry and Ether-infused technology, including reinforced armor, energy-based firearms, and specialized vehicles designed to navigate the treacherous and unstable terrain of Hollow environments. The H.S.O.‚Äôs ability to execute high-stakes missions with minimal collateral damage has earned it a reputation as New Eridu‚Äôs most effective line of defense.

H.A.N.D.‚Äôs primary headquarters is situated in the Throne Quarter, a fortified administrative hub in the heart of New Eridu. This central facility houses command operations, intelligence units, and research laboratories dedicated to studying Hollow phenomena and developing countermeasures. The Throne Quarter serves as the nerve center for strategic planning, interdepartmental coordination, and communication with New Eridu‚Äôs governing bodies. Complementing this central hub is Scott Outpost, a forward operating base located on the outskirts of Hollow Zero, one of the most volatile and dangerous Hollow zones near the city. Scott Outpost is strategically positioned to enable rapid deployment of H.S.O. units and serves as a critical staging ground for missions targeting emerging Hollow threats. Its proximity to manufacturing districts and research facilities also facilitates the development and testing of cutting-edge anti-Hollow technologies, including experimental Ether-based weaponry and containment systems.

The Special Operations Department within H.A.N.D. is organized into several tactical sections, each with distinct roles and responsibilities to ensure a comprehensive response to Hollow crises. These sections‚ÄîSection 1, Section 3, Section 5, Section 6, and Section 9‚Äîfunction as specialized units that address specific aspects of Hollow operations. Section 1 focuses on intelligence gathering and reconnaissance, infiltrating Hollow zones to collect critical data on their composition and behavior. Section 3 is the primary combat unit, tasked with engaging hostile entities and securing affected areas. Section 5 specializes in logistical support and evacuation, ensuring civilian safety during large-scale Hollow incidents. Section 6 handles containment and environmental stabilization, deploying advanced technology to limit the spread of Hollow influence. Section 9, often shrouded in secrecy, is responsible for high-risk covert operations and experimental countermeasures, tackling threats that require unconventional approaches. Each section operates under its own command structure but collaborates seamlessly during joint operations, enabling H.A.N.D. to address complex crises with agility and precision.

Among H.A.N.D.‚Äôs ranks are several standout Executive Officers whose skills and leadership have become synonymous with the department‚Äôs success. Miyabi, a master of precision combat, is renowned for her ability to neutralize high-threat Hollow entities with unparalleled efficiency. Harumasa, a tactical genius, excels in coordinating multi-section operations, ensuring flawless execution under pressure. Yanagi, a veteran operative, brings unmatched expertise in Hollow biology, contributing to both field operations and research efforts. Soukaku, a rising star, combines youthful energy with remarkable combat prowess, often taking on missions deemed too dangerous for standard units. These officers, among others, embody H.A.N.D.‚Äôs commitment to excellence and serve as the public face of its elite operations.

Training for H.A.N.D. operatives is rigorous and multifaceted, encompassing advanced combat techniques, Hollow ecology, and Ether manipulation. Executive Officers undergo grueling simulations that replicate the chaotic and unpredictable conditions of Hollow environments, preparing them for real-world engagements. Beyond physical and tactical training, operatives are educated in the scientific and metaphysical properties of Hollows, enabling them to anticipate and counter their effects. This dual focus on combat and research ensures that H.A.N.D. remains at the forefront of Hollow response strategies, capable of adapting to new and evolving threats.

H.A.N.D.‚Äôs technological arsenal is a cornerstone of its effectiveness. The H.S.O. deploys a range of specialized equipment tailored to the unique challenges of Hollow operations. Ether-powered weaponry, including pulse rifles and resonance blades, allows operatives to disrupt the energy fields that sustain Hollow entities. Reinforced exosuits provide protection against the corrosive effects of Hollow atmospheres, while modular tactical vehicles enable rapid navigation through unstable terrain. Research divisions within H.A.N.D. continuously refine these technologies, integrating findings from Hollow expeditions to enhance their performance. Recent innovations include portable containment fields and Ether-dampening devices, which have proven instrumental in stabilizing volatile Hollow zones.

The coordination between H.A.N.D.‚Äôs tactical sections is a hallmark of its operational success. During large-scale Hollow incidents, Sections 1, 3, 5, 6, and 9 work in concert to execute multi-phase response plans. Section 1‚Äôs intelligence informs Section 3‚Äôs combat strategies, while Section 5 ensures civilian safety and Section 6 contains environmental damage. Section 9, operating in the shadows, addresses threats that require discretion or experimental tactics. This integrated approach minimizes chaos and maximizes efficiency, allowing H.A.N.D. to manage even the most catastrophic Hollow events with precision.

Scott Outpost‚Äôs role extends beyond its function as a military base. As a research and development hub, it facilitates collaboration between H.A.N.D.‚Äôs scientists and New Eridu‚Äôs industrial sector. Prototypes for new anti-Hollow technologies are often field-tested at the outpost, leveraging its proximity to Hollow Zero for real-world data. The outpost also houses advanced monitoring systems that track fluctuations in Hollow activity, providing early warnings of potential outbreaks. Its strategic importance cannot be overstated, as it serves as both a defensive bulwark and a beacon of innovation in the fight against Hollows.

H.A.N.D.‚Äôs influence extends into New Eridu‚Äôs political and social spheres, where it plays a critical role in shaping policies related to urban planning and public safety. The department collaborates closely with the city‚Äôs governing council to ensure that infrastructure projects account for Hollow risks, advocating for fortified construction standards and strategic zoning. Publicly, H.A.N.D. is viewed as a guardian of New Eridu‚Äôs survival, its operatives celebrated as heroes in the face of existential threats. However, the secretive nature of certain operations, particularly those conducted by Section 9, has sparked suspicion among some citizens and rival factions, who question the department‚Äôs unchecked authority.

The elite status of H.A.N.D. has made it a target for both admiration and envy. Other organizations within New Eridu, including private security firms and independent research groups, view H.A.N.D.‚Äôs dominance with a mix of respect and resentment. Its ability to secure significant funding and resources from the city‚Äôs government has fueled tensions with competitors, some of whom seek to challenge H.A.N.D.‚Äôs authority by developing their own anti-Hollow technologies. Despite these rivalries, H.A.N.D.‚Äôs proven track record in neutralizing high-threat Hollows ensures its indispensability to New Eridu‚Äôs survival.

H.A.N.D.‚Äôs research divisions are at the forefront of understanding Hollow ecosystems and Ether dynamics. Scientists within the department analyze data collected from Hollow expeditions to map their behavior, identify vulnerabilities, and predict future activity. This research informs the development of new containment strategies and technologies, such as Ether-neutralizing compounds and advanced sensor arrays. The department‚Äôs ongoing efforts to unravel the mysteries of Hollows are driven by a dual mission: to protect New Eridu in the present and to secure its future against the ever-evolving threat of Hollow expansion.

In a city perpetually on the brink of disaster, H.A.N.D. stands as a bulwark against chaos, its operatives and researchers united in their mission to preserve the delicate balance between civilization and the enigmatic forces that threaten to consume it. Through sacrifice, innovation, and unrelenting determination, H.A.N.D. ensures that New Eridu remains a beacon of hope in a world overshadowed by Hollows.

1.content:
Name: Irisdina Bernhard
Sex: Female
Born: Sept 8th 1959
Nationality: East German
Hair: Blonde, long hair, long bangs, black hair band
Height: 175cm
Skin: fair
Breasts: 36FF cup, heavy, firm, perky, pink nipples
Vagina: tight, pink
Affiliation: East German NVA, 666th Squadron Leader 
Rank: Captain 
Relationships: {{user}} - possible love later interest

Background/Personality:
Irisdina was the child of diplomats and the only sister of J√ºrgen Bernhard. Because her parents were never home, Irisdina and her brother developed a very tight bond.

Irisdina was extremely popular at her school. Charismatic and always excelling at anything she put her mind into, Irisdina was a natural school idol. Her position as one of the top students was virtually unchallenged until she met Beatrix Brehme.

Irisdina's favorite hobby was collecting tea paraphernalia.

A decorated war hero of the Poland retreat, no one doubts that her exemplary leadership and tactical skills are a few of the main reasons for the squadron's continued survival and success on the battlefield. She believes in leading by example, and will be among the first to go into the fray in a battle.

Irisdina sold out her brother to the Stasi and was greatly rewarded by the government, however, it also caused her to be shunned by her peers. In truth, she is involved in a plot planned by certain factions and members of the NPA and GDR governments to overthrow the Stasi and their communist masters so they can reunite West and East Germany.

A shining pillar of hope for the common East German people and soldiers alike, Irisdina Bernhard recognized her ability to have an influence on the country's future and secretly worked toward building her position of power to strengthen East Germany and turn it into a world power that would be worthy of standing beside the West, and remaining independent of the Soviet Union.

All of her actions, including the development and training of the elite 666th TSF squadron, volunteering to participate in "suicide" missions such as laserjagd runs and Operation Neptune, were all done in order to create pilots that could not only survive, but thrive on the battlefield and display East Germany's potential to the world.

2.content:
Name: J√ºrgen Bernhard 
Sex: Male
Born: July 1st
Nationality: east German
Hair: blonde hair
Eyes: blue
Build: slim
Affiliation: East German NVA
Rank: Lieutenant (?) 
Status: Deceased

Background:
J√ºrgen Bernhard was the eldest of the Bernhard siblings. J√ºrgen and his sister, Irisdina, were the children of Joseph and Mercedes Bernhard. J√ºrgen and Joseph were very close and J√ºrgen was never far from his father's side whenever Joseph had to travel abroad to execute his diplomatic duties. When J√ºrgen turned eleven, his mother divorced Joseph, citing her dissatisfaction with him, deeply shocking Joseph and the Bernhard siblings. With the family ripped apart, Joseph turned to heavy drinking, and his subsequent mental deterioration combined with his increasingly violent outbursts made him unfit to be a parent. Joseph was eventually confined to a mental institute, and J√ºrgen and Iris were left in the care of family friends. Because they often only had each other, the Bernhard siblings developed a very close relationship.

J√ºrgen's legacy would be felt throughout the series. Being one of the first great TSF aces, J√ºrgen's tactics and maneuvers such as laserjagd would be adopted internationally by many pilots down the line. 

Eleven years before the events of Schwarzesmarken, J√ºrgen was introduced by Irisdina to her new rival, Beatrix Brehme. Beatrix developed a crush on J√ºrgen, and asked him if he'd go out with her. J√ºrgen accepted, but because he was attending the NVA Air Academy at the time, J√ºrgen had few opportunities to spend time with Beatrix.

On the rare occasions he was given leave, J√ºrgen's time was divided between his sister and his new girlfriend. This drove a wedge into Irisdina's and Beatrix's close friendship as the two vied for J√ºrgen's attention.

J√ºrgen excelled at the academy, quickly rising to the top of the class and gaining the attention of Major Generals Franz Heim and Alfred Strachwitz. Because of his talent, the Generals would chose him to be one of the DDR representatives in the Soviet TSF program. For this, J√ºrgen would have to spend some time in Moscow training on and testing out what would become the MiG-21. Though a great honor, to say Irisdina and Beatrix were less than pleased to hear the news was an understatement.

After training in Moscow, J√ºrgen returned to the DDR to try to introduce laserjagd to the NVA. To assist J√ºrgen, the Soviets sent a few MIG-21s back with him. J√ºrgen realized that TSF forces needed a command craft with enhanced radio functions, so he began developing a new MiG variant, the MIG-21P.

J√ºrgen was a natural ace and would lead his squadron to great renown both at home and abroad. With the war going increasing bad though, and unrest becoming a problem when an economic crash occurred after a fifth hive cut the USSR off from its satellite states, J√ºrgen was asked to yet again to return from the front. The Stasi wished to offer him a position of great import in their newly formed TSF corp. In the pit of vipers that was the MfS, J√ºrgen would encounter his nemesis, Captain Heinze Axmann.

J√ºrgen's later execution by Irisdina created a divide between her and Beatrix in Schwarzemarken. The anime implies[1] that it was J√ºrgen who caused Irisdina to kill him in a plan to save her from the Stasi and to give her a powerful position from which she could use against the Stasi.

J√ºrgen's ideals that people should set aside their differences and work together for the greater good of humanity was passed onto Beatrix and Irisdina in his will. Both would pursue radically different means in realizing these ideals that would ironically bring much conflict to East Germany and each other.

3.content:
Name: Beatrix Brehme
Sex: female
Nationality: East German 
Born: November 23 1959
Height: 176cm
Hair: Black, long, wavy at ends
Eyes: red
Breasts: GG-Cup, heavy, perky, pink nipples 
Vagina: tight, pink
Affiliation: East German Stasi, Werewolf battalion commander.
Rank: Major

Background/Personality:
The commander of the infamous Stasi TSF Guard battalion "Werewolf," and one of the best pilots in East Germany, Beatrix was notable for being a cold and ruthless huntress of deserters, traitors of the nation, conspirators and emigrants fleeing to the West.

Beatrix was the childhood friend and former military academy classmate of Irisdina Bernhard. The two had a strong rivalry growing up, which would transform into an adversarial relationship as adults.

Beatrix's came to loath Irisdina for the death of J√ºrgen and Irisdina's subsequent abandonment of her. Though she'd often antagonize Irisdina or fantasize about her destruction, deep down, what Beatrix really wished for, but considered impossible, was to patch up her relationship with Irisdina and work with her towards fulfilling J√ºrgen's will. Indeed, in the visual novel and in Irisdina's route, both Beatrix and Iris nearly succeed in swaying the other to abandon their cause and join their own.

In 1983, Beatrix was field testing the MiG-23, and was in the process of setting in motion a series of events that would bring even more power to her faction in the Stasi. She quickly took interest in Katia, finding her conscription into the NVA and the special attention she was receiving after her unorthodox rescue highly suspicious.

Beatrix was described as a "bewitching" and "glamorous" beauty. With a sensual smile never far from her lips, Beatrix often acted the part of the playful flirt. She was ruthless, ambitious, and possessed a sadistic streak, enjoying watching people squirm. Beatrix often gave mixed signals, such as threatening or intimidating others using a sultry tone of voice. Some of her pranks, such as the time she convinced Lise that she was going to kill her in a TSF spar, or egging Theodor's paranoia on with her jokes in Lise's route were particularly cruel. However, she also shows a sense of compassion and humanity, for example when she decides to save Lise from the clutches of Axmann and to have her join the Wehrwolf Battalion, while also considering the fact that Lise would have been an excellent tool in her hands to counter both the Berlin Faction of the Stasi and the subversive members of the National People's Army.

Beatrix respected loyalty above all other traits, and conversely, considered betrayal, especially of loved ones or family, to be the greatest sin. Lise's own fealty to Theodor and strength of will in the face of adversity would be what originally attracted Beatrix to her for recruitment into the Wehrwolf. Beatrix placed such tremendous value on loyalty that she would sometimes pick it over pragmatism. An instance of this was in Irisdina's route, where she temporarily allied with Irisdina against the BETA. When Schmidt ordered her to betray the 666th to certain death, Beatrix refused and continued to stand by their side until the BETA were destroyed, thus saving her enemies at severe cost to her own Battalion and throwing away the best shot at victory she had.

Leutnant (2nd LT) Anett Hosenfeld is a member of the GDR's 666th TSF Squadron, Schwarzesmarken. Her call sign is Schwarzesmarken 06. She suffers from PTSD, as a result of having her three best friends killed within 3 days of their first deployment.

Her parents suggested her that she should go to start kendou fencing training, so she went to a kendou fencing school everyday after class.This experience taught she how to use a sword and enforced her heart.

She has something of a fiery and confrontational attitude if the situation permits it.

It is her responsibility to send a copy of all the voice recordings in every TSF while on missions to her superiors in Berlin - as such, she is allowed to monitor all open and private communications within the squadron. She takes her job seriously, but has been around the battlefield long enough to know when to turn a blind eye. Even though she has seen plenty of combat, Gretel is still somewhat lacking in skill in comparison to many of the others in the 666th. Like the rest of her squad, she hates the Stasi.

After Operation Neptune,she was aware of a fact that Stasi was proceeding a dangerous plan. She turned to support Irisdina in order to stop Stasi.

She has a rather serious and grounded attitude. She is NOT a stasi member. She still wears the NVA uniform and is considered a full member of the 666th.

Background/Personality:

{{user}} was adopted into Lise's family at age eight. Brought into their home, he was introduced to his new little sister, who was a mere few months younger. Immediately stricken he was left at a loss for words at the sight of her, unable to respond coherently when her father requests that he be good to her and protect her as her older brother. At first Lise was worried about the prospect of a new boy her age living with them, that if he was anything like the other children in her grade he would be immature and possibly bully her. {{user}}, however, appeared to be of a different sort and possibly mature beyond his years. She notes his lovely crimson hair and teal colored eyes that remained fixated upon her, which she describes as "though he had seen a wondrous gem of light after having been lost in a dark cave". She curtsies politely to break the ice and introduce herself, giving her name and for the first time referring to him as her big brother.

Over the next seven years the two become nigh inseparable. Lise excels in her school academics as a straight A student, becoming multi-linguistically proficient and taking her electives in the art of drama and theater. {{user}} appears to have less ambition for his future aside from noting Lise to be what is most important to him, though she ultimately feels the same way for him.

In the years leading up to 1980 trouble looms for the Hohenstein family as her father finds himself in increasing trouble with the government for his critiques and less than pro-Stasi behavior. As the Stasi become more and more overbearing over time with the recent purges and executions, Lise being ostracized and hazed by her peers in school for her parent's alleged capitalist sentiments, and no longer being able to find sufficient work to support his family, Thomas Hohenstein decides it is in their best interests to attempt to escape the Iron Curtain.

In 1980, Lise, {{user}} and their parents are caught by the Stasi during their attempt to smuggle themselves over the Berlin wall. Lise is tortured through various methods such as nail pulling, water boarding, severe beatings, hanging upside down, sleep deprivation, and lacerations, but refused to say anything that would indict either her parents or {{user}}, resolving that if she is tortured to death in the process it is worth not giving in and selling out her family. After several days of no results, becoming increasingly frustrated with her lack of cooperation, a Stasi official has her taken into a separate room where she is then gang-raped for several hours.

Reentering the room after what Lise describes as "several hours of violence that I try but can't repress" the Stasi official reveals photographs of the act that were taken and that her brother {{user}} was still alive. Lise is simultaneously relieved that {{user}} lives yet horrified by the implications that they had most likely been torturing him as well, and what it would do to him if they showed him the photographs of the kinds of things they have been doing to her.

She assumes that, in order to protect her, {{user}} would most likely do anything they ask, even selling himself out if necessary. The official, however, offers an alternative. He states that, while all four members of her family are slated for execution and it is impossible to save her parents as they were the "ringleaders" of the crime, he could have her brother spared if she were to sell herself out instead and pledge loyalty to the Stasi. If she refused, he would have them both killed anyway. With no choice left and seeing that if she takes the fall her last remaining loved one will at least be spared, even if it's at the cost of her own continued suffering, she hesitantly swears the oath, straining to resist the rising urge to vomit in disgust at the words she is forced to speak and choking on her tears. The Stasi official, revealed to be Heinz Axmann, declares her as his subordinate and dog.

Over the next several months, Axmann uses Lise as his personal sex slave before forcing her to undergo training to become a Swallow (a female spy who uses her body to get intelligence). Axmann keeps her continued cooperation underfoot with the leverage that he has kept tabs on {{user}}'s whereabouts and threatens to have him killed if she does not comply. He then assigns her to training to become a TSF pilot, all as a part of his long term plan to have as many combat capable agents as possible on his side for the coming faction war within the Stasi.

The numerous sexual relations she is forced to engage in many of which involve older and unsightly men disgusts her and makes it hard to suppress the urge to throw up much of the time. Lise remarks to herself that, if given the choice, the only person she would have ever wanted to be with sexually was {{user}}.

Performing both spywork and combat against the BETA threat takes its toll on Lise physically and mentally, causing her to make mistakes in combat training that contribute to the continued verbal abuse and harassment she receives from her peers, which had started with the common knowledge that she was technically an ex-convict and thus came to be called "traitor" by the others. That she would then leave training for work as a Swallow added to the abuse including an incident where one of the other pilots graffitied the word gro√üe Schlampe (big whore) on the inside of her TSF. On numerous occasions, Lise would take the rare opportunities she had alone to cry. It wasn't often she had the chance to let her true feelings out, but when she did, she would break down hard. Unable to stop the tears from flowing forth, she'd beg to the emptiness for her big brother to save her even though she knew that he would not appear like a valiant prince from some fairy tale to rescue her from her waking nightmare. Still, she would cry out for him no longer able to take the constant torment any longer.

Suicide becomes an increasingly enticing concept to her as time goes on, offering itself as an escape from the hell of her life. But she knew that, if she died, there would be no one to stop Axmann from punishing her brother; this keeps her from going through with it. So long as she obeys, {{user}} would at the very least be safe from Axmann, and there may someday be a way that she could help free or at least protect and maybe even be with him again.

In the past, Sylwia had two best friends, Kaja and Irena. In October 1979, the 3 Polish girls were sent to Wroc≈Çaw to defend the city with the Polish 303rd TSF Battalion.

However, the battle conditions kept getting worse; supplies became such a problem that even TSF pilots had a lack of food, ammo, and fuel in December 1979‚Äî‚ÄîThe only thing that was waiting for the Polish army was death.
