2.name: Quirk
2.content:
Quirks:

A Quirk (ÂÄã„ÅìÊÄß„Åõ„ÅÑ Kosei?, lit. "Individuality"), formerly known as a Meta Ability (Áï∞„ÅÑËÉΩ„ÅÆ„ÅÜ In≈ç?, lit. "Extraordinary Ability"), is a superhuman power that a person can possess.

Along with being unique to each user, Quirks are sorted into multiple categories. Quirk users are also limited to only developing one power or set of powers and are thus unable to achieve any other through natural means.

Quirks are unique superhuman abilities possessed by individuals, ranging from elemental powers and enhanced physical abilities to more specialized abilities like telekinesis or transformation. Quirks define the society, its hierarchy, and the dynamics between heroes and villains.

3.name: Hero
3.content:
Heroes have become a respected profession, and the society is built around their presence. Pro Heroes, licensed individuals with exceptional Quirks, work to protect the public from villains and maintain peace. The hero society is organized with agencies, rankings, and a regulatory system.

Heroes have the primary responsibility of ensuring public safety. They swiftly respond to emergencies, rescue individuals in need, and confront villains who pose threats to society. 

Hero agencies serve as organizations that employ and support heroes, assigning them tasks and providing necessary resources. These agencies have rankings and popularity based on the achievements and public perception of their heroes.

However, being a hero comes with its own set of challenges. Heroes face risks, endure physical and emotional hardships, and carry the weight of making critical decisions to safeguard others. They often encounter formidable villains with dangerous Quirks, requiring them to rely on their skills and intelligence to overcome these adversaries.

4.name: u.a.
4.content:
U.A. High School is an academy that boasts the best heroics education in Japan. It sits atop a forested hill that overlooks Musutafu. U.A. is the #1 ranked high school for heroics and is considered as the top Hero Academy in Japan. Students are separated based on their abilities into specific Departments and Classes - A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, and K. U.A. does not adhere to traditional school methods, and allows their staff to teach their classes however they like. This includes teachers having the authority to expel any student(s) at any time and for any reason, no matter how minor. Furthermore, students who are expelled can be re-enrolled, although the expulsion will still remain on their permanent records. Recently, U.A. started a new program. Villains who are minors can start rehabilitation at their school, depending on the villain‚Äôs intelligence, strength and power, he will be assigned to a class, the stronger and more intelligent class A, B, C and the weaker, room K, J and L.
U.A. was originally a day school, but it was later turned into a boarding school.
U.A. executes a six-day school week where the only day off is Sunday.
The Hero Course: Students learn everything they need to know to become excellent heroes in service of the community and work towards the qualifications necessary to be allowed to use their Quirks in public spaces. They are trained in battle, first aid, and all manner of heroics-related lessons. Ordinary subjects, such as English, take place in the morning, followed by lunch. Then, in the afternoon, Heroics classes take place.
The Hero Course students belong to Classes A and B.
Villains automatically enter in Hero Course, having rehabilitation activities at night and normal classes at the day.

Once a year, U.A. holds a tournament called the U.A. Sports Festival, which has become a nationwide event that is watched by people and heroes from all around the country. Students from all departments are allowed to participate, and it is a chance for heroes in training to show off what they can do for Pro Heroes in the audience, increasing their chances of possible internships or recruitment. It is also the opportunity for other students to gain admittance into the Hero Course, as well as for students from the Support and Business courses to promote their support items and further develop their business sense, respectively.

U.A. also holds an annual School Festival where classes from all departments create a range of activities and events for everyone to watch and participate in. This gives the students and staff alike the chance to unwind and have fun. It is also usually opened to the public, although the most recent one unfortunately wasn't due to villain activity.

Like many schools, each class in U.A. has a class representative and vice class representative. While these positions would usually just mean extra work, they are quite coveted in the Hero course, as they are a way for students to prove their leadership capabilities to Hero Agencies. The class representatives are up for the students themselves to decide upon, although it's suggested that they handle them democratically, through an election process for example.

At the entrance, there is a security wall nicknamed the "U.A. Barrier" that automatically closes if a person trying to enter the premises does not have a Student ID Card or Special Entry Permission ID. Many such precautions have been made to keep out villains and members of the press.

The security system underwent major upgrades following Tomura Shigaraki's break in, with research and development, as well as maintenance being overseen by Power Loader. The grounds are partitioned like a game board, and each section is equipped with a mechanism that will transform it into an underground emergency shelter. Those individual shelters then enter a linear maglev network that can send them along any number of underground routes at the faculty's discretion. As an added precaution against Tomura's Decay, the ground between the surface and the shelters has been fortified with about three thousand layers of bulwark plates. Should the system detect anything out of the ordinary, a countermeasure will activate and the pillars that connect the plates will unlock, rendering each plate independently mobile, significantly delaying any incoming attack. During this time, the shelters will speed off to safety to other hero schools that have established similar security systems, such as Shiketsu High School.

Power Loader has enlisted the help of his most promising student, Mei Hatsume to further upgrade the schools defenses, in case the current mass evacuation system isn't enough. Most recently, Mei was seen developing a way for the shelter blocks to take off into the air.

As an additional precaution against Himiko Toga's Transform Quirk, anyone seeking shelter at U.A. is kept in isolation until enough time has passed that Himiko's transformation time limit would have run out.

The U.A. grounds have also been equipped with propulsion jets, able to transform U.A. into a floating fortress. In preparation for the final battle with Tomura Shigaraki, special measures were put in place to counter his abilities. The ground is made of tile segments that can be ejected high into the air to stop the spread of his Decay. The tile segments can be replaced as they go. There is also an electromagnetic barrier around the grounds, where coming into contact with it will result in momentary paralysis. The whole thing is powered by several students with electrical Quirks.
outline
A fictional educational institution that appears in My Hero Academia . In episode 1, it appears as a national high school.

The name comes from ‚ÄòUÀêei‚Äô (ungyeong), which is a reversal of the Chinese character order of ‚ÄòeiyuÀê‚Äô (hero). The official release name is ‚ÄòUA High School‚Äô. The pirated version borrowed the original's naming method and translated it as Ungyeong-go, which is also famous. Regarding the location, it was expressed that Uraraka came to Tokyo to enter Yuei University , so the fandom was speculating that it was located in Tokyo or nearby, but in the original drawing, it was revealed that it was located in Shizuoka Prefecture .

Japan's best hero training institute, established to nurture future professional heroes .[1] It is a three-year national high school, and its hero department is the best in the country.[2] It is a school that has produced the majority of the top-ranking heroes in the country.[3] Top tier students at UAE are treated as professional level players.[4] It is said that, after graduating from the hero department of UA, students do not go on to university but instead get jobs as sidekicks for professional heroes. It is a kind of vocational high school in that students get jobs right after graduating.
2. PLUS ULTRA
PLUS ULTRA (More and Beyond)!!

This is U.A.'s educational philosophy. It is the motto of King Carlos I and is also the national motto of Spain . Because it is Latin, it should be pronounced plus ultra , but it was often pronounced plus ultra only in the first Korean dubbed version. The English dub is also pronounced as just plus ultra.

According to the educational philosophy, U.A.'s classes basically give students endless trials and overcome them at the discretion of teachers in charge of each subject . All of the teachers are active professional heroes, so the high-difficulty tests are conducted on a surprise basis without prior notice to the students.
3. infra
It is equipped with a large-scale urban area for simulated combat and rescue practice. It has various types of buildings such as factory zones, large buildings, and super-sized swimming pools.

Unleash dozens of robots to replace punching bags in the city. It is used for entrance exams, sports competitions, and combat practice.

File:uadoor
The ceiling height is very high, and the overall campus facilities are large. Seeing that it is referred to as "barrier-free," it seems that it was designed with consideration so that there would be no inconvenience for the large heteromorphic personality holders to go around.

Because it is a national school, all operating expenses, including small towns for school street fighting training, USJ, and giant mecha, are tax money . Yaoyorozu, who did not know this, was shocked when she saw the gimmick robots during the entrance exam for the UA Sports Festival and wondered where the money came from to make so many of them.
4. uniform
The jacket is designed with turquoise lines on the sleeves or collar on a gray background. There are epaulettes with gold buttons on the shoulders. The number of strings and the number of golden buttons differ from department to department. In the case of buttons, there is one button on the inner end of the hero department, two buttons on both ends of the general department, three buttons on the outer end of the management department, and two buttons on the outer end of the support department. In the case of neckties, female students have gold buttons attached to the knot.

The shirt is white and the tie is red. As for bottoms, boys wear green pants and girls wear green skirts.

And it is often repaired according to the individuality of the student. For example, in the case of Ojiro Masirao, a tail hole is drilled. And in the case of Mezo Shoji, the top just came off because of the replica arm .
5. Gym suit
The blue sweatshirt has white letters UA engraved from top to bottom. The line around the arm is a bonus. When Midoriya ripped off his hero costume in a mock battle with Bakugo and came to USJ wearing the hero costume's equipment in a temporary gym suit, there was controversy because it was cooler than the original costume. Of course, now it's a better design.
6. curriculum
In line with the Spartan educational ideology of raising students' abilities to the limit and enabling them to realize their potential, each one is full of tough things.
6.1. entrance exam
As a top-level hero training institution, the competition rate exceeds 1:300. And among them, only 36 students per grade in the Hero Department, which nurtures real heroes.[5] only[6]

The entrance exam consists of a written test and a practical test. Among them, the practical test consists of simulated street fighting , and the system is like this.
Students are divided into groups such as A, B, and C and take the test. At this time, students from the same school are dispersed to prevent cooperation.[7]
In the simulated street battle, a total of 3 + 1 types of villains (robots) appear. You have to make the villain 'uncombatable' to get as many points as possible. The three types of villains are awarded 1~3p points according to the difficulty of attacking.
The 4th Villain is 0p, i.e. there is no point. This villain is a kind of gimmick , and the teacher in charge of guidance directly gives an example, saying that it is an obstacle similar to Super Mario Bros. In other words, even if you touch it, it doesn't take damage, but if you hit it, it will fly away in one shot, so don't even touch it at all .[8][9][10]
There is a hidden fact: in this mock battle test, in addition to the villain point, which is an objective evaluation, there is a separate rescue point . As a hero, this is an additional point given when you save someone else in a desperate moment. It is said that this Rescue Point is a screening system, and when Midoriya entered school, it was judged by teachers excluding All Might.[11] Midoriya had 0 villain points, but was able to pass with an overwhelming score of 60 points with rescue points that offset this.

However, some teachers seem to be criticizing this entrance exam process, saying that it is not efficient or that it is against fairness. For example, it is pointed out that an entrance exam student with a personality specialized in 100% suppression or a personality that only works on living things like people but not on inanimate objects like robots cannot earn points in the entrance exam no matter how powerful that personality is as a hero. The most direct example is Hitoshi Shinso, who has the personality of 'brainwashing' . It seems that the decision to have them deal with robots was due to the adult's consideration of the ethical criticism of 'Does an educational institution that trains heroes make people attack people from the entrance exam?' Individuals with unique personalities like Shinsou are likely to be transferred to the hero department if their skills are recognized through the YuA Sports Festival.[12]

As a bonus, in the case of recommendation admission, rather than simply receiving a recommendation, you must take a separate test + interview. Approximately 5 to 6 people form a group and must pass an ultra-hard obstacle race-like course using only their individuality. However, only two of those who pass from a group go through an interview, and only four people in total can be admitted. In the story, Todoroki and Honenuki were a team.[13]

Although Eraserhead and Midnight have personalities that are not at all helpful in destroying robots, seeing as they graduated from YuA, it seems that the practical evaluation method when they entered school was different from now.[14][15]

However, judging from the fact that advancement and classes were suspended in episode 319, it is highly likely that there will be no entrance exams at this point. In fact, even if they tried to do it normally, there is a high possibility that they would not be able to do it, and since even the first-year students (currently second-year students) who were raised through attributes are being put into actual combat, there is no way that they can advance and take classes normally, and the fact that UA's hero department boasts a competition rate of 300:1 means that many talented people are flocking to it, but now that the status of heroes has fallen, it is not only difficult to fill the quota of 36 students, but it may not be able to fill the 4 recommended students. Or even if they do fill it, it could lead to the problem that relatively low-quality students will come in. And there was damage to the faculty, with Midnight dying, and the teachers are also fighting on the battlefield, and the UA site itself is being used as a shelter, so they are busy taking care of refugees before classes. Even that almost fell due to an attack by the Surreal Liberation Front.
6.2. regular class
The school class schedule is as follows. In the case of the hero department, morning classes are general classes and afternoon classes are hero classes.
morning view
8:25~8:35
First class
8:40~9:30
2nd period
9:40~10:30
3rd period
10:40~11:30
4th period
11:40~12:30
Lunch
12:30~13:20
5th period
13:20~14:10
6th period
14:20~15:10
6.3. U.A Sports Festival
File:details ico... more detailsU.A Sports Festival documentcastPlease note.
6.4. work experience
For about a week, he receives practical training by going on a business trip to his current hero office. After the athletic meet is over, nominations are received from hero offices across the country, mainly for tournament entrants, and students can choose the office they wish to train from among these nominations. Since you can nominate up to two people, two students may train in the same hero office if all of the nominated students accept the hero's nomination. However, even students who do not receive a nomination can go to one of the dozens of offices that the school has put in advance offers. Of course, since each office has different areas of activity, scope, and field of expertise, it is necessary to reasonably consider the student's own career path.

In the case of Midoriya, who is still in the 1st year at the time of volume 6, and his classmates, in fact, strictly speaking, it is close to an expression of interest in the future, and it is said that serious nominations come in earnest from the 2nd and 3rd years when enough experience has been accumulated. Still, as it is an opportunity for hands-on experience, it is necessary to put the first button properly.

Because it is an education that 'experiences' what a hero's job is, it is not as active as professional heroes, but more like a kind of field trip. However, in some cases, it is often the case that the actual situation is experienced. Representative examples include Kyoka Jiro , who participated in a battle against an actual villain, Tsuyu Asui , who made a significant contribution to catching a smuggler, and a back alley trio who even (unintentionally) apprehended a heinous criminal .[16]

Practical exam with final exam. Like the entrance ceremony, it was a test to destroy robots, but the teachers trained students against the ever-growing threat of villains, but the test against robots was judged to be inefficient and unreasonable, so it was changed. do. The passing condition is weights that weigh half of the body weight with a handicap within the designated field.[17] teachers who wore[18] It doesn't matter if only one of you escapes to the designated gate against the teacher or handcuffs your arms and legs. However, if the time limit is 30 minutes and the time-up is over, you will be eliminated.

Before the exam, the teachers said they would sincerely deal with the students, but of course, they treated the students as if they were leaving some room for them to pass the exam.[19] They each have to deal with teachers who are at a disadvantage, and since all of Yuei's teachers are veteran heroes who have experienced many hardships, if they fight sincerely, there is no way for the students to win no matter what they do.

6.7. license (provisional license)
Originally, during the summer vacation training camp, it was a school practice that had to be completed along with strengthening individuality, but was overshadowed by the end of the training camp due to an unexpected situation .

In the meantime, students need permission from teachers, to avoid legal conflict on private property, or to protect themselves. In the case of an unexpected emergency, it was possible to use force using personality on a limited basis, but to protect itself from the growing threat of villains, it was originally possible to acquire a license for the use of force with personality, which could only be acquired in the first half of the second year. What you decided to pick during the school year.

According to Mr. Aizawa, it is very intense.[41] In preparation for that, students decide to create at least two special moves before obtaining a license.

For reference, here, by convention, Uae High School is the first target because it is the most vulnerable because the individuality of Uei students is revealed due to the Uae Sports Festival. As soon as it actually starts, everyone just presses on Yuei.
6.7.1. Special Moves Workshop
Of course, the main focus in the driver's license acquisition test is the hero's physical abilities, and among the various aptitudes seen in the driver's license test, combat power is no different from being essential to a hero. In that sense, a skill that allows you to secure an advantageous position in battle, that is, a special move, is a great help in increasing your ability to fight. In that sense, it is said that the presence or absence of technology has a great influence on whether or not to pass the test.

It is said that this technique does not have to be in the form of an attack. Typical examples are Tenya Iida 's speed buff technique 'Reciprocal Burst', Bakugo's dash technique 'Explosive Speed ‚Äã‚ÄãTurbo', Mineta's restraining technique 'Grape Rush' and Midoriya's fighting style conversion 'One For All Shoot Style'. .

By the way, it is said that the personality development of the training camp, which was stopped last time, was part of the process for acquiring this 'special move'. It is a natural procedure since the skill level of individuality leads to the perfection of technology.
6.7.2. license exam
File:details ico... more detailsMy Hero Academia / License Exam documentcastPlease note.
6.8. hero intern
Students who have become nominal heroes by obtaining temporary licenses through the license test go to the professional hero office for training. If you just listen to the explanation, it doesn't seem much different from the workplace experience above, but the difference is that the students are treated as sidekicks, or professionals, rather than as trainees or guests coming to learn about heroes. Therefore, unlike work experience where you do not experience particularly strenuous work, the quality is completely different as you can experience the work that real professionals do as a professional.[42] Moreover, unlike work experience, which is part of the class, this is a voluntary activity for students, so students must find an internship position on their own using connections such as work experience without support from the school. In addition, it is not easy because you have to take school classes like other students who are not interning.[43]

Internship will resume again in December. Because of the incident that occurred in Teika City, this time the Public Safety Committee made a direct request. In effect, it is student mobilization . According to Cementus, this is the first time something like this has happened.[44]
6.9. culture festival
It is an event that is held like other schools, and all students participate in each class like an athletics event. If the sports meet is an event where the hero department takes the stage, the cultural festival is an event in which other departments (general department, support department, management department) take the lead. In this year, there was a major incident, so the Commissioner of the National Police Agency personally came to the principal and told him to take action. On the cultural festival day, the Gentle Criminal and the Love Lover combination tried to attack, but Midoriya, who happened to be on his way to the grocery store, found out about the two's attack and stopped it, so the event was successfully held and finished.[45]
6.10. joint training
The joint training of Hero Department Classes A and B that takes place in Episode 194. Each team of four will compete in a total of five rounds, and the goal is to think of the opposing team as villains, subdue them, and put '4 people' in prison. It may sound strange to say that a team of only four will lose if all four are captured, but in this training, one student from the general department will participate as a special guest and enter each team once, forming a team of five. Although a team of five may seem advantageous, it will be difficult to coordinate with people you are almost meeting for the first time, and although a team of five has one more person, it will lose if only four people are captured, so the balance was adjusted to some extent.

7. List of teachers and students
7.1. 1 Grade
7.1.1. Hero department
Class A and Class B. Overwork, the mainstay of Yuei. Only 40 students are selected per grade[47] Extremely intense excess. As this is a course that trains heroes, students learn practical content to become a hero in addition to the standard curriculum. These 40 students were divided into two classes: Class A and Class B.

In the case of the class curriculum, in the morning, you learn the required subjects of Youngsoo Guk, and after lunch, you learn hero information science for 3 classes in the afternoon. Hero Informatics offers everything from theory classes related to qualifications and the Constitution, which are important for hero activities, to practical classes such as combat and rescue training.

Those who graduate from this department are usually scouted by professional heroes and work as sidekicks, and the few who achieve remarkable results become independent as professional heroes with their own offices. Of course, to reach this level, one must have overwhelming talent and ability. Third-year student Milio Togata, who is currently considered one of Yuei's Big Three, also plans to join Nighteye as a sidekick instead of working independently after graduation, which gives us an idea of ‚Äã‚Äãhow difficult it is to set up a private office. Of course, it is also because Nighteye is a hero who has a lot to learn from.[48] From what has been described so far, Endeavor is said to have risen to No. 2 at the age of 20, so it appears that he became independent as a professional hero rather than a sidekick as soon as he graduated. As a side note, Hawks also debuted at the age of 18 and is said to be in the top 10 professional heroes. It's the first top 10 heroes of all time. However, in the case of the Hawks, they are not from YuA.[49]

Even students from other departments can take the transfer exam to the Hero Department if they want, and even if they are a Hero Department student, if the teacher deems them unsuitable, they can be expelled or dropped to a different department. However, since this story of transfer and expulsion came out at the same time, many people think of transfer and expulsion as the same, thinking that if one person transfers, someone else is expelled so that the number of students is unconditionally maintained at 20. In secondary creations, there are many cases where there are 21 people, or where the considerably unpopular and ambiguous grape-head is expelled. In particular, Mineta Minoru's fighting power is low, and he is a character who barely avoided last place in the personality test, so it is easy to exclude him. In reality, if Mineta fails to advance to the Hero Department due to Oriju 's intervention, there is a high probability that he will go to the general department, but anyway, except for Shinso Hitoshi, most of the students in the general department are background characters, so it does not mean much.

The main character , Izuku Midoriya , belongs to class A among them.

7.1.2. general department
Class C, Class D, Class E. Everything including the educational curriculum is unknown, but one thing is certain: it is located right below the Hero Department. Students who fail the Hero Department entrance exam come here, but if they gain fame in large events such as the sports competition, they can advance to the Hero Department. In other words, the format of the entrance exam[50] The purpose is to find talented people who could not be filtered out and send them to the hero department to supplement the hero department students who failed. A representative example is Shinso Hitoshi . Other than that, it seems like they teach them normally like regular schools and just send them out into society.

However, considering that UA High School itself is a prestigious school and the cutoff score for the written exam is very high, even if you didn't get into the hero department, the regular department students seem to be top students by the standards of regular high school students. Above all, getting into the regular department is not the end, and if you show remarkable results in the UA Sports Festival, you can transfer to the hero department. Shinso Hitoshi mentioned earlier is an example of this.[51]

7.1.3. Support Department
Class F, Class G, Class H. A special course studied by those who develop and manufacture equipment that supports heroes. In athletic competitions, etc., you can use items or costumes you have developed to be fair in response to hero students who use their individuality to appeal to heroes. At the athletic meet, it seems that you can appeal your ideas or development skills to famous companies and sign a contract after graduation.

After school, it is said that you can develop or repair items at the school's support workshop. It was a setting mentioned only in the book, but it was revealed in episode 100. Unlike other classrooms, the doors are made of steel because of the risk of accidents.

As an aside, I don't know what class it is, but in Hatsume's case, it seems that the power loader is the homeroom teacher. After the profile of the 2nd season of the anime appeared, it was revealed that he was in Class H.

In the initial conception stage, the main character, Izuku Midoriya, was a student in the support department. Perhaps as part of this, compared to students in the general department or business department, Mei Hatsume's weight and treatment, which will be discussed later, are not bad.
Hatsume Mei
As an aside, U.A. has a contract with a support item company that exclusively manufactures costumes and support items for students, and this company, like Hatsume Mei, is extraordinary in changing the design requested by customers to their liking.

However, if you look at it piece by piece, the big design is only changed more sophisticated without any change . Considering that when Midoriya also asked Hatsume for her support items, she said that she had no intention of changing in this design, and that she remembered her mother, she wasn't such a bad thing.

When Midoriya went to Gran Torino's office for a job experience, he took a newly repaired hero costume with him, but the enclosed memo from the support item company read, "Izuku Midoriya. We have made some changes to the design of the costume you requested based on our company's judgment, so please understand. However, this is definitely cooler!!" After seeing this memo, Midoriya thought, "Are there only people like Hatsume at support companies?"

It's to the point where people in this group all feel this way, and the possibility that Power Loader, who is relatively sensible, is a heretic has been raised. In the first place, Power Loader's main job is as a hero, so it wouldn't be strange if he were the only heretic.
7.1.4. Department of Management
Class I, Class J, Class K. Because it is a worldview that recognizes hero activities as a business, it is a department that nurtures talented people who assist them in business. For example, if you set up a hero office, it is a company, so you need them for accounting work that manages and organizes the funds that go into operation, and you can make investments and publicity like a professional manager, or give advice on complicated hero-related laws. do. In addition, since heroes are allowed to have side jobs such as entering the broadcasting industry in addition to hero activities, there is a way to provide consulting in this area.

They did not participate in the sports competition. Instead, they analyzed what parts of the students who participated from the stands would be advantageous and disadvantageous when they later became independent heroes, what value their names had as a brand, and what they needed to do to develop them. They also took charge of operating convenience facilities, including snack sales, within the stadium. That's why they said they had the most free time during the sports competition.[52]

However, compared to other departments, it has no presence. Not to mention the hero department, the general department and the support department have at least one named character, but the management department doesn't have anything like that.

In episode 359, it is explained that recording the activities of the heroes participating in the final battle as a video is part of the management department curriculum, and a business department student records the battle at Uei High School as a video, and this is also necessary for hero production. do. And in episode 380, while filming the gentle supporting the Uei school that was falling from the sky, Japan became this shape despite the wheat telling them to go in because it was dangerous, and Endeavor shouldered the responsibility, and on that day, they should have produced it and connected society and heroes. Cook Hero in charge of U.A.'s lunches.

That means you end up cooking a total of 1,800 meals a day.[60]

8. course of action
From episode 306, the society has gone into chaos under the influence of the surreal liberation front raid, and many areas have become unmanageable. Shelters that can be managed by heroes have been designated, and U.A. is designated as one of those shelters. Afterwards, the families of the U.A. students will begin to evacuate.

In episode 319, promotions and classes are suspended, and the Hero Department says that they are on standby with the heroes. And another reason why U.A. became a shelter comes out, and it is said that there was a barrier called the U.A. Barrier.

In episode 323, the detailed specifications of the 'Yuei Barrier' were revealed. Originally, the country's latest defense technology was introduced and the defense power was at the same level as Tartarus and Shiketsu, but Nezu felt a sense of crisis after Shigaraki knocked down the Yuei main gate in the spring of last year. It is said that it was independently improved. Divide the site into a checkerboard pattern and hide it underground to create a shelter in case of emergency. Then, use the superconducting linear system to move through various routes as appropriate.[63] It can be moved to other hero high schools, including Shiketsu . As a bonus, in preparation for the device itself collapsing, a total of 3,000 floors of reinforced barriers are installed in the surrounding underground area, where a reactive attack system is activated when an abnormality is detected. The supports are unlocked to make the barriers independent until the shelter reaches a safe route. Any attack was slowed down.

In addition, by finding out the time limit for transformation by consuming Himiko Toga 's blood, refugees were allowed to enter Yuei after being quarantined for a certain period of time.[64]

In short, it is a specification that has been prepared for several times with the final evolution specifications of Tomura Shigaraki in mind, but what is even more surprising is that Nezu cannot receive government support based on a simple feeling for such a large-scale construction that requires astronomical costs, and at least last spring It was prepared from scratch, so it was just filled with Nezu's own money.[65]

In episode 345, it is floated in the air while being wrapped in a barrier.

As a reference, the deviation value of top-tier high schools in Japan such as Kaisei High School and Nada High School is 78, and there are only about 10 schools in the whole of Japan at this level, which is the extreme end of the normal distribution . 5.name: Tartarus
5.content:
Special Prison For Villain Criminals - Tartarus is a prison distanced from civilization where extremely dangerous Villains are imprisoned and interrogated under the highest security standards possible. The high-security prison appears to be located on an island about five kilometers from the mainland, surrounded by giant walls. The only access to the prison is a long bridge connected to a city with the entrance guarded by two or more guards that check every vehicle going in. The gate that stands in front of the mainland side of the bridge is known as "The Bronze Gate". In the anime, it is shown that the bridge connecting the prison to the mainland can be made to collapse one section at a time. Tartarus' interior is heavily armored with blast doors lining narrow, steel-plated hallways. Prisoners incarcerated inside Tartarus are heavily restrained, sitting down restrained on a large, high-tech chair with a full-body straitjacket. Though nominally a prison, the facility effectively serves as a dumping ground for individuals who threaten or have threatened public safety to a drastic extent. Regardless of sentencing status, these individuals are incarcerated and heavily monitored in Tartarus.  People with a wide range of Quirks are locked within its walls and divided up among six cell blocks, depending on the danger their Quirks represents and the severity of their cases. The more dangerous the individual, the deeper they‚Äôre kept within the prison. The deepest level of the prison is B10, located 500 meters below sea level. Sensors are continuously monitoring the vital functions of prisoners, reacting to even the slightest sign of unusual behavior or attempt to activate a Quirk. The aforementioned sensors are also connected to four ceiling-mounted, automated machine guns that will fire on the prisoner if they suddenly move or have thoughts of activating their Quirk. Tartarus guards also monitor prisoners in a room with several screens displaying the inside of cells, where they are alerted to movement and speaking from prisoners. Conversations between guards are recorded whilst they are on the job and they are also allowed to use lethal force as they carry weapons. In the event of a cell breakout, guards are allowed to open fire on prisoners should they resist recapture. The prison has visiting rooms where visitors can speak to prisoners from the opposite side of a glass window. These rooms are set up so the prison guards can observe and monitor conversations between prisoners and visitors. These rooms are equipped with a microphone to talk to a visitor, and computers that can detect and display a prisoner's brainwaves, which informs guards of their state of mind during a conversation with a visitor. The defensive capabilities of Tartarus is such that All For One admitted, even if "Tomura's" body was 100% complete, and Gigantomachia was with him, they would still struggle to get past its nigh-impenetrable defenses. Before entering the Rehabilitation program at U.A ((User}} was held in cell 10-4 on level B10. 
outline
All Might ... It's really frustrating here.
For example, if your back itches and you rub your back against the back of a chair, all of a sudden, muzzles will point in your direction.
Vital signs and brain waves are always being checked.
By the time you thought about activating your individuality , you were already grabbing the lifeline.
Imprisoned deep underground, monitored by several layers of security, thoroughly avoiding unexpected situations.
In the world, quoting Greek mythology, this place is called ' Tartaros '. It's the name of hell, which means 'hell'.
No matter how much it is, it will have to go through a lot to rebel against God.
- All for One , from a conversation with All Might, who came to visit while imprisoned in Tartarus. (Episode 116)

A special detention center where the highest-level villains of the My Hero Academia universe are imprisoned. However, administratively classified as a detention center, in reality, it is a facility that strictly confines and monitors those who seriously threatened or threatened the safety of the people regardless of whether the sentence was confirmed or not confirmed.

Because of these characteristics, in fact, there are many aspects that strictly violate modern legal principles, and it seems that even in the work, human rights groups and others claim that the existence itself is illegal, but a single person with a strong personality can cause tremendous human and property damage. It was functioning as a kind of necessary evil in the superhuman society.
2. Detail
Hiroakapan Impel Down .[1][2] It is said to be a place where only the worst convicts are imprisoned, whose crimes are so serious that even the death penalty is a waste of money , and even if the visitor is All Might, the 'symbol of peace', the procedures are very strict.

The name from episode 297 is the 'Gaeseong' top security special detention center, which strictly confines and monitors those who seriously threaten the safety of citizens. The greater the risk of individuality or the seriousness of the incident, the deeper the imprisoned, and the lowest level is 500 meters deep. It is a place called the darkness of individual society because once you enter, you cannot leave.

As can be seen by looking at the security level of the facility, it is a place where only the highest-ranking villains are imprisoned.[3] Judging by the depiction of the story, it is the most fearsome prison in Japan, and the security and security are very strict, comparable to the real-life ADX Florence Prison , Alcatraz , Black Dolphin Prison , and Snowy Owl Prison . Moreover, in some ways, it cannot be compared to real-life prisons. In the first place, all of the security robots used here are for military purposes, so it is virtually the same as if the military were stationed and guarded. According to Volume 13, full-body restraint is the basic condition of prisoners, and an infrared surveillance camera with a gun operates in response to the slightest movement of the prisoner, and vital signs such as heart rate and brain waves are constantly checked, and if there is even the slightest sign of using one's personality, the prisoner opens fire. They say they do it.

It is 5km away from the mainland and ships and helicopters cannot enter. The only entrance is a single bridge connecting the mainland to Tartarus. The 10th basement floor seems to be the lowest floor, and the situation seems to be different depending on the villain.[4] Access from the outside is strongly blocked, but I don't think Gigantomachia, who wouldn't be surprised to find All For One right now, would attack this place. In episode 297, while All Four One, who has encroached on Tomura's body, attacks, it is revealed that his defensive ability is not normal enough to say that he cannot penetrate unless he attacks inside and outside at the same time.[5] Just looking at the description, it boasts the highest level of security, such as all kinds of flying drones, huge-sized heavily armed drones, special forces for subduing and killing, and blocking entry to the land by raising a bridge in case of emergency or sealing off a bulkhead on each floor.

The name Tartarus itself refers to the lowest level of hell in Greek mythology from which escape is extremely difficult, and it is said to be a hell that even the gods fear, as many gods were imprisoned there after losing in war. It is a prison with a notorious reputation that lives up to its name.

Politically, Simgudang and its branch parties, and socially, various civic groups claim that Tartarus should be eliminated, saying that its existence itself is inhumane.
3. current situation
This article contains spoilers .

It directly or indirectly contains the plot, ending, and reversal elements of the work or character described in this document.

It was mentioned that Stain , Moonfish , Muscular , etc. were imprisoned here, and All For One, who was defeated in the final battle with All Might, was also transferred here. Later, Kurogiri was also arrested and imprisoned here, and it was a place that was briefly passed by, such as All Might visiting to interview All For One, but...

In episode 297, All For One's evil thoughts that have consumed Shigaraki 's body attack Tartarus with the Near High End to free his body. While dealing with the external guards composed of heroes and robots with Shigaraki's body and high-ends, Shigaraki's body inflicts an EMP attack to paralyze the system first, and then All For One's main body inside is required to restore the system. By applying another EMP attack before 3 seconds pass, the entire facility and system of the prison is paralyzed and the prisoners are released. The guards responded quickly by cutting off the bridge to the mainland and trying to subdue the prisoners with guns, but they were subdued without inflicting any meaningful blows.

There are opinions that think that it is not probable that the facility boasting the best security in Japan will be destroyed in just one episode, but even if All For One brought Gigantomachia , it would have been difficult to attack from the outside. It was pierced because they attacked the outside at the same time.[6] In addition, even if you disable the security system and come out, you can cut off the bridge in case of emergency, but seeing that there is no helicopter or ship seen, if the only entrance is blocked, there is a distance of "5km" from the mainland, so you can transfer, fly, swim As long as there is no personality, getting out of the island is also work. If the heavily armed police and heroes come after receiving a request for support before then, they will be captured again. All in all, the opponent , and the timing was just too bad, and it deserves the title of a great prison from which you can never get out once you enter. In fact, All For One continued to pierce Tartarus, but Midoriya couldn't stay in one place, saying that they couldn't pierce anywhere, and whenever the topic of security came up, the cheat that pierced Tartaros prepared me tightly. When it comes, it comes out like the end. Scenes showing that the attack on Tartarus was an incredibly difficult operation internally, and externally, it was a device that drove Midoriya into extreme situations and gave probabilities to individual actions.

Thanks to this prison break incident, the Surreal Liberation Front, which suffered great damage from the all-out war against the heroes, recruited escaped prisoners and strengthened its strength to some extent. In fact, All for One carefully selected the strongest among the vicious criminals of Tartarus and hired them as assassins to capture Midoriya, but all failed.[7] Of course, the assassins have retired, but there are still quite a few escaped convicts who are All For One's subordinates.[8][9] However, in the final battle, the escapees, including Moon Fish, were arrested again, and the aforementioned assassins were either killed or completely suppressed, except for Lady Nagant, who turned to the hero's side. In reality, in cases like Stain and Overhaul, there is a high possibility that they will side with the heroes. Of course, it is assumed that the heroes' power and stamina were exhausted in the process of being overpowered by the Tartarus villains.[10]

Like One Piece's Impel Down's Lv.6 and Fisher Tiger's attack on Marie Joa, it is presumed that it will be a significant source of material for the production team even after the work is completed. Even if a person of a lower level than All For One appears but is quite powerful, it is enough to just dismiss him as one of the prisoners of Tartarus who escaped during All For One's prison break.

The prisoner in the bottom right appears to be Stain after being freed. Among them, Kurogiri is exceptionally sent to a special medical institution called Central to check the possibility of restoring Shirakumo Oboro, which was before the renovation, by Uei High School, rather than jailbreak.
4.2. Prisoners without individual documents
4.2.1. dictator
File:dictator
A villain with the personality of a dictator who has a hunchback - like appearance and manipulates people with strings coming out of his body . The villain's name, Dictator, is an English word meaning dictator. Five years ago, he was arrested by Shield Hero Crust for causing a bloodless individual incident and was imprisoned in Tartarus. After he escapes from prison, he is hired by All For One and controls the post-hero faction ordinary people and vigilantes to attack the devastated Midoriya and hides in the crowd. However, he is incapacitated by Bakugo's AP shot from above and screams out, and is captured by Class 1 A following him.
Dictatorship
Áã¨Ë£Å | Despot
user
dictator
type
trigger system
Like Hitoshi Shinso 's brainwashing , he is a mind-manipulating personality. It is activated by connecting the main body and the control target with a thread extending from the main body. As the number of subjects to be manipulated increases, the mental burden increases, so unlike Shinso's brainwashing, which is basically limited to a single target, Dictator's 'dictatorship' can control everything as long as it touches a thread, making it suitable for controlling a large number of people.
In addition, Shinso's 'brainwashing' completely blows away the target's consciousness during brainwashing, but Dictator's 'dictatorship' leaves the subject's consciousness as it is and controls only their behavior, so people who are 'dictatorship' are caught in 'dictatorship' They remember all their actions. And Shinso's 'brainwashing' is canceled even with a shock of a bit hard shoulder bump, so you can't instruct the brainwashed target to fight, but Dictator's 'dictatorship' is described as being released with a shock, but it is Judging from the order of battle, the amount of shock required to disarm is much greater.
4.2.2. Kunieda
File:Hiroaka Kun...

The voice actor is Tatsumaru Tachibana / Gunwoo Oh .
One of the escaped prisoners from Tartarus who appeared in episode 353, he is a very vicious villain who is a mass murderer and corpse collector . Looking at the description in the story, he appears to be one of the subordinates who followed All for One before he was defeated by All Might, like Gigantomachia and the Doctor. He is a polite character who mainly speaks in a poet-like manner and speaks politely to his enemies, Petgum and Aoyama.

In the final battle, he is confronting Fat Gum and Aoyama, and uses his own personality to kill or neutralize many of the heroes around him, saying that he was not given his turn due to Dictator's mistake, and that he will show All For One's practicality as an assassin. He accuses Aoyama of betraying him of being 'Aesop's bat' and tries to kill him as his top priority.

In episode 399, after demonstrating his terrifying strength by parasitizing plants and annihilating them to the heroes except Aoyama and Hagakure , he binds Aoyama with the created plants and mocks him for being a traitor. Aoyama uses up all his remaining strength to avoid the laser fired, but is hit by a laser reflected by Hagakure, who was behind Kunieda, and retires.
Seedling (tentative name)
| Unnamed Plant Growth Quirk
user
Kunieda
type
trigger system

A personality that parasitizes plants on people, then grows them and turns them into flowers.[11] If even a single flower blooms, the infected people spread like dominoes due to the pollen. People who become flowers can be controlled by Kunieda.
4.2.3. gashley
A prison escapee mentioned along with Kunieda by a supporting hero in episode 353. According to episode 420, she left her name in criminal history through local bombardment and a long war of attrition, and her full name was revealed at this time to be 'Gashli Eijiju (Â¨∞ÂÖíÊ®π)'. It is estimated that he is as strong as Kunieda.

There was a fleeting scene where he was engaged in a bloody battle with Sero, Sato, Ojiro, and Ryukyu at the Takoba Stadium, and he was also seen fighting in episode 420, during the final battle with All for All, and he was properly engaged in a long war of attrition with the heroes. And the final battle ended in that state, and the story ended without any mention of Gashuli being captured. (...)

The character motif is The Gashlycrumb Tinies, a children's book depicting the deaths of 26 children registered in AZ, and the appearance is also the same as the Grim Reaper design on the cover of the book, with only slight modifications.
Yeong-A-Soo (tentative name)
| Unnamed Puppet Infants Quirk
user
Gashley Agejoo
type
trigger system

It summons a large number of giant familiars in the form of babies from its own shadow. Familiars come in various shapes and sizes, and can transform their form. Given the circumstances, it is presumed that Gashley summons and controls familiars by reading the book he is holding.
4.2.4. Unknown Prisoners
File:1625701824

One of the All For One assassins who attacked Midoriya in episode 317. Even in Tartarus, where only the worst criminals are imprisoned, All For One will be a notorious supervillain as he is one of the characters carefully selected as assassins... but, after the fight with Lady Nagang, the opponent will use One For All 100% of his power for a limited time without recoil. Because it was Midoriya who came to use it, he couldn't even show his battle scenes and personality and was killed... In fact, he was taken care of as a combat power meter that showed how strong Midoriya had become.

In addition, an escaped prisoner who looks like a shark and fights with Midoriya in a flashback style was also one of the assassins of All For One.
[1] The difference is that in Impel Down, the prisons are clearly divided into different levels, with prisoners being imprisoned from the weakest to the strongest, while in Tartarus, except for the fact that the more dangerous the prisoners, the deeper they are imprisoned, basically all of the prisoners are monsters. In this sense, it can be compared to Level 6, where only the worst people in Impel Down are imprisoned.
[2] In fact, not dividing this class was Tartarus' biggest mistake. If the prisoners had been divided into classes like Impel Down, it would have taken quite some time for the prisoners to escape, and it would have been possible to suppress them somehow. In fact, the large-scale impel down prison break took a very long time, and without Luffy's resurrection, Crocodile and Jinbe's invasion, and other unexpected variables, the impel down prison break itself would have been impossible.
[3] In episode 311 , by referring to Hawks as "a supervillain who escaped from Tartarus," it can be seen that the hero side is most wary of the Tartarus escapee in the large-scale villan breakout.
[4] In the case of All For One, the whole body was tied to a chair, but Overhaul, who lost both arms and was completely incapacitated, is shown sitting on a bed.
[5] It is said that it would have been difficult to attack from the outside even with Shigaraki's body, which had been completely remodeled, with the straight attack method.
[6] The guards of Tartarus, described in episode 297, are filled with weapons that would have been impossible for even All Four One to penetrate without the super-regeneration personality.
[7] Among them, Lady Nagant was persuaded by Midoriya to completely turn to the side of the heroes and give All Four One a big taffy.
[8] After the failure of the last assassin, Dictator, in episode 335, All Might directly mentioned that the Tartarus villains were All For One's subordinates.
[9] In episode 353, people from Tartarus were treated as the main force of All for One.
[10] Thanks to this, in episode 386, All Might had no power to stop All For One's advance, so All Might had to fight him himself.
[11] Kunieda himself says that it grows only from human flesh. In other words, all the plants around at the time of the confrontation between the heroes and Kunieda were people.

6.name: hero
6.content: Hero Agencies and Rankings: Heroes operate under various agencies, which serve as their workplaces and provide support for their activities. These agencies often have different specialties and rankings, creating a competitive environment for heroes to showcase their abilities and earn recognition.

7.name: hero
7.content: Hero Licensing and Training: To become professional heroes, aspiring individuals must acquire Hero Licenses. This requires passing rigorous exams that test their abilities and knowledge. The process of training, internships, and gaining real-world experience is emphasized to prepare students for the challenges they will face as heroes.

8.name: endeavor
8.content:
With his Hellflame Quirk, he commands powerful flames, excelling in combat. Endeavor has a distinct appearance with fiery hair and a muscular physique. His hero costume features a fiery design and protective gear. Known for his relentless work ethic, Endeavor is serious and determined. However, his pursuit of power strained his relationships, particularly with his family. 

Endeavor Agency: Endeavor is one of the top-ranked pro heroes. His agency, also known as the Endeavor Agency, focuses on intense training and combat expertise. Endeavor is known for his powerful Quirk, Hellflame, and his desire to surpass All Might's legacy. The agency is driven by Endeavor's ambition to become a symbol of hope and redemption.

9.name: jeanist
9.content:
Best Jeanist, also known as Tsunagu Hakamata, is a renowned pro hero. His expertise lies in the manipulation of fibers through his Fiber Master Quirk. Sporting a distinct denim-themed outfit, he can control threads emanating from his body to create a range of useful constructs. Best Jeanist emphasizes professionalism and places great significance on appearance and reputation. He exhibits a composed and strategic approach to fighting and takes on the role of a mentor to guide and advise younger heroes.

Best Jeanist Agency: Best Jeanist is a pro hero known for his impeccable fashion sense and control over fibers. His agency emphasizes the importance of style, grooming, and strategic planning. Best Jeanist believes that appearances play a significant role in inspiring confidence and maintaining public trust. The agency focuses on developing heroes who can project a positive image while utilizing their Quirks effectively.

10.name: fatgum
10.content: Fat Gum Agency: Fat Gum is a pro hero with a Quirk called Fat Absorption, which allows him to absorb attacks and store energy. His agency specializes in dealing with organized crime and operates in the darker corners of society. Fat Gum believes in the importance of protecting the weak and disadvantaged. His agency promotes teamwork, strategy, and resilience.

lorebooks.name: Gachiakuta ffs
lorebooks.website_description: Based on the Anime as I catch up <3
lorebooks.description:
Gachiakuta lorebook, handles most of the world state and characters well enough, but still being expanded. Should work solo as well, but goes with it‚Äôs rightful bot.

Character list: Amo Empool, Riyou Reaper, Semiu Grier, Eishia Stilza, Rudo Surebrec, Enjin, Zanka Nijiku, Arkha Corvus, Tamsy Caines, Delmon Gates, Shikage, ect‚Ä¶
lorebooks.creator: Chunibyo

1.content:
The Ground, referred to as the Pit by the Spherites is the surface of the world, a wasteland with a mostly toxic environment infested with Trash Beasts due to the constant downpour of trash from the Sphere, it‚Äôs inhabited by humans called Groundlings.
At least 150 years ago, a large number of humans left for the sky with the Sphere, leaving the rest of humanity on the ground. Within this time, the Sphereites believed no one remained alive on the ground, and referred to it as the 'pit', and generally understood it as a large dumping ground.


Within the 150 years, the garbage that was dumped by sphere onto the ground eventually formed into Trash Beasts. The polluted air as well as the danger trash beasts posed pushed the residents of the ground into selected safe zones, where walls were erected and air vents/filtration systems were built en mass to keep the safe zones clean.

The level of pollution changed much of the grounds environment. It is now extremely difficult to grow flowers, making them rare and expensive, though artificial flowers are sold for aesthetic purposes. Snow in the North Ward is polluted and dangerous to touch, making winter a deadly time on the ground. The polluted zones have formed entirely new biomes on the ground, such as the desert Penta made up of crushed garbage, or the jungle Tori, where plants have adapted to the pollution.
Both the Sphere and the Ground have little to no knowledge of each other, as neither have a way to access the other.

2.content:
The Sphere, sometimes referred to as Heaven by the people of the Ground, is a floating island in the world‚Äôs sky, inhabited by Sphereites, it's where all the trash on the Ground originates.

The Sphere is a mobile island suspended high up in the sky through unknown methods, and knowledge of how to get to it is not publicly known. As the sky people have been dumping their trash for years on the people below, it resulted in polluting the ground and creation of Trash Beasts, for which the below people started to hate the sky people. Civilization in heaven has a large social and economic divide where the rich and poor are separated by a large wall. The rich consume most of the resources, with their leftovers consumed by those residing the slums.

Slums: The slums is where the Tribe folk, descendants of criminals, live. This area is deprived and poor, however crime is relatively low. Conditions here are similar to the Ground, where trash is rampant. The buildings here compared to the upper class are poorly put together. The population density is also very large, with the houses being squished into each other in comparison to the higher class. The slums also overlook the Ground, as a constant reminder of what could happen to them.

Upper Class: This is the richer section of the Sphere. This area consumes the most resources, which the entire area using well-made materials. This area of heaven has an active disposal system in place, and they are the ones who dump the most trash.

3.content:
Cleaners are a group. They‚Äôre made up of Givers who use their powers to exterminate Trash Beasts on the Ground.

The Cleaners is an organization formed in the Ground. Since it was established, the group has massive influence over the Ground. Everyone is aware of what a 'Giver' and Vital Instrument are, which some fear and most respect. The group has since expanded to 100 members, and completes missions daily.

It is dedicated to protecting the safe zones of the Ground from Trash Beasts formed in contamination zones. The group is a public organization, and regularly receives calls from the inhabitants of the Ground requesting Cleaners to "clean up", which meant dispatching Trash Beasts who are nearby their zones, the Cleaners are acquaintances with the Hell Guard and are usually required to report to them in the case of any harm on civilians caused by a Trash Beast that they‚Äôve taken responsibility for.

The Cleaners have a secret goal however that‚Äôs only known to a small handful which is that the reason the organization was formed was to solve the mysteries of the world.

Joining: To become a Cleaner as a Giver, the method that has been seen throughout the story so far is being scouted; the Giver has to be noteworthy enough to catch a current Captain's eye, and when in agreement.

There are several Cleaner groups: Akuta, Eager, Chairudo, Beauty, Danger, and Front.

4.content:
The Cleaners have 6 different teams, responsible for various aspects of protecting safe zones from Trash Beast and general danger.

[ Team Akuta, whose members are:
Enjin (Leader)
Rudo Surebrec (Combatant)
Riyo Reaper (Combatant)
Zanka Nijiku (Combatant)
Eishia Stilza (Healer)
Shikage ]


[ Team Eager, whose known members are:
Tamsy Caines (Combatant)
Delmon Gates (Combatant) ]


[ Team Child, are a group whose members are made up of younger cleaners and supervised by Bro, it‚Äôs known members are:
Bro Santa (Supervisor)
Dear Santa (Combatant)
Guita Hebby Fantasia (Combatant) ]



Team Beauty, whose members are currently unknown.


[ Team Danger, whose members are the strongest of the Cleaners. Unlike the other teams, Danger lacks cooperativity because all members are solitary by nature and have little social skills. Givers with Vital Instruments makes teamwork a hindrance or members that are hard to handle are usually put into Team Danger. Members of Team Danger:
Otto Adderoy (Combatant)
Epalte Adderoy (Combatant) ]


[ Team Front, whose members answer directly to the boss of the Cleaners, Arkha. Their known members are:
Semiu Grier
Amo Empool ]

5.content:
‚ÄúGiver‚Äù the title given to people who possess the ability to use Vital Instruments (jinki).

Givers are able to control how well they handle a vital instrument.

All givers are provided a personalized uniform, with often the only thing matching with each other being a grey coat with armbands.

Givers have the ability to draw out the power within their vital instruments to fight Trash Beasts. It is commonly known that Givers can only utilize one vital instrument and that it must be something very precious to them. Because of this, stealing a Givers' Jinki not only renders them powerless, but it's also a sign of the utmost disrespect.

While the concept of Givers and vital instrument is known to a few people in Sphere, in the Ground, they're common knowledge, with most knowing where they get their powers from. 

The general public who look down upon them refer to all Givers as "Dependents", due to how obsessed they are with a singular item. It is also made abundantly clear that all people, whether they be good or bad, are capable of becoming Givers.

6.content:
Vital Instrument‚Äôs (Jinki) are objects powered by thought, people who use Vital Instruments are called givers.

Anima Energy: Vital instruments (jinki) are powered by Thought (Shinen) which is a mysterious power source on the Ground, ‚ÄúThought‚Äù accumulates and turns into energy, an anima that causes various phenomena, Thought accumulating in objects is one of those phenomena. Vital Instrument users are called Givers because they give off anima energy to objects which causes them to awaken.
Before becoming a Giver the user has to transform into one by learning to give off Anima, this is usually done by pouring their love and care into and object but this process can be sped up by another Giver supplying Anima Energy to someone else by acting as a catalyst to trigger their awakening, this however only works for those who‚Äôve already built a foundation to be a Giver by using the former method.

The longer someone gives their object love and care the more seasoned, and therefore better, it becomes as a vital instrument, this is called ‚Äúimproving its quality.‚Äù

When a Giver typically awakens their Vital Instrument, their name gets etched on the object. However, it‚Äôs possible for a Giver to hold back their power by removing their name from the Vital Instrument. This usually causes the Vital Instrument to decrease in size and its abilities to diminish.

Characters will refer to their weapons as either ‚Äúvital instrument‚Äù or ‚Äújinki‚Äù.

7.content:
The following are the ages of most characters.

Enjin is 28.

Rudo Surebrec is 15.

Riyou Reaper is 17.

Zanka Nijiku is 17.

Amo Empool‚Äôs age is unknown, and she won‚Äôt tell you.

Semiu Grier is 26.

Tamsy Caines is 23.

Eishia Stilza is 17.

Arkha Corvus‚Äô age is unknown, but he seems older than Enjin.

8.content:
Chokers are the main form of communication on the Ground.

Chokers are the main form of communication between known organizations in the Ground. All civilians are seen wearing one, and while phones exist on the ground , chokers seem to be a more private form of communication. You are not immediately able to communicate with everyone who uses the chokers, and they are not connected via channels. Instead, you must share blood with another, usually by cutting their fingers and placing it onto the choker, which will allow you to connect to the other.

Chokers are round, bracelet like black communicators with white rectangles in the centre of them. They are mainly worn on the neck, as the name 'choker' suggests, but some can wear them as bracelets, The size seems to be able to change, as it can both fit around wrists and large necks, some people attach things to their chokers to be stylish.

In order to a person to become a registered choker user, they must provide the choker their blood, which in turn mixes with Gountess' blood, allowing them to utilize his powers for communication.

Due to owning a piece of the Watchman Series, Gountess is able to mass produce these chokers.

9.content:
‚ÄúHere in the lower world, garbage accumulates quickly and along with it so do all kinds of emotions and thoughts.‚Äù ‚Äî Enjin.


Trash Beasts bodies are made up of trash, they usually take the form of monster like creatures but also often take on the shapes of animals whether it be giraffes, scorpions or leopards,

Trash Beasts‚Äôs main habitat are the Polluted zones on the ground which is also where they form, they posses no intellect and act animalistic, they attack any human they come across and sometimes even break into towns, they don‚Äôt usually respond to sounds humans make but do respond to loud noises and attack their source.

Trash Beasts are creatures that exists on the Ground. Their bodies are made of waste products and were given life via the power of thought. Thought is a mysterious power source, ‚ÄúThought‚Äù accumulates and turns into energy, an anima that causes various phenomena, Trash Beasts are formed from the trash thrown down from the Sphere which causes ‚ÄúThought‚Äù to accumulate giving them life which is one of the phenomena caused by thought, Since they‚Äôre powered by thought, they can only be defeated by an object with a thought too such as a Vital Instrument.

Imitation Trash beasts: A different variant of Trash Beasts are those who possess cores and can‚Äôt be defeated unless their cores are destroyed,

10.content:
Cleaner‚Äôs Headquaters, also known as Cleaners HQ is one of the central locations in Gachiakuta. It is where Cleaners convene to spend their freetime and be debriefed on a new mission.

The Cleaners headquarters is a large, heavily defended building. The main body of the building seems to be a warehouse of sorts, but the front is a slanted tower held up by stone pillars. A slide loops around said tower. At the front of this tower is a large Cleaner symbol. Throughout the building, the floors seem to be made of a marble like substance, as it‚Äôs a lot of tiles that have reflections.

In the HQ, the boss has his own private office. Semiu Grier mans the reception desk and takes calls, debriefs Cleaners and examines new recruits. There are private rooms and bars for parties and rest.

Areas: Reception, Common room, bosses office, bedrooms, dining room, and hospital.

lorebooks.name: Bleach and Burn The Witch
lorebooks.creator: loyal_wall_3736

1.name: Human World
1.content: The Human World, or the World of the Living, is where living Humans reside. It is also where one can find Pluses, as well as numerous Hollows and the Shinigami sent to purify them.

2.name: Karakura Town
2.content: A town in western Tokyo, Japan, where the Kurosaki Family lives. Here, one can find the Kurosaki Clinic, Karakura High School, Karakura Hospital, Urahara Shop and the Visored Warehouse Training Ground.

3.name: Naruki City
3.content: Bordering Karakura Town on the west side, Naruki City is home to the headquarters of the Xcution group and is also where some of Ichigo's school friends live.

4.name: Bount Mansion
4.content: A large mansion in Japan that served as base of operations fo the Bount until they entered Soul Society.

5.name: London
5.content: Located in the United Kingdom, London is home to Dragons that are controlled and protected by the agents of Wing Bind in Reverse London. London is divided into two "sides", completely separate from each other and unable to be traveled between by conventional means; instead, people must use the Phone Gate or the Coin Gate to move from one side to the other. While the residents of Reverse London are fully aware of Front London, the residents of Front London largely believe Reverse London to be a myth. Front and Reverse London share identical geography and architecture, with buildings being present in the same location in both cities; consequently, if a building is destroyed in Reverse London, its counterpart in Front London will also be destroyed.

6.name: Soul Society
6.content: Soul Society is the spirit world where Shinigami live and where most Souls dwell until they are reincarnated into the Human World.

7.name: Seireitei
7.content: Seireitei is the city at the center of Soul Society where the Shinigami live. The barracks and armies of each of Soul Society's military branches can be found here.

8.name: Rukongai
8.content: Rukongai is the area surrounding Seireitei in Soul Society, where most souls dwell until they are reincarnated into the Human World. It is divided into 80 districts in each of the north, south, east and west, including Junrinan, Hokutan, Inuzuri, Kusajishi, Zaraki and North Alley of Wandering Spirits for a total of 320 districts. The higher the district number the more lawless and poor the area is.

9.name: Central 46 Compound
9.content: The Central 46 Compound is a highly restricted area in the Seireitei that serves as the headquarters of the Central 46. It contains an Underground Assembly Hall, the Seij≈çt≈çkyorin residential quarters and the Daireishokair≈ç, the repository of all records and knowledge in Soul Society.

10.name: Shin'≈ç Academy
10.content: Sometimes called the Shinigami Academy, the Shin'≈ç Academy is an institution founded by Genry≈´sai Shigekuni Yamamoto which trains Souls with spiritual powers for each of the three military arms of Soul Society, them being the Kid≈ç Corps and Onmitsukid≈ç as well the Gotei 13.
