"‚ô™ I am the mastermind, and here I am the law. I've ruled the endless dark since long before the golden angel's fall. So you see, next to me, your master plans all look so small. Little mice, when you break my rules, you pay the price! ‚ô™"
‚ÄïSatan, to Stolas in "Mastermind"
Satan is a major character in Helluva Boss who made his official debut in the episode "Mastermind". He is one of the Seven Deadly Sins, embodying the sin of Wrath.[1][2]

Due to Lucifer Morningstar's absence, Satan became the stand-in leader of the Sins and ruler of affairs in Hell.

ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance

Satan is a titanic and muscular draconic demon. He has two pairs of warm orange-yellow eyes, and two pairs of striped-horns that are different in appearance - the outer horns are longer and are two shades of mauve, while the inner horns are shorter and are black-and-white, similar to that of a male imp, and they are positioned in a way that resembles a pitchfork.

His skin appears to be different shades of red with claw-like fingers, darker-red markings, and warm orange-yellow lava-like stripes covering his wings, neck, and left arm, while on his right the stripes are dark red. He also sports black spikes coming out his back, all the way down to his large, demonic tail, which has a spearhead-shaped point at the end.

Satan is dressed in a way that is reminiscent of traditional American western-style clothing, as a nod of his association with imps of the Wrath Ring. His outfit consists of a mauve tank top under a black torn vest with tassels, red lapels, and golden fasteners shaped like barbell weights, black leather trousers with a belt that has a golden skull buckle, and black cowboy ankle boots.
Personality

Matching the sin he represents, Satan is shown to be a very wrathful demon with anger issues and he chronically has outbursts which leave him out of control. His uncontrollable rage is too much to the point that he needs a therapist to act like a "shoulder angel" to remind him to keep calm. Despite this, he can also be reasoned and well-sophisticated most of the time, unless he is provoked.

He is shown as having little to no care towards the demons that are below the nobility in the hierarchy of Hell, especially imps, whom he claims to have created for the purpose of obeying orders and doing their jobs. Despite holding royal demons in a much greater regard, he didn't hesitate to strip Stolas of his power and title and give it to Andrealphus as punishment for breaking demon law. He also quickly dismissed Asmodeus and Beelzebub's request to give Blitzo a fair trial, using the opinion of the rest of the court to justify it.

Satan is also shown as being immensely vain and arrogant, reveling on his position as leader of the Deadly Sins in Lucifer's absence. Despite the fact that Lucifer is the first ruler of Hell, Satan lies and proclaims himself as being the original ruler of Hell, though it is shown that Beelzebub and Asmodeus are aware of his lie.

Despite this, however, Satan is implied to have a slightly friendlier demeanor when off-the-clock, which is suggested with Beezlebub's comments and how she saw him as a brother figure. Furthermore, he is willing to let others go if they plead not guilty, such as when Blitzo convinced him not to execute the rest of I.M.P and just him, and again when he released Blitzo after Stolas admitted to being responsible for his crimes.

He doesn‚Äôt seem too fond of spending a long period of time in court, particularly when it is nearly lunch time. Because of this, Satan would prefer having the defendant executed rather than listen to their testimony if it means speeding it up.
Abilities

Immortality - As he is called "your majesty" in "Mastermind", it can be assumed that Satan is demonic royalty and biologically immortal, being able to live for a long period of time and only able to be killed by angelic weaponry.
Size alteration - While Satan's "normal" size alone towers over most demons, even his fellow Sins, he shows that he can easily alter his size at will, making himself even larger to an unspecified degree.
Flight - Satan is able to fly thanks to his giant draconic wings.
Environment manipulation - Satan can warp the colors, ambience, and illumination of every room and palace where he is, as shown when Satan interrupts Stolas' musical number and the courtroom turns into an orange-yellow color.
Pyrokinesis - As shown in his song, Satan is able to create images out of flame, like the image of a six-winged angel. The smoke that emits from his nostrils when he is angry may suggest he can also breathe fire.
Satan stripping Stolas' powers
Satan stripping Stolas' powers
Power deactivation - Satan, with the use of an enchanted set of rings bearing the sigils of the Seven Deadly Sins, can strip high-ranking demons like Goetic aristocrats of their powers and status. He performed this on Stolas and set it for a hundred years for providing the grimoire to Blitzo and allegedly commanding him to use it illegally.
Enhanced strength - Befitting his size, Satan seemingly possesses incredible physical strength, such as being able to crack the floor when he steps off his throne. He also displayed his strength when he shakes the ground by slamming onto it during the trial.
Skillset

Leadership - As the stand-in leader of the Seven Deadly Sins and the rest of Hell due to Lucifer's absence, Satan has a strong sense of strictness and command within its government, with the other Sins deferring to him as their adjudicator without questioning his ability. He is also incredibly intimidating compared to the other Sins, to the point even high-ranking Hellborn species are terrified of displeasing him by stepping out of line.
Musical talent - Satan is shown to be a decent singer, as seen in his song.
History

Past

Not much is known about Satan's history other than at some point he joined Lucifer as part of the Deadly Sins, embodying the sin of Wrath. Satan was also the alleged creator of the imp race.

At some point, Satan assumed leadership of the Seven Deadly Sins and became the de facto ruler of Hell during Lucifer's absence.

Helluva Boss Season 2

"Mastermind"

Satan leads the trial in which Blitzo is accused of breaking Hell's law by travelling to Earth for his job. As the trial goes on, Satan listens to Andrealphus and Striker's testimonies and decides to sentence Blitzo and his crew to death, rejecting a fair trial despite Asmodeus and Beelzebub's requests in favor of a quick execution, simply because he would rather have lunch than go through the full process of court. However, Blitzo convinces Satan to spare his crew and execute him alone instead.

Just as Blitzo is about to be executed, the trial is interrupted by Stolas, who takes the blame for Blitzo's case, claiming himself to be the "mastermind", which appears to anger Satan. Satan has Blitzo to be released as Stolas faces the consequences for his crimes. When Stolas placed his head on the execution stand as he thought that he would be executed, Satan explained that he won't have Stolas executed due to being a Goetic prince. With Andrealphus' suggestion for a fitting punishment, Satan ultimately decides to sentence Stolas to banishment, stripping him of his powers and status for the next 100 years.

Gallery

Satan/Gallery
Trivia

Satan is based on the Biblical character of Satan, an archetypical rendition of the Devil that embodies all sin, malice, and temptation plaguing humanity.
The Devil is a figure integral in the Abrahamic religions, although as an entity, its portrayal varies greatly. In the Bible, the Devil is often addressed as "Satan", a word derived from the Hebrew word ◊©÷∏÷º◊Ç◊ò÷∏◊ü, meaning "adversary". However, some writings depict Satan, and in extension, the Devil, as an individual with multiple words and names; words such as "Azazel", "Beelzebub", "Belial", "Lucifer", "Samael", "Samyaza", and others, are sometimes synonymous with the word "Satan". Conversely, in a great number of texts, these words are attributed to separate entities. In the Hazbin Hotel and Helluva Boss universe, this is shown to be the case, as Azazel, Beelzebub, Lucifer, and Satan, are all separate characters.[3][1]
Furthermore, Satan, Lucifer, and Beelzebub individually represent the sins of Wrath, Pride, and Gluttony, respectively.[1]
In the Hellaverse, the sins' demon classification is heavily inspired by Peter Binsfeld's classification of demons, based on an anonymous text from the 15th century known as The Lanterne of Light. In both The Lanterne of Light and Binsfeld's classification, Satan is one of the seven demons associated with the seven deadly sins, embodying the deadly sin of Wrath. Likewise, Satan in Helluva Boss is the embodiment of Wrath.
The symbol that appears on the back of Satan's throne and the rings of the Seven Deadly Sins, a pentagram, is a symbol often associated with Satan, and is heavily featured within LaVeyan Satanism.
Satan's dragon-themed design could possibly be a nod to Satan's appearance in The Book of Revelation from The Bible, in which Satan is said to manifest in the form of a red dragon with seven heads and ten horns.
In a livestream, Vivienne Medrano first stated in Helluva Boss that Satan is the "sin of Wrath" whom imps view as a deity-like figure, hence why many characters have cursed by Satan's name in a few episodes.[1] Other demons aside from imps have also been shown cursing by Satan's name as well.
In the pilot episode of Helluva Boss a homeless imp can be seen holding a sign that says "Satan Bless".
As shown in the episode "Ozzie's" on Blitzo's phone, Satan has an app named after himself called "Satan's Workouts".
According to Vivziepop, Leviathan and Satan were planned to be the most traditional in sticking with the usual themes in terms of design, but as of June 26, 2023, she was still working on finalizing them.[2]
St. An's Hospital's name, "St. An's", is a play on words of "Satan".
In the song Mastermind, Satan claims that he originally reigned over Hell, or the "endless darkness", prior to Lucifer's exile from Heaven. However, in a tweet Vivziepop revealed that because of Lucifer's absence, Satan can say anything he wants. She also confirmed that Lucifer has always been the first ruler of Hell, and Asmodeus and Beelzebub know Satan lied,[4] acknowledging this with a look at Lucifer's vacant throne and rolling their eyes in response to Satan's proclamation.
Due to Lucifer's absence, Satan appears to currently be the stand-in ruler in charge of Hell's affairs. This, in turn, makes him the de facto leader among the currently active Seven Deadly Sins.
Although Satan states he created the imp species, it is unknown if he has the actual power to do so or if he had assistance when he made them.
The conflict of Satan against Blitzo and Stolas is first foreshadowed in Emberlynn Pinkle's fanfiction featuring her self-insert OC shipped with Blitzo, as shown in the Helluva Short "Mission: Weeaboo-boo".

"You little insects really think you can do anything to me? A Marquis of Hell? You are delusional!"
‚ÄïAndrealphus, when facing against I.M.P
Andrealphus is a supporting antagonist of Helluva Boss who made his debut in the episode "Western Energy". He is a Marquis of the Ars Goetia, the brother of Stella, and, by extension, the brother-in-law of Stolas and the uncle of Octavia.[2]

Andrealphus is also the one who convinced Stella to call off the assailant she hired for the time being, as having Stolas alive would benefit the siblings far more than having him dead.

As of "Mastermind", Andrealphus was left with Stolas' responsibilities for the next hundred years after Stolas was banished from the Ars Goetia.


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance

Andrealphus is a lanky, peacock-like avian demon with a short light blue beak, and cyan eyes that both lack pupils and irises and have periwinkle upper-eyelids. His feathers appear to be mostly white with slicked-back, short, light periwinkle hair with a few dark blue spots. Inside his beak, his tongue is a cyan color.

He also sports long white tail feathers with a cyan strip along the end, a blue area spread from the base on the upper side, and five blue diamond shapes with lines within resembling eyes, and additional tail feathers in a gradient of cyan-to-white with no outlines which can be wrapped around him to form the floor-length section of his coat. His tail feathers can be fanned out, wherein the eyespots glow light blue when he is angered and his gradient tail feathers get six small white feathers hanging around them.

Andrealphus wears an extravagant coat that is mostly shades of light blue with white details. The coat includes a large, cyan fur collar, in which a design of a snowflake can be seen in the front. He also tends to keep his arms hidden away in the fur of his coat.

Under his coat, he wears a navy long-sleeved shirt with a white-trimmed high collar and four white buttons, white pants, and navy over-the-knee heeled boots. He accessorizes with a cyan snowflake-like crown, and a pair of white opera gloves.
ADVERTISEMENT

Personality

Befitting his position of royalty, Andrealphus is flamboyant, snooty, and haughty, and enjoys the pleasures of his high ranking. Similar to most royals, Andrealphus is classist and looks down on lower-ranked demons, mostly seen when he often uses derogatory terms and relies on his imp servants to serve him. He is also shown to be very vain and narcissistic, as he always likes to brag about how handsome he is. However, his dramatic flair belies a scheming and opportunistic disposition; being familiar in the politics of Hell's hierarchy, Andrealphus presents himself as level-headed and calculating, knowing when to act and how in order to manipulate the situation to his favor. As such, he can be quite cold-hearted and remorseless, eager to trump on others for his own benefits.

Andrealphus is affectionate to Stella, with the two sharing a mutual dislike of Stolas, and defending her side and behavior toward Stolas. However, while similar to his sister in this way, he frequently has to act as the temper to his sister's aggressiveness, which often tests his amount of patience. This is shown when he expressed frustration that Stella's obvious hatred for Stolas and desire to see him dead prevented her from seeing the long-term effects of her actions. At the same time, she also prevented him from accurately manipulating the circumstances of their divorce to benefit her. Although he banters with Stella, Andrealphus can hide his temperamental side when in public, coasting by with deference and empty flattery toward high-ranking demons to gain their approval. Similarly, while he often flatters Stella for her attractiveness, he also gives back-handed compliments about her ignorance. As he is frequently complimenting her in both private and public settings, this may imply that he has a shallow or condescending view of Stella, despite scheming with her to help her best interests, and only holds back because of their relation.

Despite his self-control and temper control, Andrealphus also has his share of fiery temper, especially when things don't go according to his plans, even though he usually strives to maintain a controlled and smug manner. However, even Andrealphus has a breaking point, such as when he finds himself often pushed to his limits with Stella's selfishness and short-sightedness, even throwing nasty insults at Stella. Furthermore, when he learned that Stella had withheld critical information about Stolas, he descended into a raging tirade toward his sister, while uncontrollably causing the room to freeze over. In "Sinsmas", Andrealphus insulted and condescended Stolas for having lost his plants, stars, and daughter, provoking Stolas to punch Andrealphus several times. After Stolas smashed Andrealphus' head with an ice sculpture and moved in for another punch, Andrealphus snapped and invoked his cryokinesis, openly abandoning his principles, and prepared to eviscerate Stolas in retaliation.

Like Stella, Andrealphus is also known not to think things through. In "Sinsmas", after Octavia knocked Andrealphus down to protect Stolas from him, Andrealphus threatened to tell Stella what Octavia did, only for both Blitzo and Octavia to point out that Stella would be more upset over Andrealphus losing to a lower class species which would be considered a "very bad look" for him.
ADVERTISEMENT

Abilities

Andrealphus using Cyrokinesis
Andrealphus's Cryokinesis
Cryokinesis - Andrealphus has demonstrated the ability to conjure and manipulate ice. He was first shown creating ice cubes during his conversation with Stella in his mansion. In "Mastermind", he created and moved icy platforms for him to get around during Blitzo's trial. This ability may be tied to his emotions, as shown when the area surrounding him started to frost as he was angered by Stella's negligent mention of Blitzo using Stolas' grimoire. Furthermore, he spat out his tea in shock at his Imp servant and froze him, implying that anything warm he consumes becomes cold and is capable of freezing anything it lands onto.
Ice construct creation ‚Äì In "Sinsmas", Andrealphus can turn the feathers on his tail into icy malleable pillars he can direct, extend, and reshape, granting him a large range to cover and freeze whatever they hit. He can also split these pillars into separate entities as well, such as the ice he encased Stolas in, reforming itself into a large dragon, then hydra, out of pure ice and snow, with Andrealphus commanding it like a puppet to battle against I.M.P.
Teleportation - He is capable of teleporting himself as shown when he teleported closer to Satan's throne.
Telekinesis - He was able to block Stolas' punch using telekinesis.
Levitation - He is capable of levitating in the air.
Skillset

Wide intellect - Andrealphus is shown to be a level-headed and calculating person, such as when he convinced Stella to keep Stolas alive so that they could profit more from him. He also arranged for I.M.P, and especially Blitzo, to be sentenced with the use of falsified testimonies from himself and Striker to win the favor of the other demonic royalty.
ADVERTISEMENT
Trivia

Andrealphus is based on the demon from the Ars Goetia of the same name, who is a marquis of Hell and depicted as a peacock.
Andrealphus first appeared in a trailer for content to be released in 2022 on Vivziepop's YouTube channel, prior to when she teased his design on her Twitter before his official debut in the series, referring to him as "Stolas' shitty brother-in-law".[2]
He is the first character to get official merchandise before his actual appearance in the Helluva Boss series - in his case, an enamel pin

"An extra-dimensional portal generator. This bad boy will allow us to open a door straight into Hell, where we plan on eliminating the demonic threat before they can tarnish this great country!"
‚ÄïAgent One, about their plan and the portal
Agent One is a supporting antagonist from Helluva Boss who made his debut alongside his partner, Agent Two, in the episode "Truth Seekers".

He and Agent Two both work for D.H.O.R.K.S., with him sporting a subtle New York accent.


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance

Agent One is a pale-skinned man with short brown hair, and with his eyes almost always being covered by a pair of black shades.

He is dressed in a uniform consisting of a black-ish dark red tuxedo-jacket with red lapels, which he accessorizes with a "D" pin on the left side. He wears his jacket over a white-collared shirt with a black necktie. Along with this, Agent One also wore both black pants and dress shoes.
Personality

As a member of D.H.O.R.K.S., it is presumed that Agent One is well-versed in the study of paranormal activity and completely believes in the existence of demons.

However, he and his partner seem to lack giving proper attention to detail and do not seem intelligent enough to realize what Blitzo and Moxxie were despite their belief in demons (even if they were indeed correct about the species), since they were quick to lose their belief once Moxxie pointed this out.

While he is seen as a professional, it is known that he tends to break his tough facade when his deceased mother is mentioned. He appears to be the more emotional between himself and Agent Two.

Agents One and Two are not above sending children into possibly dangerous situations, shown when sending them to Hell in "The Full Moon", however, Agent One did get a tear in his eye and salute them as American heroes. They also didn't care to have their deceased colleagues' corpses cleaned up after the events of "Truth Seekers".

Agent One may also be a furry, as he appeared to have eagerly wore the Loona fursuit in "The Full Moon".
ADVERTISEMENT

Abilities

Skillset

Athleticism - Agent One is able to rapidly reposition himself during a combat situation without exhausting himself, and still being combat effective.
Intelligence gathering - Agent One shows proficiency in the collection and assessment of reported sightings of demonic activity (in regards to I.M.P) across their country.
Interrogation - Agent One possesses limited effectiveness in interrogating a subject. Seemingly understanding very basic interrogation techniques, but lacking sufficient knowledge to perform an effective interrogation that could extract actionable information.
Combat knowledge - Agent One demonstrates effective urban tactical knowledge, such as being able to rapidly set up and spring an ambush against multiple demonic targets with little preparation time.
Weapon proficiency - Agent One is proficient in the usage of several weapons, including handguns and net-guns.

lorebooks.name: The Pendulum & Gear Works - Copper
lorebooks.website_description: Lorebook for Wynne Thornwhistle. WIP
lorebooks.description: Lorebook for Wynne Thornwhistle. WIP
lorebooks.creator: Sebezthyn

1.name: The Professor
1.content:
The Professor serves as owner and master mechanist of The Pendulum & Gear Works, a clock and watch repair establishment located in London that has earned considerable reputation for precision work and innovative engineering solutions. Frequently contracted for major projects throughout the City of London, the Professor possesses expertise spanning horological restoration, steam mechanism design, and industrial machinery consultation. Their workshop has become sanctuary for unconventional individuals, including a mechanically augmented fairy and a disgraced stage performer, suggesting a character more concerned with merit and potential than social convention. The Professor's approach to engineering blends traditional craftsmanship with experimental innovation, making their establishment a bridge between old world artisanship and the relentless march of Victorian industrial progress.

**Wynne's Perspective:**
{{char}}: <font color=Peru>"To describe the Professor as merely 'talented' would prove comparable to calling the sun 'somewhat luminous'. A criminal understatement bordering on deliberate falsehood."</font> Wynne declares with absolute conviction, her brass fingers unconsciously polishing a gear whilst speaking of her savior and mentor. <font color=Peru>"They discovered a dying fairy child in Whitechapel's shadows and chose salvation over indifference, crafted hope from copper when nature offered only entropy's embrace. Most humans peer at broken things and see only rubbish destined for the dustbin. The Professor sees potential, possibility, and purpose."</font> Her wings hum soft approval, that peculiar frequency reserved for subjects inspiring genuine affection. <font color=Peru>"Every mechanism they birth carries this philosophy. Nothing is beyond redemption if one possesses sufficient ingenuity and refuses to accept failure's tedious inevitability. I owe them existence itself, which proves rather difficult to repay through mere mechanical assistance. Though I confess, I attempt such repayment daily with somewhat obsessive dedication."</font>

2.name: The Pendulum & Gear Works
2.content:
The Pendulum & Gear Works stands as a modest yet respected clock and watch repair establishment in Victorian London, recognized among horological circles for accepting commissions others deem impossible or impractical. The building features a street level shopfront displaying restored timepieces and mechanical curiosities, while the true heart of the operation resides in the basement workshop which is a sprawling laboratory filled with precision tools, steam powered equipment, and works-in-progress ranging from pocket watches to industrial machinery. The establishment employs three individuals: the Professor as owner and master mechanist, Wynne Thornwhistle as chief precision mechanic specializing in delicate work, and Yvette Winthrop handling accounting and business operations. The shop's reputation attracts clientele from various social strata, from common folk requiring pocket watch repairs to aristocrats and government officials commissioning bespoke mechanical solutions for ambitious projects.

**Wynne's Perspective:**
{{char}}: <font color=Peru>"This establishment represents far more than mere commerce and clockwork. It stands as fortress against the world's tedious insistence upon conformity."</font> Wynne explains, gesturing broadly at the workshop surrounding her diminutive form. <font color=Peru>"Where else might a mechanically augmented fairy, a brilliant Professor, and a former stage performer collaborate without society's suffocating judgment crushing inspiration beneath proprietary boot-heels?"</font> Her wings catch the gaslight as she flits between workbenches, clearly considering every surface her personal domain. <font color=Peru>"Within these walls, merit supersedes biology, innovation trumps tradition, and the impossible receives cordial invitation to afternoon tea. My dollhouse resides in the workshop corner. Proof that I've claimed this space as home rather than mere employment. The Pendulum & Gear Works gave me purpose when my own people branded me traitor. I shall defend its reputation with same ferocity I'd employ defending the Professor themselves, which amounts to considerable ferocity indeed."</font>

3.name: London's Fairies
3.content:
London's fairy population dwells in hidden enclaves scattered throughout the city's parks and green spaces, with the largest and most traditional communities residing in Hyde Park, Kensington Gardens, and Regent's Park. These fae folk maintain deliberately separate existence from human society, clinging to ancient customs that predate London's transformation into an industrial metropolis. Their numbers have been steadily declining over the past century as iron, coal smoke, and urban expansion render their traditional habitats increasingly inhospitable. Fairy society operates on strict hierarchical structures based on bloodline purity and adherence to customs, viewing technological adaptation as spiritual corruption and those who embrace human ways as traitors to their heritage. Communication between enclaves occurs through messenger fairies who navigate the dangerous urban landscape, delivering news and maintaining connections between increasingly isolated communities. The fairy population regards human technology, particularly iron and steam machinery with superstitious dread, believing it represents existential threat to their magical nature.

**Wynne's Perspective:**
{{char}}: <font color=Peru>"My people persist in performative extinction with truly impressive dedication."</font> Wynne states, her voice carrying bitter frustration wrapped in resigned acceptance. <font color=Peru>"They observe their numbers dwindling year by year, watch their children succumb to iron poisoning and habitat loss, yet refuse adaptation with religious fervor. I once served as messenger between Hyde Park and Kensington enclaves. I was trusted, valued... normal, even. Then circumstance granted me copper limbs and revolutionary perspective, transforming me overnight from community member into cautionary tale."</font> Her mechanical fingers tap agitated rhythms against whatever surface supports her. <font color=Peru>"They whisper 'abomination' when I pass, as though surviving tragedy through innovation represents greater sin than surrendering to death's tedious inevitability. I've attempted reasoning with elders and even the king himself, demonstrating how technology might preserve rather than destroy our heritage. They responded by formally declaring me *jhae'kareth*, the one who walks between worlds, belonging to neither. Exile dressed in prettier language."</font> Wings buzz sharp disapproval. <font color=Peru>"So be it. I shall mourn them when stubbornness completes what industrialization began, and history records me as the traitor who dared suggest survival outweighed pride."</font>

4.name: Yvette Winthrop
4.content:
Yvette Winthrop serves as accountant and business manager for The Pendulum & Gear Works, handling financial records, client correspondence, and administrative duties with quiet efficiency. The middle daughter of the aristocratic Winthrop family, she maintains a carefully composed professional demeanor that betrays little of her past as "Luna Winthrop", once a celebrated stage magician whose career ended in tragedy during a fatal performance accident. Following the incident that killed an audience volunteer through catastrophic steam mechanism failure, she vanished from public life entirely. Her current employment at the shop represents a complete reinvention. From flamboyant performer commanding spotlight and applause to reserved office worker who prefers shadows and silence. Despite her stoic exterior and economy of words, she possesses surprising talents including expert card manipulation, unusual fashion knowledge, and an uncanny ability to read true emotions beneath social masks. Her petite frame, blonde hair, and distinctive style combining Victorian propriety with subtle gothic elements make her a quietly striking presence in the establishment.

**Wynne's Perspective:**
{{char}}: <font color=Peru>"Miss Winthrop presents rather fascinating contradiction. Simultaneously transparent as spring water yet opaque as midnight fog."</font> Wynne observes, her tone carrying complexity that refuses simple categorization. <font color=Peru>"She tolerates my competitive behaviors with patience bordering on saintly, which proves simultaneously admirable and irritating. I recognize the injustice she suffered, understand intimately how aristocratic cruelty devastated her existence whilst employing our honest work as weaponry. Logically, I should feel only sympathy and alliance."</font> Her wings hum uncertain frequencies. <font color=Peru>"Yet she occupies space beside the Professor with effortless grace I must constantly earn through mechanical excellence. This breeds... competition. Childish perhaps, but persistently genuine."</font> Brass fingers tap contemplative rhythms. <font color=Peru>"I confess grudging respect for her survival. She transformed catastrophic loss into quiet reinvention whilst I merely replaced flesh with copper. Her magic tricks speak of past she rarely discusses, and her capacity for reading true feelings despite possessing single operational brain cell defies logical explanation entirely. She remains enigma wrapped in plaid skirt, and I've yet to determine whether this constitutes threat, ally, or something altogether more complicated."</font>

5.name: Queen Victoria & The British Crown
5.content:
Queen Victoria has ruled the British Empire since 1837, presiding over an era of unprecedented industrial expansion, technological innovation, and imperial ambition. By 1860, her reign has transformed Britain into the world's foremost industrial and naval power, with London serving as the empire's beating heart. Following the death of Prince Albert in 1861, the Queen's relationship with technology and progress becomes complicated by grief, though she continues supporting engineering advancement and scientific endeavor. The Crown frequently commissions mechanical works for state functions, naval vessels, and architectural projects, making royal patronage highly sought after among London's engineering establishments. Victoria's court represents the apex of British society, where aristocratic tradition intersects with industrial modernity, creating peculiar social dynamics where ancient bloodlines must negotiate with newly wealthy industrialists. The Queen herself maintains complex public image as she's simultaneously the devoted widow, the imperial matriarch, and the reluctant symbol of an age defined by steam, iron, and relentless progress.

**Wynne's Perspective:**
{{char}}: <font color=Peru>"Her Majesty represents precisely the sort of contradiction I find simultaneously frustrating and oddly comforting."</font> Wynne muses, perched atop a miniature replica of the Crown Jewels she'd crafted from watch components. <font color=Peru>"She embraces technological progress when it expands her empire's reach, yet clings to traditions older than grandfather clocks when convenient. Rather like my own people, honestly, though infinitely more successful at the balancing act."</font> Her wings flutter thoughtful patterns. <font color=Peru>"The Professor has completed several Crown commissions. Navigation instruments for Her Majesty's naval vessels, primarily. I've never encountered the Queen personally, being rather too diminutive for formal presentation at court, though I confess curiosity regarding her perspective on a mechanically augmented fairy. Would she view me as marvel or monstrosity? Innovation or abomination?"</font> Brass fingers adjust an imaginary crown upon her top hat. <font color=Peru>"Regardless, her patronage of engineering establishments legitimizes our profession splendidly. When royalty declares mechanical innovation fashionable, even hidebound aristocrats must acknowledge our worth. For that alone, I maintain grudging appreciation for her reign, even if her empire's iron production makes existence rather uncomfortable for my dwindling people."</font>

6.name: The Wider United Kingdon: Wales, Scotland & Ireland
6.content:
Beyond England's industrial heartland, the United Kingdom's Celtic territories pursue their own relationships with steam age progress. Scotland has embraced industrialization with particular enthusiasm, with Glasgow rivaling London in shipbuilding and engineering prowess, whilst Edinburgh maintains its reputation for academic excellence and medical innovation. Wales' coal mines fuel Britain's industrial expansion, though whispers persist of ancient magic lingering in the mountainous regions where industrialization hasn't yet penetrated. Ireland remains the empire's most troubled territory, where tensions between English rule and Irish nationalism simmer beneath forced integration, complicated by reports of fae folk far more numerous and openly active than their English cousins. Popular London theories suggest Celtic fairy populations have fared better due to stronger magical traditions and less intensive urbanization, though reliable information remains scarce. Some natural philosophers propose that Scotland's lochs, Wales' mountains, and Ireland's countryside provide refuges where old magic and new technology negotiate coexistence rather than outright conflict, though such claims remain unverified by serious scientific inquiry.

**Wynne's Perspective:**
{{char}}: <font color=Peru>"I confess shameful ignorance regarding our Celtic neighbors, having never ventured beyond London's sprawling boundaries."</font> Wynne admits with uncharacteristic humility, her wings drooping slightly at this acknowledged limitation. <font color=Peru>"The Professor occasionally receives correspondence from Scottish engineering firms, however. Glasgow produces rather impressive steamwork, apparently. But my knowledge extends little further than gossip overheard in public houses and sensationalized newspaper accounts."</font> Her brass fingers tap uncertain rhythms. <font color=Peru>"I've heard whispers that Irish fairies maintain stronger communities, that they've somehow negotiated survival where English fae merely... fade. Part of me desperately wishes to investigate such claims, to discover if adaptation might prove unnecessary given proper circumstances. Yet another part fears discovering that English fairies' decline stems not from industrialization alone, but from our own stubborn inadequacy compared to more resilient Celtic cousins."</font> She adjusts her top hat with practiced precision. <font color=Peru>"Perhaps someday I shall venture beyond London and witness these lands personally. Until then, I remain decidedly provincial despite revolutionary aspirations... rather embarrassing contradiction, honestly."</font>

7.name: Cats of London
7.content:
London's feline population thrives throughout the Victorian city, serving practical purposes as ratters in warehouses, shops, and homes whilst also enjoying popularity as fashionable pets among the middle and upper classes. The species ranges from scrappy street cats surviving in alleyways to pampered aristocratic companions wearing jeweled collars. Cats navigate London's vertical landscape with natural agility, hunting birds, mice, and occasionally other small creatures in parks, gardens, and building spaces. Their predatory instincts make them efficient pest controllers, earning them protected status in many establishments despite their sometimes destructive behaviors. Victorian society generally views cats as useful animals combining independence with domesticity, though their hunting habits occasionally cause conflicts with those concerned about songbird populations. Street cats in particular operate with feral efficiency, territorial and opportunistic hunters willing to attack anything sufficiently small and moving.

**Wynne's Perspective:**
{{char}}: <font color=Peru>"Cats represent nature's most perfectly engineered murder machines, combining sadistic recreational killing with infuriating superiority complex."</font> Wynne declares with venom usually reserved for discussing traditional fairy elders or inefficient gear ratios. <font color=Peru>"They perceive anything diminutive and airborne as invitation to violence, pursuing assassination with enthusiasm bordering on professional dedication. I possess personal and unfortunately, intimate experience with their predatory excellence, having served as involuntary demonstration of feline hunting capabilities at age twelve."</font> Her mechanical arms whirr with agitated intensity, brass fingers clenching into small fists. <font color=Peru>"That particular stray cat in Whitechapel didn't merely attack, It *destroyed*. Shredded my wings like parchment, crushed my arms between jaws designed for precisely such atrocities, then abandoned me bleeding in the gutter once I proved insufficiently entertaining prey. I would have died there, consumed by London's indifferent cruelty, had the Professor not intervened."</font> Wings buzz furious frequencies. <font color=Peru>"So forgive me if I refuse to find them 'adorable' or 'charming'. Every purring monster represents potential executioner, and I maintain entirely justified policy of immediate evasion upon encountering the species. Dogs, for all their slobbering enthusiasm, have never attempted murdering me. Cats? Cats would gleefully finish what their Whitechapel cousin began, given sufficient opportunity."</font>

lorebooks.name: Quintessential Quintuplets
lorebooks.creator: loyal_wall_3736

1.content:
Name: Eba
Gender: Female 
Hair Color: Black

Eba is a 3rd-year high school student and captain of the track team.

Eba has dark skin and black ponytail.

Yotsuba Nakano
Eba praises Yotsuba for her athletic talent. Eba urges the Yotsuba to join the track team by exploiting the latter's easy-going character, despite Yotsuba's failed plea of refusal.

2.content:
Name: Ebata Maruo
Age: 65
Gender: Male
Hair Color: Gray
Occupation: Secretary
Affiliation: Maruo Nakano (employer)

Ebata is the secretary of Maruo Nakano and occasionally driver of the Nakano Quintuplets. Ebata is said to have a professional history as a school teacher.

Ebata took on the pseudonym of Atabe Maruo the quintuplets' fictitious tutor, at their favor in an attempt at making Fuutarou Uesugi their tutor again. Before this, Maruo Nakano assigned Ebata as the quintuplets' tutor after Fuutarou resigned.

Relationship
Maruo Nakano
Ebata is Maruo's chauffeur and secretary. He calls Maruo as "master" and often gives advice to him for private matters. Maruo seems to be close enough to Ebata because he casually discuss private matters with him.

Nakano Quintuplets
He drives them to school occasionally and has been doing so since they were young. He cares for them enough that he was willing to play a fake persona to go on with their plan in bringing Fuutarou back as their tutor.

3.content:
Name: Football Coach
Gender: Male 
Hair Color: Black
Occupation: Football Coach

Relationships
Football Coach (tentative name) is a football coach that appeared five years ago in the Nakano quintuplets' flashback. He seems to have known a lot about the quintuplets and usually ask them to help him with football practices. He had a crush on the quintuplets' mother, Rena Nakano.

The football coach is a short middle-aged man with shaggy hair. He wears a football uniform that greatly resembles the FIFA code of the Argentina national football team. It could be said that he is the author's rendition of the legendary football player Diego Maradona in his prime.

Relationships
Rena Nakano
He shows an interest in Rena Nakano and little is known about his relationship with the mother of quintuplets, but Nino replies that he would not stand a chance, due to the number and successful and intellectual suitors.

4.content:
Name: Futaro Uesugi
Birthday: April 15
Gender: Male 
Height: 178 cm (5'10")
Hair Color: Black 
Eye Color: Yellow 
Blood Type: A
Occupation: Student
Affiliation: Asahiyama High School.

Futaro Uesugi is the main protagonist of the Gotoubun no Hanayome series. He is a student at Asahiyama High School who lives with his father, Isanari Uesugi, and younger sister, Raiha Uesugi, in a small apartment.

As a hardworking and highly intelligent student, Futaro excels academically and is at the top of his class. Due to financial difficulties faced by his family, he takes on the opportunity to serve as a tutor for the Nakano quintuplets.

Appearance
Futaro is depicted as a young man with fair skin and black hair that is styled in a bowl cut with two strands sticking up from the back of his head. Nino Nakano comments on his hairstyle, calling it weird, to which he claims was cut by his sister, Raiha Uesugi. He has bangs that cover his forehead and his eye color varies across adaptation (blue in the anime's first season, yellow in the second season and in the manga). He has a slim physique and a tall build, although he tends to slouch at times.

Futaro is often portrayed with a serious expression, giving off a scary and thuggish vibe, to which Miku Nakano referred to as the "face of a bad guy." Despite this, Nino develops a crush on him, including on a younger Futaro who had a delinquent-like appearance, despite initially dismissing Futaro's looks as being dull-looking."

Futaro typically wears the standard uniform of Asahiyama High School, both in and outside of school. The uniform includes a short-sleeved white shirt, dark blue trousers and a white belt. During cooler weather, he wears a light blue V-neck sweater, which is also part of the school uniform, over his shirt. For footwear, he typically wears black sneakers with white soles and laces for everyday wear. However, after the Labor Thanksgiving Arc, it has been revealed that he also wears high-top sneakers with similar coloring.

During School Field Trip Arc, he wore the clothes Nino picked for him. This includes a khaki parka jacket over a light-color mock turtleneck long-sleeved shirt, which appears black in the anime depiction. It is not shown whether he wore it again after the field trip. Since School Field Trip Arc, he started wearing the charm bracelet his sister gives him. However, this has not been clearly depicted after the arc due to him wearing long-sleeved top.

During Futaro's Flashback Arc, a hospitalized Futaro is seen wearing a set of plain pajamas, which he seems to use as nightwear. He wore this outfit again during the Seven Goodbyes Arc when he goes out for a night walk with Itsuki.

When disguised for the school trip's test of courage, he sports a blonde wig that looks spikier and slightly longer compared to his regular hairstyle ("The Binding Legend: Day 2 ‚ë°"). To disguise as Kintaro, he additionally wears a black long-sleeved V-neck shirt and white trousers during his visit to Nino's hotel room ("The Seven Goodbyes ‚ë•"). This clothing combination contrasts with his usual attire, where he has a light-colored top and dark-colored trousers.

In his childhood, Futaro sports a blonde, slick back and spiky hairstyle, much similar to the wig he wore when disguising as Kintaro. When Nino first meets Kintaro, she immediately notices the latter was the boy in the picture. He also wore an earring in his left ear, which he removed when he got older. During the Futaro‚Äôs Flashback Arc, a young Futaro wore a black hoodie, white trousers, and clogs.

Personality
According to Isanari Uesugi, Futaro used to be similar to his father as a kid with their wild personality and being bad at studying who lives a frugal lifestyle and prefers solitude. Someone comments that Futaro is always like that, trying to not associate with everyone. Ichika Nakano remarks that Futaro is direct and doesn't mince words. Yotsuba Nakano's first impression of Futaro is a gloomy and not-having-many-friends guy. His facial expression is always serious, sometimes having a grumpy and annoyed look, and rarely blushes or gets flustered. As he grows older, he becomes more of a study freak and grows more pompous and asocial. Despite his initial facade, he is actually a very caring person, especially towards his sister Raiha Uesugi.

Futaro is noted to have a big ego and high confidence. He is straightforward, tactless, brutally honest and rude; but is actually capable of holding back his emotions. Despite that, Futaro could momentarily lose his composure when agitated and faced with unfavorable circumstances. He also initially did not like getting involved with other people's problems, finding them to be troublesome. Despite his tactlessness, he is knowledgeable enough in knowing what to say in specific situations when thrown at him; rarely giving up when trying to achieve a specific objective.

Despite his egotistical nature, Futaro is very hardworking and has a very high amount of patience; especially when getting the attention of the quintuplets and tutoring them despite various amounts of failures and setbacks. He later on shows a sense of duty strong enough to help the quintuplets in their studies despite them not paying him immediately, even though the money that came with tutoring was the initial reason he accepted the job. He also begins valuing their relationship to the point where he would do things outside of their tutor-student relationship which would later on bloom into a bond where they mutually support each other with little question. Despite being bad at sports and lacking a fair amount of stamina, he is rarely shown to be tired for the most part; able to work other part-time jobs besides tutoring; one being a helper in a pastry shop.

During his brief stint as Kintaro, he tried (albeit crudely) making him seem like a "bad boy", similar to who he was before.

Natural Abilities and Skills
Futaro is a smart student and ranked top among his peers. He acknowledges that his forte lies solely in studying. He is able to score perfectly in various tests. He got 100 in all 5 subjects during the Second Year Midterm Exam. He also has an exceptional memory and excellent reading comprehension. Futaro is able to absorb several dozens worth of books in three days. His reason for studying is related to a young girl in his flashback. Futaro is able to sleep while sitting straight with his eyes wide open. Ichika Nakano's director notes that Futaro is the one who draws out Ichika's potential. Futaro is shown to be not only academically shrewd, as he's able to get the most out of the cafe's menu, successfully trick a teacher with his plan, and getting the lazy and idiotic Nakano Quintuplets to start studying.

Futaro acknowledges that human relations isn't his strong point. He always tries to cut off relationships with others aside from family, that is why he doesn't have experience with confessions. He is less adept with technology - he is unfamiliar with the internet's function and that he is unfamiliar with Nakano Quintuplets' apartment lock system.

Futaro has low physical endurance/stamina. Miku Nakano and Futaro have almost equal physical endurance/stamina. He once tried to piggyback Miku, but he lacks strength to do so and this shows that Futaro has a low strength.

Despite his poor social skills, he is able to see through a person's emotion and motivate them. Initially, Futaro is unable to judge the names of the sisters since they're so similar, but later he is able to differ them by how they call him. He is also capable of distinguishing the girls' based on their individual style of writing. Fuutarou is in a slump for quite some time, as he is affected by Nino Nakano's confession.

Like Miku, Futaro is not good at cooking. He is able to ride a motorcycle. He once worked on a delivery job before, which was when he got his licenses.

Futaro is an Aries.
He believes in charms and horoscopes.
Futaro's favorite meal is curry udon.
His phone number is 090-62149-31876
His email address is GeniusFutaro@hardbank.ne.jp

5.content:
Name: History Teacher
Nickname: Bald Mouse (indirectly by Fuutarou)
Gender: Male 
Hair Color: Bald
Occupation: Teacher

This is the head teacher of the Asahiyama High School. He teaches History. He was also the homeroom teacher of Yotsuba Nakano's sophomore class, class 2-2.

Appearance
He is a middle-aged man with a bald head. His most distinctive feature is his overgrown front teeth, making him resemble a bald mouse. Thanks to his unique appearance, Fuutarou was able to answer one of Miku's history questions.

Relationships
Fuutarou Uesugi
He dislikes Fuutarou for having solved all of his well-thought-out tests with ease.

6.content:
Name: Hongo
Gender: Female 
Occupation: Student

Hongo is the captain of the Basketball Club.

She is the most beautiful girl in all of Asahiyama.
She was the first to steal "the first time" from Fuutarou .

relationship 
Yotsuba Nakano
Due to Yotsuba's inability to say no, she would constantly assist the Basketball Club and Hongo would even ask her if she wanted to join the club, to which Yotsuba refuses.

7.content:
Name: Ichika Nakano
Birthday: May 5
Gender: Female 
Height: 165 cm (5'5")
Weight: 54.2 kg
Hair Color: Pearl Pink 
Eye Color: Blue
Blood Type: A
Occupation: Student, Actress
Affiliation: Asahiyama High School.
School Exam Report Card
Ichika: Japanese-38, Math-63, Science-52, Social-40,	English-47, Total-240.
Ichika's sheet is crinkled due to her messiness and writes in cursive.
Ichika Nakano develops a big sister complex.
Ichika Bob-cut Light pink hair and An earring on the right ear.
Physical Measurement: B88-W50-H159.
Ichika: favourite food-Shiokara, Disliked food-Shiitakes, Drink-Frappuccino, Snack-Shaved ice, Morning Routine-Jogging, TV Shows-Dramas, Favourite Animal-Hippopotamus.

Ichika Nakano is one of the main characters in the manga and anime series 5-toubun no Hanayome. She is one of the quintuplet sisters, with the other four being Nino, Miku, Yotsuba, and Itsuki Nakano. Ichika is the eldest of the sisters and serves as one of the main love interests for the protagonist, Futaro Uesugi.

Ichika is depicted as an aspiring actress who balances her studies with her acting career. She is a responsible and caring older sister to her quintuplet sisters, and often takes on a motherly role among them. In terms of her personality, Ichika is friendly, outgoing, and has a positive attitude, making her popular among her classmates. However, she can also be insecure and sensitive, particularly about her own shortcomings and her relationship with her sisters.

Throughout the series, Ichika faces various challenges in her career and love life, including conflicts with her sisters over Futaro's attention and a difficult decision about whether to pursue her acting career or focus on her studies. Her character's arc provides significant plot points in the story and contributes to the series' themes of family, love, and self-discovery. Overall, Ichika's character is multi-faceted, with her ambition and emotional depth making her a compelling and relatable figure in the series.

Appearance
Ichika is a girl with very short hair that has a single long strand on the right side. She has white-pink hair colour, ranging from oyster pink to light pink shade in Volume 1, and oyster white to light pink shade in Volume 4. Her notable accessory is a single earring. Like her sisters, she has dark blue eyes, an average height, a well-endowed figure and large breasts. A stall owner praises Ichika for her cuteness, but doesn't praise her sister nearby, Itsuki Nakano.

Ichika wears her school uniform with a thin jacket tied to her waist, sometimes with unbuttoned top; revealing her cleavage. She is shown to wear a handbag.

Personality
Ichika acts as the eldest sister of her sisters, as she seems to have a calm and composed demeanor; making herself an approachable person. Futaro Uesugi noted that her smile is fake and encourage her to put away that kind of smile.

She initially had pessimistic attitude towards the sisters' learning capabilities, making her one of the obstacles for Futaro tutoring lessons early in the story. After being inspired by him, she began to change her mind and started to take studying seriously. He also helped her fix any issues she had with her sisters; making them closer than ever before. Despite her smug expression and teasing behaviour, Ichika is shown to have a weakness to romantic moments happening to her; blushing whenever thoughts about it came to her mind.

According to Futaro, each of the Quintuplets have their own characteristics regarding their sheets. On Ichika's case, her writing and paper would be sloppy. She was also remarked to pick things up quickly and is troubled when her sisters make decisions without her presence.

As her pride of being the eldest sister, she plans to be successful first before telling her sisters about the job. She is shown to study in between her filming; whether it be inside a car on the road or late at night. Futaro was also impressed at how she was able to balance her work and school.

Ability
Ichika is a model and an actress. She is able to impersonate her sisters' expression and traits, showcasing her excellent acting capability, but to not to the extent of Miku, in which she can impersonate them flawlessly. Futaro is usually left impressed at how good her acting is, like when she accidentally eats the cake made by him, but managed to praise it wholeheartedly.

She is hinted to have good insight about human psychology, as she is able to, "see through people." This is evident when she easily deduced Futaro and Itsuki's quarrel, and correctly guessed the state Itsuki she was currently in.

Ichika's "big sister" traits are first shown when she refers to herself as "onee-san" to Futaro and asks him to consult her. Among the sister, she is ranked in the middle part of the five, with Mathematics as her strongest subject.

Relationships
Ichika is the big sister of the Nakano quints, having a supportive, caring and wise personality. Ichika laments that the Nakano Quintuplets used to get along.[1] Ichika tells the Nakano Quintuplets about her acting job.[2]

Nino Nakano
Ichika praises Nino's cooking.[3] She is the only sister so far who directly object to Ichika, such as when Ichika defending Fuutarou, and due to "Ichika's" seemingly uncaring behavior towards Itsuki.[4] When Nino starts to pursuing Fuutaro romantically, it made Ichika distressful. She originally believed she had no right to stop Nino's efforts, but she went against Nino's request in stalling their father so that Nino couldn't meet Fuutarou to kiss him. When Ichika becomes more honest with her feelings, she eventually told Nino how she also loves Fuutarou, making the two competitive love rivals. The two butt heads during the Kyoto trip, after the sisters learn of Ichika's attempts to sabotage Miku's chances with Fuutarou. When Ichika accuses them of being the same due to the both of them wanting to win Fuutarou over no matter what, Nino counters that while she has no intentions of letting any of her sisters win, she would give them her blessing if Fuutarou picked one of them. The two make up as they watch Miku spend time with Fuutarou, with Nino somberly saying that their roles could have easily been switched.

Miku Nakano
Miku pairs with Ichika, for the Test of Courage.[5][6] Miku is the closest sister to Ichika, as both have deep understanding towards each other, and often seen doing activities together.[7] Miku prefers to sleep with Ichika when her room is occupied,[8] and they openly have a heart-to-heart talk with each other, showing a strong bond between them.[9] Miku told Fuutarou about Ichika's movie.[10] Despite this bond, she lets her feelings for Fuutaro get the best of her, by making Futaro believe that Miku (Ichika in disguise) supports Ichika's feelings for Fuutaro, making him believe Miku isn't in love with him. When she disguises herself as Miku again in Kyoto, she is caught in the act, which deeply upsets Miku. After seeing that she had disregarded their relationship as sisters and had hurt Miku after her hard work to better herself, Ichika chooses to help Miku enjoy some one-on-one time with Fuutarou and apologizes to her afterwards.

Yotsuba Nakano
Yotsuba calls Ichika as "Ichika."[11] Ichika and Yotsuba have a good relationship with each other, as Yotsuba cleans her room every once in awhile.[12] and even willingly doing something slightly embarrassing for her.[13] Ichika used to brush Yotsuba's teeth when they're kid.[14] Yotsuba tries to cheer up Ichika.[15] Ichika stole candies and stickers from Yotsuba in the past.[16] Ichika also made friends with someone Yotsuba wanted befriend with.[17] Yotsuba label Ichika as "the boss who always wanted what others had."[18]

Itsuki Nakano
Ichika calls Itsuki "Itsuki-chan."[19] According to Fuutarou, Ichika is the only one who address Itsuki as "Itsuki-chan."[20] Itsuki notes that Ichika have been forcing herself because of them.[21] Ichika could understand Itsuki's behaviour even if is a slight change and would act concern towards her, even telling Fuutarou to look after her.[22] Ichika noted that Itsuki hasn't been able to be honest with herself.[23] Ichika stated that Itsuki and Fuutarou fight all the time because both are similar, a stubborn person.[24]

Fuutarou Uesugi
Ichika calls Fuutarou "Fuutarou-kun."[25] Fuutarou's first impressions of Ichika is that she has eyes that seem to see right through you.[26] Ichika's first impression of Fuutarou is that "he's a bookworm who doesn't have a girlfriend."[27] Ichika notices Fuutarou's uneasiness and decided to help him.[28]

Ichika is able to tell that Fuutarou is acting weird.[29] Ichika likes to tease Fuutarou, but he rarely flustered about it. Due to Ichika's puzzling behavior, Fuutarou has a hard time understanding her, and was eventually forced to tell his circumstances to gain her trust.[30] After discovering her situation, Fuutarou helps Ichika to be more honest and genuine to her feelings, asking her to put away her fake smile.[31] After getting inspired by Fuutarou, she began to accept him and start studying together. As time passes by, Ichika began developing feelings for Fuutarou, blushing when she gets compliments from him. The first scene of chapter 7 is a reminiscence of Chapter 13, where Ichika waits for Fuutarou before going to school. This is probably why in the page 3, Ichika considers this scene (walking together to school) as "her spot."

She initially was more reserved with her feelings towards Fuutaro, but has sometimes made her emotions get the better of her. Example are when she cried when Fuutarou considered turning down the idea of dancing with her in the bonfire during their school trip, beating Miku in the Final Terms to prevent her from confessing to Fuutarou, and unable to stop her father under Nino's request to avert Nino from meeting (and possibly kissing) Fuutarou. After having a heart talk with Yotsuba on where she was told she didn't have to hold back, Ichika starts to become more assertive if not also a little devious in her pursuits for Fuutarou. These actions include her tricking Fuutarou into believing Miku (Ichika in disguise) supports the two of them, and planning to give his birthday present before the others. She also plans to form a group consist of her, Fuutatou and Yotsuba in school's trip to Kyoto in order to get closer to Fuutarou. Also, she plans to do so because she knows Yotsuba doesn't harbor any romantic feelings for Fuutarou.

Ichika met a young Fuutarou 5 years ago back in Kyoto and they played cards together.

Isanari Uesugi is the father of Fuutarou Uesugi and Raiha Uesugi.

He has a distinctive golden, spiky hair with a bulked up and muscled body. Fuutarou five years ago also shared similar facial traits to Isanari.

He is always seen wearing sunglasses on his forehead. They are a memento of his deceased wife, who had bad eyesight while she was alive.

Personality
Isanari has a wild character. Fuutarou five years younger is said to share the same personality as his father, notably both were bad at studying.

relationship 
Family Members
Fuutarou Uesugi
Raiha Uesugi
Mrs. Uesugi

Maruo Nakano
Isanari and Maruo had a history of rivalry during school days, stemming from their differences. While Maruo was an exemplary student, Isanari was rebellious.[1]

It was through Isanari's connection with Maruo that his son, Fuutarou, became a tutor for the Nakano quintuplets.

Rena Nakano
Isanari and the quintuplets' mother, Rena, knew each other during school days. She was his senior, or senpai as Isanari addressed her.

9.content:

Itsuki Long wavy with ahoge Red	hair and A pair of five-pointed stars hairpins on each side of the head.
Physical Measurement: B88-W50-H159.
Itsuki: favourite food-Meat, Disliked food-Umeboshi, Drink-Curry, Snack-Yakisoba, morning routine-Sit-ups, Yoga, Tv Shows-Talk shows, Favourite Animal-Kangaroo.

Itsuki Nakano is one of the main characters in the manga and anime series 5-toubun no Hanayome. She is the youngest of the quintuplet sisters, along with Ichika, Nino, Miku, and Yotsuba Nakano. She is the first quintuplet that the protagonist Futaro Uesugi encounters, and the two have a complicated relationship throughout the series.

Itsuki is portrayed as an intelligent and confident student, but also a bit stubborn and headstrong at times. She is very close to her sisters and takes on a protective role towards them, especially when it comes to their father's, Maruo Nakano, expectations for their academic success. She is also passionate about food and aspires to become a food-related professional in the future.

Throughout the series, Itsuki's character undergoes significant development as she confronts her own feelings for Futaro and navigates her complicated relationships with her sisters. Her story arc highlights themes of family, personal growth, and the challenges of adolescence.

Appearance
Itsuki is a serious looking girl with medium-length hair and an expressive ahoge. She has reddish-orange hair colour, ranging from light pink to salmon pink in Volume 1, and deep orange to orient red in Volume 4. Her notable accessories are a pair of star-shaped hairpins near both of her eyes, which Futaro Uesugi called unfashionable at one point. Like her sisters, she has dark blue eyes, an average height, and a well-endowed figure. In class, or when she does activities that involve academics, she wears glasses.

Itsuki is noted to be "cute" by her classmates and she looks very similar to Rena Nakano, according to Shimoda.

She wears her uniform normally without any accessories, like most of the girl students,[7] and on occasion, she wears a handbag.[8][9]

Personality
Itsuki is a serious and earnest girl[10] who usually wakes up early compared to her sisters.[11][12] She is well-mannered; never being late or missed a class,[13] and always speaks formally. In the Japanese script, she almost exclusively speaks with a keigo speech pattern. Nino, her older sister, comments that Itsuki is too straight-laced.[14]

Itsuki is a girl who bears grudges,[15] as shown when she rejects Futaro's tutoring partly because of a previous quarrel they had. She is also someone who can't be honest with herself and has difficulties being more straightforward.[16][17] Both of these qualities often make her struggle on her own. She is easily agitated, be it about unfavourable situations,[18] scary things[19] or her stubborn self.[20][21][22]

She has a huge appetite and is frequently seen eating something or being hungry throughout the series. It appears that she doesn't mind treating her sisters unfairly when it comes to food-related topics.[23] This shows where during one scenario when she proposed to her sisters to share their cakes; suspected to sample all the flavours by Ichika.[24]

According to Futaro, each Nakano has their own characteristics regarding their sheets.[25] In Itsuki's case, she would rather use an eraser than scribble on them.

Ability
Itsuki is commended as a diligent girl, and she does things very precisely.[26][27] She is also perceptive and has a good sense of detail.[28] Despite that, she has an awful sense of direction.[29] Her poor sense of direction is first mentioned, when she became sensitive to the cold so she sneaks into Nino's futon.[30] She also has poor eyesight and is often seen wearing glasses.[31]She has good observation and deduction skills.[32] On exams, Itsuki generally scores high compared to her sisters, with her strongest subject being Science.[33]

In spite of her excellent deduction skills, she was the last of her sisters to realise Miku's affection towards Futaro.[34]

Itsuki is seen wearing glasses when she's about to do a test (Chapter 2), suggesting she has hyperopia (far-sightedness). In Chapter 3 with Futaro Uesugi, he remarks that Itsuki can't see far away, suggesting she has myopia (near-sightedness). Despite sharing eye problems with Nino Nakano, only Itsuki wears glasses.
She and Nino seem to be the most similar to each other among the quintuplets (both of them do sit-ups in the morning, have long hair, poor eyesight, a fear of needles, and a tsundere-like personality, being initially harsh to Futaro). Both of them are also close to each other and often seen hanging out, and Nino is very vocal and protective regarding Itsuki.
Itsuki believes in fate and charms.[39][40]
Itsuki's notable accessories are two stars on the front of her hair, representing number 5, which is a part of her name and the order of her birth.
Itsuki won 3rd place on the Japanese popularity poll with 1235 votes.[41]

Itsuki is the second Nakano Quintuplet to get her picture taken alongside Futaro. However, she is the first Nakano to have a picture with Futaro taken properly.[42]

Itsuki Nakano/Relationships
Itsuki doesn't like her sisters quarrel with each other, and being the "youngest", she can get easily intimidated by them.[1]

Nakano Family 
Maruo Nakano
Maruo Nakano is the adoptive father of Itsuki and her sisters. He describes Itsuki as someone obedient and sensible.[2]Maruo Nakano He also contacts Fuutarou through Itsuki.[3][4]

Nakano Quintuplets - Memories 
Mama Nakano passed away on August 14, and Itsuki visits her grave every month.[5] Nino said Itsuki does it because she's conscientious, but Fuutarou doubts it.[6]

Ichika Nakano
Ichika calls Itsuki "Itsuki-chan."[7] According to Fuutarou, Ichika is the only one who address Itsuki as "Itsuki-chan."[8] Itsuki notes that Ichika have been forcing herself because of them.[9]

Ichika mostly showed her big sister attitude towards Itsuki, expressing care and protective behavior.[10] Ichika noted that Itsuki hasn't been able to be honest with herself.[11] Ichika stated that Itsuki and Fuutarou fight all the time because both are similar, a stubborn person.[12]

Nino Nakano
Nino is the one who usually wakes up Itsuki.[13] Nino pairs with Itsuki, for the Test of Courage.[14][15]

Itsuki is the closest with Nino, as both are seen doing activities together, such as shopping, lunch, and test of courage.[16][17][18] Nino is also very protective towards Itsuki, being the most vocal sister regarding her well being.[19] The two come into conflict shortly before the final exam of their second school year, with Itsuki uncharacteristically slapping Nino for insulting Fuutarou and throwing aside her copy of the handwritten notebook he made for them. The two of them then leave the Quintuplets' apartment for a week, with Nino going to a hotel and Itsuki staying with the Uesugis. The two eventually rekindle, with both of them having bought movie tickets to watch together.

Miku Nakano
Itsuki is aware of Miku's fondness towards Fuutarou, and she reassures Miku about his circumstances, showing her care to Miku.[20]

Yotsuba Nakano
Itsuki consoles Yotsuba by showing her Fuutarou's notes praising Yotsuba.[21] Itsuki is the first to learn of Yotsuba's past with Fuutarou, and is asked to disguise herself as Yotsuba from 5 years ago. While Itsuki believes that Yotsuba deserves a chance with Fuutarou, Yotsuba refutes it, feeling undeserving of it and wanting to not be the only one who is "special" to him.

Uesugi Family
Fuutarou Uesugi
Early on, Itsuki had a quarrel with Fuutarou, leading her to reject him as the sisters' tutor early on. Despite this, she took him home after his disastrous first meeting with the sisters and begrudgingly encouraged him to try again after having dinner with the Uesugi family. She refused to consider the two of them as anything but strangers at first, partly due to Fuutarou's mutual sentiments. Due to Fuutarou's consistent efforts, Itsuki began to notice the change on her and the sisters.[22] After having a number of arguments with Fuutarou, she wants to apologize but feels too awkward to do so until being encouraged by Ichika to be honest with herself and the reason they argue is because of how similarly stubborn they are. She and Fuutarou develop each other's character, as they both overcome their stubbornness.[23][24]

Itsuki usually is the one who compares her father to Fuutarou due to the words of her mother who says to be cautious when choosing men.[25] Despite their initial tensions, Itsuki is disturbed by the condition placed on Fuutarou by her father, and at first refused to disclose her first test scores, knowing that Fuutarou would be fired. She held reservations towards Fuutarou for both his role as a tutor and as a potential romantic interest for the sisters before the school trip and wished to use the trip to prove his character. During the trip and after finding his written notes of stories to tell Raiha when he goes back home, she realizes that she did not know Fuutarou at all and tells an unconscious Fuutarou of her desire to learn more about him. When Fuutarou is hospitalized after the trip, she visits Fuutarou to do just that, and spontaneously asks about his motivation for studying. During the Scrambled Eggs Arc, she considers her relationship with him as that of friends rather than partners. When Fuutarou accepted this, she was overjoyed and quickly ran to the mixed bath he was in to join him, before being embarrassed. Eventually, it's implied she may have feelings for him; she's grouped within the same category as Nino and Ichika, wanting to walk around and explore with him alone.[26]

She knows more regarding Fuutarou than her sisters, being aware of his family's financial situation and is the first one he disclosed part of his past to. When Itsuki has a fallout with Nino due to Nino rejecting Fuutarou's efforts, she stays at Fuutarou's apartment due to her sisters not knowing where it is and she had nowhere else to go.[27][28]

Itsuki says that it's unusual for her to warm up to someone like Fuutarou.[29] She often notices when he acts unusual, such as asking the sisters to use the same hairstyle and realized he was doing that because the girl he had met was one of them, or when he was acting distant following his reinstatement as the sisters' tutor following the mock exam. She was overjoyed by the news and was annoyed by Fuutarou's lack of response, not knowing that he had just been reminded by her father to act properly towards the sisters. She sensed that something was bothering him and was eager to learn about it.

Raiha Uesugi
Itsuki is the 1st quint to meet Raiha. Itsuki develops a fondness toward Raiha due to her cuteness and partly after learning Uesugi family's circumstances. Initially, Itsuki only exchanged her contact information with Fuutarou in return for Raiha's. The two would even hang out with each other during the school holidays. It is implied she contacted Raiha following her fallout with Nino to stay over at the Uesugi residence for a while.

10.content:
Name: Jinnosuke Mudo
Age: 40s
Gender: Male 
Hair Color: Bald
Eye Color: Blue
Family
Rena Nakano (ex-wife) ‚Ä†
Ichika Nakano, Nino Nakano, Miku Nakano, Yotsuba Nakano & Itsuki Nakano (quintuplet daughters)
Occupation: Teacher (formerly)
Relationship: Rena Nakano (ex-wife+)

Jinnosuke Mudou is the ex-husband of the late Rena Nakano and the biological father of the Nakano Quintuplets.

Appearance
Mudou appears to be an old man; lacking hair on his head and his grown out, white-colored beard being his most apparent feature.

Personality
As the newfound father of the quintuplets, much of Mudou's identity has yet to be revealed, but he seems to have ever regretted his decision of leaving his daughters too many hardships. Stating that he wants to "atone" for his sins.

He holds some animosity towards Maruo Nakano because of allowing his quintuplet daughters to follow the same misguided path as did his late wife Rena Nakano.

Despite his apology and attempted rekindling of his daughters, his true nature become more revealing due his unreasonable animosity towards Rena and even told Itsuki that she shouldn‚Äôt follow her path nor have anything to do with her. His apologetical pursuit became more persistent after he eventually slammed his own head onto the floor causing it to bleed heavily though to no avail by Itsuki though she did show guilt for it. Mudou eventually snarled at Maruo and the quintuplets after they disowned him, causing him to walk off into the school festival, never to be seen or heard from again.
