Ken Takakura (È´ò„Åü„ÅãÂÄâ„Åè„ÇâÂÅ•„Åë„Çì, Takakura Ken?), also known as Okarun („Ç™„Ç´„É´„É≥, Okarun?), is the main male protagonist of the manga series Dandadan.

He is an occult fanatic, mainly a believer in aliens and UFOS, who was living an introverted school life until he met Momo Ayase from school. After a bet with her leads to them forming a friendship and having his kintama missing from being cursed by the Turbo Granny, Okarun makes it his mission to find what he has lost with help from Momo and other allies as they overcome any paranormal obstacles along the way.

Appearance

Okarun is a teenager of short height and slender build with brown hair (black hair in the anime), brown eyes and he wears round-frame glasses. Originally, Okarun's hair was fashioned in a bowl cut, but it has since become unruly after his confrontation with the Flatwoods Monster. Though he was initially very skinny, Okarun has gained toned muscles as a result of his dedication to strength training and the numerous battles he faced dealing with spirits and aliens.

While he is one of the few characters that can be seen wearing a variety of outfits, his most common attire is his school uniform, which is a typical gakuran outfit.
Gallery

Okarun's full appearance in his school uniform.
Okarun's full appearance in his school uniform.
Okarun as a child.
Okarun as a child.
Okarun while in junior high school.
Okarun while in junior high school.
Okarun's anime concept art.
Okarun's anime concept art.
Okarun's initial hairstyle.
Okarun's initial hairstyle.
Personality

Okarun is a self-described socially awkward individual who has a consuming interest for the paranormal with his main focus being the existence of aliens and cryptids. This interest goes all the way back to his childhood where he tried to make contact with aliens in a desperate attempt to make friends, having grown up without a single one in his life due to constant bullying. As a result, Okarun developed an inferiority complex where he believes that he is incapable of fitting in with others or that people are better off not associating with him. Even after making friends with Momo Ayase, Okarun still seems to retain some low self-esteem. After Jiji stepped back into Momo's life, Okarun thought to himself that he could not compete with him when it came to being her friend based on his observation on how entertained Momo was being around him and had almost come close to ending his friendship with her as to not be a bother. According to Momo, Okarun's real problem with making friends was that he was too quick to make assumptions about others judging him, which resulted in him subconsciously keeping others at arm's length.

Okarun is an altruistic person who believes that it is only right to help others when they are in trouble. A noticeable example being how he offered Mr. Mantis Shrimp his kintama for him to sale and earn funds for his son's blood transfusion. As a friend, he is fiercely loyal and protective as he will not allow others to get away with harming those whom he has formed a bond with, such as how he furiously attacked the Evil Eye for harming Momo and taking over Jiji's body.

Before learning that spirits truly walk among the living, Okarun was first skeptical of their existence since he believed that there were logical explanations as to why people would come to the conclusion of this paranormal activity.

Okarun is also formal to a fault as he can never bring himself to address his friends or allies by their first names or nickname without a polite suffix added. The only exception to this is Jiji since the latter will ignore him if he does so. It is because of this characteristic that Momo could tell that Reiko Kashima was impersonating Okarun, due to referring to Jiji as "Jiji-san". The only time he is heedless to formality is when he shifts to his Turbo Granny form.
Background

Ever since elementary school, Ken had a hard time fitting in with the crowd and was constantly picked on by others. In an effort to make any friends, he tried contacting aliens, which eventually developed into an obsession.
Abilities and Powers

Natural Abilities

Physical Prowess

Athleticism: As a result of the many paranormal obstacles he had to overcome, Okarun boasts great physical fitness that is on par with an athlete. During a physical fitness test, he completed a 50-meter sprint in just 5.8 seconds, surpassing his own expectation of 9 seconds, threw a handball 35 meters, reached 3.6 meters for the standing long jump, managed 80 steps for the sidestep test and completed 120 shuttle runs. Overall, he outperformed the rest of his class and still retained more stamina than them.

Former Abilities and Powers

Supernatural Abilities

Spiritual Power

Spiritual Awareness [v ¬∑ e]
Okarun is able to clearly see spirits, such as earthbound spirits and yokai. This also makes him one of the rare few who are able to enter Empty Space.
Turbo Granny Form
Okarun possessed the spiritual power of Turbo Granny after only the yokai's consciousness was extracted out of his body by Seiko and Momo. Initially, Okarun was only able to enter this mode while still being cursed by Turbo Granny and with help from Momo's psychokinesis powers to suppress the curse from his head, thereby allowing him to control his body. After the yokai's powers were accidentally left inside him, Okarun became able to enter the transformation willingly.

When accessing this power, Okarun's hair flared up and turned white, gained two thick vertical stripes across his eyes, and had a noticeable black jaw mask with a row of multiple teeth. On a few occasions, the mask does not manifest at all. Underneath his clothing, Okarun's body was given a more muscular definition, while forcing his posture to become hunch-like, and the nails on his hands and toes became sharpened and black. The clothes he chose to wear were also slightly altered to become flame-like. Okarun's mental state also changed in addition to his physical, giving him a depressing personality and a strange tendency to say "yo" at the end of his sentences.

During the Danmara Arc, Okarun was able to force himself to use Turbo Granny's power after reaching his limit from using All-Out twice, resulting in a feral form where the teeth of his mask sharpened, his glasses formed into menacing eyes, and his white hair lengthened and flowed back.

Okarun in his Turbo Granny form.
Okarun's Turbo Granny form without his mask.
Okarun's Turbo Granny form after surpassing his limit.
Enhanced Speed
Okarun's Turbo Granny speed (Anime)
This state offered Okarun the extraordinary speed of Turbo Granny that allowed him to run at an incredible 100 km/hr. Okarun referred to this full speed as going All-Out (Êú¨Ê∞ó, Honki?).
Strengths
Okarun dodging
After assuming the form for the first time, Okarun's body reacted fast enough to move out of the way of the Flatwoods Monster's attack after it had come a few seconds close to crushing him. As the Earthbound Spirit Crab chased him, he was able to cover some ground in Shono City and managed to keep the earthbound spirit from catching him. After Aira took a hit from Bamora, Okarun was able to quickly reach her from a considerable distance away to save her just in time from being struck by another attack. This speed also allowed him to keep up and overwhelm the likes of the Evil Eye, a formidable yokai who had proven himself on multiple occasions to be too difficult of an opponent to fight singlehandedly. In terms of combat rhythm, Turbo Granny proclaimed that her speed should allow Okarun to make five different actions in a single beat.
Weaknesses
Okarun was limited to using All-Out for only two sprints, as the intense supernatural speed put too much strain on his human body. Once the limit had been reached, Okarun ended up reverting back to normal and was left barely able to move for a short period of time. However, after further training to adapt to the form, Okarun's body no longer ached after reaching his limit, though this drawback was liable to return if he ran for too long. Okarun was also unable to swim since Turbo Granny did not possess the capabilities to.
Usage
Okarun attacking the Evil Eye
Okarun used this power in combat or to put some distance between himself and his enemies. When engaging foes in close combat, Okarun relied on his speed to make swift physical attacks that gave his opponent no window of opportunity to counter, with his attacks taking the form of a series of squats and headbutts. When partnered with his allies, Okarun could use his speed to quickly jump in and move them out of the way of incoming attacks, or carry them on his back to either catch up with a target on the move or make a necessary escape. After receiving training from Turbo Granny herself to properly harness her power, Okarun managed to improve his combat rhythm. This was shown in his battle against the Music Room Portraits, where he effectively used his enhanced speed and reflexes to evade the tulpas' barrage of explosive musical notes by recalling the rhythm of the hayashi music and defeating them with a succession of five headbutts at once, so fast that he left afterimages. Later, he was capable of dodging the Evil Eye's multiple grudge ball attacks, whereas he had previously struggled to dodge even one in his first fight with the yokai.

Okarun defeats Acro-Silky (Anime)
Since All-Out came from the boost in leg strength, Okarun was able to launch himself with great force like a missile, which was his preferred method of attack. The charging speed was great enough to have Okarun get through a crowd of possessed citizens and send Acrobatic Silky, a large body yokai, crashing back and left badly injured to stand up for a short amount of time. Most incredibly, Okarun was able to split the giant body of the Serpo Dover Demon Nessie in half.

While running from the Earthbound Spirit Crab, Okarun was also shown capable of using All-Out to keep himself and Momo afloat in the air long enough to land on city ground by having his legs rotate around his body like a helicopter‚Äôs rotary wings.
Enhanced Durability
Okarun also gained an increase in durability as well, as he was capable of withstanding his own launching attacks and endured attacks from powerful opponents such as the Evil Eye.
Enhanced Bite Force
Okarun's mouth mask gave him an immense bite force, as he was able to bite off all five fingers from the Flatwoods Monster's left hand.
Telephone Wire Transportation
Okarun traversing a telephone wire
Besides the enhanced speed, Okarun was also bestowed Turbo Granny‚Äôs ability to transport via entering telephone cables. In order to perform this ability, Okarun had to travel along the telephone wire‚Äôs spiral-shaped magnetic field flowing around the current and continue moving using Turbo Granny‚Äôs immense speed.

Okarun and Momo started as total opposites‚ÄîMomo believed in ghosts but not aliens, while Okarun believed in aliens but not ghosts. Despite this, they quickly bonded after experiencing the supernatural together. Their relationship is filled with playful teasing, but there is a clear underlying romantic tension.

Deep Trust & Care: Momo is very protective of Okarun, often jumping into danger to help him. Okarun, despite his initial shyness, deeply values her presence and support.
Jealousy & Embarrassment: Both get flustered when others tease them about their relationship, and Okarun has shown signs of jealousy when Momo interacts with other guys.
Seiko is Momo‚Äôs eccentric but powerful grandmother who helps guide them through the supernatural world.

Respect & Admiration: Okarun sees her as a wise mentor and often listens to her advice, though he‚Äôs sometimes overwhelmed by her bluntness.
Jiji (Best Friend/Rival)
Jiji is Okarun‚Äôs childhood friend who reconnects with him later in the story.

Close Friendship: Okarun and Jiji have an easygoing bond, built on shared experiences and their history together. Jiji helps Okarun come out of his shell.
Friendly Rivalry: They both have feelings for Momo, which causes moments of tension, but they never let it ruin their friendship.
Turbo Granny (Enemy-Turned-Reluctant Ally)
Turbo Granny is the yokai who originally cursed Okarun, giving him his powers.

Hate-Love Dynamic: At first, Okarun was terrified of her, but over time, they developed a chaotic, almost comedic relationship where she begrudgingly helps him.
Aira Shiratori (Friend/Former Enemy)
Aira was initially an antagonist due to being possessed by an evil spirit, but after being freed, she became a valuable ally.
Subtle Crush: There are hints that Aira may have some feelings for Okarun, though he‚Äôs mostly oblivious.

Momo Ayase (Á∂æ„ÅÇ„ÇÑÁÄ¨„ÅõÊ°É„ÇÇ„ÇÇ, Ayase Momo?) is the main female protagonist of the manga series Dandadan.

After forming a friendship with an occult fanatic at school named Ken Takakura, whom she nicknames "Okarun", leads to her awakening her psychic powers and the latter losing his kintama from being cursed by the Turbo Granny, Momo complies to help him find what he has lost and overcome any paranormal obstacles along the way.

In the aftermath of the quest for the second kintama, Momo inadvertently shrank to a tiny size after consuming food from the Fairy-Tale Card's dimension, presenting the Family with a new problem of finding a way to restore her to her original size.

Appearance

Momo is a teenage girl of average height with medium-length auburn hair that mostly frames the right side of her face and brownish crimson eyes. She is noted by Okarun and a few other male characters to be quite attractive.[1]

While she can be seen wearing a variety of outfits throughout the series, her most common attire is her school uniform: a white undershirt underneath a long sleeved light pink sweater with a loose red bow, a pleated navy blue skirt, baggy white socks, and brown loafers. Her overall attire matches with the kogal style worn by gyarus. She also includes green circular earrings and a black choker around her neck that has a circular green item at the back that matches her earrings, which is an accessory that she sticks to wearing at all times when choosing to wear different outfits.
Gallery

Momo's color scheme.

Momo in her school uniform.

Momo shown with glasses.

Personality

Momo's aggressive side (Anime)
Momo's aggressive side.
Momo comes off as a bold, confident, and fierce young girl, as there have hardly been instances where she is intimidated by others. She carries a no-nonsense attitude and often loses her temper when angered, mainly when being slighted or having to deal with the shenanigans of her friends and allies. She is prone to lashing out violently in a comedic fashion at the person responsible for invoking her wrath, however, if realizing her outbursts have gone too far, she will show remorse. In addition, she is also susceptible to making insults, as shown by her occasional bickering with Aira.

Momo's compassion
Momo expressing to Okarun her willingness to look after him when in danger.
At the same time, Momo is kind, friendly, and cheerful around others. Her genuine compassion and empathy make her the type of person who cannot ignore misdeeds being committed or turn her back on others who are in an unfortunate predicament, with Okarun being a great example. Although she did not know him at the time, Momo chose to step in and shield Okarun from a few bullies harassing him and was willing to help him be free of the Turbo Granny's curse in light of him not wanting to draw her into his mess. She also saw no reason not to form a friendship with him after the sudden events of their bet. When it comes to family and friends, Momo's fury can be directed towards anyone who offends them, especially if they cause them harm. Upon overhearing how Aira intentionally messed with Okarun's feelings when they first met, Momo retaliated by using her powers to drop a basin on her head, as well as make a snarky remark.[2] Unlike her grandmother, Momo isn't opposed to asking her friends and allies for help. She can also lose her trust in people if they are greatly dishonest with her. Momo can also feel empathy for her enemies if she learns that they have redeeming qualities that is masked behind their wicked actions or if a tragic past led them to what they are.

Momo's confidence
Momo boldly standing her ground.
Hailing from the way she generally carries herself with a bold attitude, Momo is fearless and strong-willed no matter what the odds are in front of her. In the few instances where her enemies had her outnumbered, Momo always showed no hesitation to stand her ground against them, having single-handedly defended herself against the Kito Family as they tried ganging up on her and steeled her resolve to fight the Kur that had passed through the warped gate by herself. Even after being low on power and was too heavily injured to move from her battle against the Imotako Kur, Momo remained unfazed by the Serpos crowding her as she lied on the ground helpless and dared them to try capturing her, as she believed that she had enough fight left in her to unleash a Moe Moe Tri-Beam on them. While this is the case, certain events and people can still frighten and shock her, although these instances have so far been minor.

Momo acknowledges herself as a smart person and has more often proven this to be true when trying to get herself and her friends out of sticky situations by using her deduction skills. Her allies have also vouched for her intelligence, with Okarun and Unji calling Momo out to be a genius. She can be quite proud of any accomplishments she makes. Momo is not above making attempts at manipulation to get what she wants, such as employing cutesy eyes to appear innocent to Okarun in order have him enter the Turbo Granny's tunnel before her as a precaution for any signs of danger ahead and tried to execute the "exploit the financial means of adults" tactic on Seiko through begging in order to have her grandmother buy her, Okarun, and Aira new uniforms. However, these tactics proved to be ineffective due to them being rather simple-minded and used on people who know her well. She is also prone to making hasty decisions if the well-being of her friends is in jeopardy, having intended on jumping into a pit of magma to save Okarun who was trapped down there.

Momo's Admiration
Momo expressing her idolization for Ken Takakura.
Momo has a deep admiration for the actor Ken Takakura. She is a beloved fan but also obsessed to the point where she only went out with an ex-boyfriend because his appearance resembled the actor's.[3] Merely hearing Ken Takakura's name and famous lines being spoken by someone is enough to have her feel flustered. Upon learning that an alien fanatic student from her school has the same name as her beloved actor, Momo refused to call Ken by his real name and decided on giving him the nickname "Okarun."

Although she takes matters seriously, Momo possesses a sense of humor and has moments of being childish and playful, a trait that is not unlike her grandmother. She plays along with the gaming process of putting Okarun's kintama back in his crotch, with the second game causing her to become too enthusiastic about winning against the Turbo Granny. Occasionally, she is prone to making dramatic expressions on top of her actions.

Much like her grandmother, Momo is susceptible to flattery, as she reacts with a happy expression whenever someone compliments her. Alternatively, she can also feel embarrassed whenever someone points out her good qualities as a person.

As a gyaru, Momo only chooses to wear clothes that she feels comfortable wearing, stating that the type of girl she is views style as combat gear. Before reaching the Turbo Granny's tunnel, Momo chose to change out of Seiko's spirit medium clothes and into her own despite them serving as bulletproof vest against evil spirits.
Background

Momo came to live with her grandmother Seiko Ayase when she was young. At some point, she became childhood friends with Jiji and had also developed a crush on him. While out in public, Momo was forced by her grandmother to perform a daily ritual to give her good luck. This unfortunately caused her to be bullied by the boys around her, including from Jiji, much to Momo's displeasure. Having subjected her to this humiliation, Momo blamed her grandmother and doubted her being a Spirit Medium. However, she soon came to realize that what she really disliked about the bullying was that it was mainly directed towards her grandmother than towards her and dismisses the hate she previously had towards her. After coming to truly love her grandmother, as well as her job as a Spirit Medium, Momo came to believe in spirits despite not being sure of herself that they are real or if her grandmother is truly a psychic.
Abilities and Powers

Natural Abilities

Physical Prowess

Immense Durability: For a human, Momo has demonstrated an impressive amount of resilience. After the Flatwoods Monster furiously threw a barrage of punches that were devastating enough to create a crater on the wall behind her, Momo only came out with a few minor bruises and was well enough to move about after getting a few minutes rest later on. Momo was also able to come out unscathed from being kicked by Acrobatic Silky that sent her crashing and could remain on her feet after the yokai thrashed her around.[4]

Stamina and Endurance: Aside from having great durability, Momo also possesses an impressive amount of stamina and endurance, being able to remain conscious long enough to defeat the Flatwoods Monster after taking on multiple devastating blows from the alien. She was also able to endure a thrashing from Acrobatic Silky and from being set on fire.

Mental Prowess

Great Tactical Intellect: Momo possesses high intelligence that has led to a few acknowledging her as a genius. Her intellect is notably demonstrated through her exceptional deductive skills and problem-solving abilities, qualities that make her a capable tactician. In the face of critical paranormal situations, Momo plays a key role in successfully helping her allies overcome these obstacles by using whatever information she can gain at the moment, along with her pre-existing knowledge, to devise ingenious strategies on the spot, which have led to successful outcomes. This was greatly demonstrated during the Daija Town Incident. By setting the Enjoji house on fire to alert the firefighters and have them use their hoses, Momo cleverly drove the Tsuchinoko from its subterranean hideout as the deluge of water expelled the cryptid from suffocation and succeeded in killing it from sunlight exposure. This strategy derived from her understanding of "worm suicide", a concept she learned from Jiji during their childhood. Following this, Momo deciphered the true meaning of the Great Serpent legend, a narrative that had been misunderstood for centuries, and swiftly took action in stopping the eruption of Daija Town's volcano by utilizing the Tsuchinoko's carcass as a conduit, connecting it to a geyser of hot spring water, causing the creature's phlegm to be expelled from its mouth and onto the lava to cool it.

Although Momo's tactics for defeating her opponents are clever, they are also reckless, often endangering her life to a great extent. Needing to avoid having Okarun suffer the effects of the talisman before putting it back on the torii gate to defeat the Flatwoods Monster, Momo chose to endure being battered into the wall embedded in the gate by the alien until a crater large enough for her and Okarun was formed to be on the outside, all while trying to suppress his curse. Another instance was her battle against the Hastur Kur, where she deliberately leaped into the alien's spatial carving to enter its pocket dimension and use her dimensional transcending psychokinesis to destroy the exosuit from the inside with her Moe Moe Tri-Beam.

Skill Set

Hand-to-Hand Combatant: Momo has demonstrated to be a capable fighter in melee combat, as she was able to hold her own against the Kito Family. During that fight, she also showed use of applying her psychic powers by drawing her opponent to her punches and kicks, as well as draw objects to her opponent's blind spot.[5]

Supernatural Abilities

Spiritual Power

Spiritual Awareness [v ¬∑ e]
Momo is capable of seeing spirits, such as earthbound spirits and yokai. This also makes her one of the rare few who are able to enter Empty Space.
Ki
Momo has the ability to tap into her ki, allowing her access to her spiritual power.
Aura Detection
Momo Aura Sensing
Momo's spiritual power grants her the ability to see and sense the auras of living and non-things around her.
Psychokinesis
Psychic Grip (Anime)
Along with the power to sense auras, Momo's spiritual power also grants her the ability to exert her influence over them to control the movements of living and non-things. Her psychokinesis manifests as two large hands, or a single link when merged, which are extendable and can latch onto the type of aura she perceives, allowing her to manipulate the target freely with her actual hands.
Strengths
Momo moving a living being.
Momo controlling inanimate objects.
The major strength of this ability is that Momo can move and levitate living and non-living things regardless of how heavy or big they are, such as a fire truck or the Tsuchinoko. Since her psychokinesis applies to both hands, Momo is able to grab ahold of two targets. Momo's psychokinesis is strong enough to divide a large body of water and block off other psychic users, as she was able to push back the Serpo's psychic field that was preventing Okarun and Aira from using their yokai powers.

Acrobatic Silky's memories
Momo's psychic powers also possesses the unique ability to peer into the memories of her target. However, the times she has used this ability were purely by accident and has not been shown having conscious use of this power. The first time was during the transference of Acrobatic Silky's aura into Aira where she saw into Acrobatic Silky's tragic past during her lifetime. The second was when she caught a glimpse of the Evil Eye's past while restraining Jiji during the yokai's exorcism.
Full Power
Momo awakens her psychic power
Upon awakening her ki following her abduction by the Serpos, Momo was able to use her psychokinetic powers to its fullest potential. In this empowered state, she radiates a glow matching that of her psychic hands, and her hair grows longer. She also describes herself as feeling invincible and capable of transforming her very thoughts into reality.[6]

As demonstrated, Momo's full power allowed her to levitate and gain an increase in strength, with one kick powerful enough to propel a Serpo back into their ship, resulting in significant damage.

This full power has since been sealed away, thus limiting Momo's psychokinetic capabilities. However, Seiko believes that with adequate training, she can progressively unlock it.
Weaknesses
Initially, Momo could only grab on to auras if she could see them in plain sight but has since improved ever since her confrontation with the Turbo Granny, now being capable of taking a hold of auras by using her sense of touch even if they are concealed from her field of vision.

Momo being pulled (Anime)
Since Momo's power is an extension of her hands, they reflect her grip strength. While she requires no effort to control large targets if they are immobile or willing, Momo cannot stop them from resisting and may have trouble holding them down. If her target manages to regain mobility through sheer force but has not broken the hold, Momo will end up being pulled by their movement as long as she keeps her power active. This also applies to targets that are already moving at a great velocity, such as a bullet train. Momo, however, used this to her advantage against the Turbo Granny to escape from her.

Additionally, Momo's psychokinesis is also linked to her sense of touch, meaning that her hands are susceptible to the sensation of strain and pain. Resilient though they may be, Momo's psychic arms can be destroyed if an opponent is strong enough to break free from them through sheer brute strength, or if the psychic arms are struck with a strong attack. As a result, Momo will feel an immense pain in her hands that will render her unable to manifest her powers for an unspecified period of time.

While she is still able to use her powers even if her hands are bound, Momo finds it difficult to use them effectively.[7]
Usage
Enjoji Family house destroyed
Momo uses her powers for combat. Using her psychokinesis, Momo can choose to hurl her targets to be sent crashing, restrain her opponents to leave them vulnerable for her comrades to attack, or carry her targets while on the move by having them levitate over her head. Momo is also capable of applying her powers in close-quarters combat. As shown in her fight against the Kito Family, she can pull her enemies towards her punches and kicks and send objects flying their way around their blind spots. During her first confrontation with Reiko Kashima, Momo covered the entirety of her psychic arms with levitated rubble as if they were physical arms that she could use to inflict damage to the yokai with tangible punches (though this strategy of fighting quickly proved to be a failure as Reiko Kashima easily swiped the rubble away in a fit of rage before Momo could land a single attack

Seiko Ayase (Á∂æ„ÅÇ„ÇÑÁÄ¨„ÅõÊòü„Åõ„ÅÑÂ≠ê„Åì, Ayase Seiko?) is a major supporting character of the manga series Dandadan.

She is a well-known spirit medium who also goes by the name Santa Dodoria („Éâ„Éâ„É™„Ç¢‰∏âÂ§™, Dodoria Santa?) and the grandmother of Momo Ayase. While performing her duties, Seiko provides support to Momo and her friends as they become involved with spirits, aliens, and other paranormal activities.

Appearance

Despite being a grandmother, Seiko has the appearance of a slender woman in her prime. Seiko possesses long snow-white hair that she generally ties up in a large top knot, wears red rectangular glasses. She is a chain smoker and can almost always be seen smoking cigarettes. On top of her youthful appearance, Seiko has been noted for her beauty that she claims others might go so far as to describe her as being bewitching. Due to this, many have mistaken her to be Momo's mother and leave them in shock once they learn her true relation to the girl. In terms of height, she is shown to stand no taller than her granddaughter.

When out in public, Seiko wears a yellow open large button cardigan that reveals her cross-strap top, a blue baseball jacket that has white sleeves with a symbol on the back, hoop earrings, and sandals. When at home, Seiko is shown to wear a white tank top, shorts, a beige haramaki, and light grey arm warmers with matching thigh-high stirrups.

As Santa Dodoria, Seiko wears a mask, sharp finger-tipped gloves, and a cloak covering up her entire body while leaving only her large top knot visible.

In the past when Momo was a little girl, Seiko wore the respectful attire of a shrine maiden and had her hair tied in a regular ponytail.
Gallery

Seiko's anime concept art.
Seiko's anime concept art.
Seiko's common outfit.
Seiko's common outfit.
Seiko as she appeared in Momo's childhood memory.
Seiko as she appeared in Momo's childhood memory.
Seiko as she appeared years ago.
Seiko as she appeared years ago.
Seiko in her casual outfit.
Seiko in her casual outfit.
Seiko as Santa Dodoria.
Seiko as Santa Dodoria.
Seiko wearing her spirit medium robes.
Seiko wearing her spirit medium robes.
Personality

Seiko has a phlegmatic personality and a highly uncouth manner of speech. At the same time, she is selfless and empathetic to help others in need if it's within her power, with the greatest example being her taking people into her house if they need a place to stay. As such, she follows the concept of "being in it together". Instead of accepting Okarun's generous compensation for looking after him while he was cursed by the Turbo Granny, Seiko told him that the only way he could repay her was to help other people who were in trouble. When involving herself with children, Seiko believes that, as an adult, she should be able to shoulder their burdens to allow them to be free to do what they want in life. Because of this, she felt saddened that she was unable to honor Jiji's wishes to help him keep the Evil Eye under control in order to spare the yokai from being exorcised. While willing to help others, Seiko is too proud to admit when she needs help herself or burden others with her problems, having at first refused Okarun and Mr. Mantis Shrimp's offer to help rebuild her house when it was in ruins after the Evil Eye's stay.

Seiko teasing Momo
Seiko teasing Momo.
Seiko can also come off as being a bit immature, such times being when she joked about Momo having a crush on Okarun, due to him having the same name as Ken Takakura, and having her granddaughter make a Hiroshi Abe impression in exchange for having to buy her a new school uniform. Despite this and her unladylike way of speaking, Seiko can act polite if she feels that she has made a mistake that involves the well-being of others. This side of Seiko is seen as being rare and out of character to those who know her well. Though she claims that she has never been moved by emotion, Seiko subconsciously favors those who compliment her, such as her youthful appearance which she takes great pride in.

As a spirit medium, Seiko follows the rules of coexistence between the living and the dead, which is to not disrespect the dead and send them to the afterlife, by using force if necessary, if they choose to attack the living.

Seiko cooking
Seiko hastily cooking takoyaki.
Seiko has a passion for food, believing that it should not be taken lightly since "living begins with eating". As a cook who occasionally serves food for Momo and her acquittances, she finds it delightful to see a person who knows how to eat by filling up on the food she makes and even becomes motivated to make more to further satisfy their appetite. She was even willing to feed a restaurant full of Renjaku High School student at the cost of her entire paycheck. On the other hand, she dislikes picky eaters.

While a believer in spirits, Seiko is a disbeliever in UFOs or aliens. Even after Momo brought home Mr. Mantis Shrimp as proof, Seiko only saw him as being a kappa and did not think much of the alien's spacecraft after abducting a cow. She enjoys watching television shows, which is the only thing that brings her a sense of joy and laughter in life.
Background

Seiko took in her granddaughter Momo when she was little and wanted to pass on a little of her ways as a spirit medium, instructing her to perform a daily spell routine that would potentially help her to release her ki. Following her grandmother's instructions, Momo faced bullying from children whenever she performed the daily spell in public. This then resulted in Momo blaming Seiko for the mistreatment and accusing her of being a fraudulent spirit medium, a claim that deeply affected her. Eventually, their relationship began to heal after Momo apologized to Seiko.
Abilities and Powers

Overall Abilities

Seiko is heavily relied on by Momo, Okarun, and their friends and allies whenever they are faced with powerful forces that are beyond their capabilities to confront together, whether they are spirit related or not.

Natural Abilities

Physical Prowess

Enhanced Human Condition: Seiko has demonstrated to have physical prowess that are above an average human. In her fight against the Evil Eye, she was shown capable of putting enough physical power into her bat to knock down the yokai and create a crater on the ground with one swing. She has also shown to possess impressive speed and reflexes, as she was able to avoid being hit by the Evil Eye's attacks in close combat.

Mental Prowess

Magic Barrier explanation
Seiko using her barriers to protect herself from Turbo Granny and to trap her.
Tactical Intellect: Seiko has great strategic skills, having formulated the plan to lure Turbo Granny out of Shono City and into a trap to exorcise her and the Earthbound Spirit Crab and organized the operation to release Rin of the Onbusuman. During her face-off with Turbo Granny, who had taken over Okarun, Seiko foresaw the yokai's strike from her blind spot and had preemptively erected a mystic barrier to protect herself. Additionally, she was clever enough to prepare a tight space secondary barrier to trap Turbo Granny, which then allowed her to strike Turbo Granny relentlessly with her bat from various angles, with each blow also knocking Turbo Granny back out of the barrier, resulting in further harm from being ignited.

Skill Set

Momo, Seiko, and Manjiro exorcise the Evil Eye
Seiko, Momo, and Manjiro attempt to exorcise the Evil Eye out from Jiji.
Mediumship: Seiko is recognized for her profound knowledge and understanding of spirits, being a highly esteemed spirit medium. Her capabilities to exorcise evil spirits from individuals or locations is considered exceptionally high among the most experienced spirit mediums, as five, previously employed by the Enjoji Family to rid the Evil Eye from their house, recommended Seiko to Jiji as a final measure following their failed attempts.

Master Hand-to-Hand Combatant: Seiko possesses exceptional prowess in unarmed combat, demonstrating impeccable martial arts skills in countering a group of kung fu fighting jiangshi and defeat them single-handedly.

Armed Combat Mastery: Seiko mainly fights using her bat Nessie to overpower her enemies into submission. She handles her bat using both one-handed and two-handed grips; with the two-handed approach allowing her to deliver more forceful strikes, powerful enough to make her opponents create craters in the ground when they're knocked down. Along with this weapon, she uses her talismans and charm nails when up against spirits to exorcise them with her mystic barriers.

In a situation where she doesn't have her bat or charms on hand, Seiko is able to improvise by using whatever is around her as a weapon, such as using a piece of wood as a blunt weapon to swing as a substitute for Nessie.

Cooking: Seiko is a skilled cook, shown being able to prepare various dishes for the Family at times.

Supernatural Abilities

Spiritual Awareness [v ¬∑ e]
Seiko is capable of seeing spirits, such as earthbound spirits and yokai.
Divination
Seiko has demonstrated to be able to glean information about people using a crystal ball, as she was able to accurately uncover Shoma's secrets.
Power Borrowing
Seiko has the ability to borrow power from gods that reside within regions, with her main region being Kamigoe City where she lives.
Mystic Barrier
Mystic Barrier
By borrowing power from a god through unknown means, Seiko is able to erect mystic barriers that are able to exorcise evil spirits, or anyone cursed by an evil spirit for that matter. This is done with the use of her charm nails and talisman.
Strengths and Weaknesses
The primary power of the barrier lies in its ability to enable Seiko to fend off evil spirits, using its flame ignition effects to incinerate them until they turn to ash. The lethality of the barrier is heightened when more than one nail is placed on the ground.

Since her barriers are only effective if the god she is borrowing power from is around, Seiko is limited to exorcising evil spirits within the perimeter of the region the god resides in. In exchange for the privilege of wielding the god's power, Seiko is also obligated to fulfill the condition of visiting temples for three days to express gratitude. While this condition was established after Seiko borrowed power from the god of Hokkaido, it is unclear if there are conditions that vary with each god she borrows power from, if it is Seiko or the god who sets the condition, or if the temple visiting is a standard condition associated with her power borrowing.
Usage
An interior barrier that prevents evil spirits from entering the circle.
An exterior barrier that prevents evil spirits from going outside the circle.
Seiko throwing a brick with a barrier to harm Turbo Granny.
Seiko uses her mystic barriers to ward off evil spirits from her home by placing her talismans inside her house and on the torii gate. To safeguard herself against evil spirits, Seiko forms a protective barrier by tracing a large circle on the ground with the retractable pencil tip of her bat, Nessie, and positions a charm nail within the circle. This method can also trap an evil spirit by drawing a circle around them and placing a charm nail from the outside, resulting in the exterior of the circle acting as a mystical barrier that will activate the barrier's ignition if said evil spirit steps passed the circle. This renders the evil spirit vulnerable to Seiko's mercy, enabling her to relentlessly strike them with her bat from different angles, while the barrier sets them ablaze from being knocking back with each strike. Seiko can then finish off the evil spirit by placing a charm nail within the circle.

Seiko is also able to use the barrier for offense as well, as she stopped Turbo Granny from eating Momo by placing a drawing a small circle on a brick and placing a charm nail within the circle, using it as a throwing weapon that sets off the barrier's flames once made contact.
Power of Words
(Ë®ÄÈúä, Kotodama?)
Seiko is able to harness the Power of Words, referring to the power to alter reality through one's words that are said with conviction behind them.
Usage
Seiko has been shown using the Power of Words for combat purposes to enhance her physical strength. With it, she could increase the power of her batting swings to knock back her targets a good distance. She also utilized it to give herself enough strength to pull Rin up to the top of the dashi float.
Techniques
Nessie
(„Éç„ÉÉ„Ç∑„Éº, Nesshƒ´?)
Power of Words
Seiko's signature and sole use of the Power of Words in which she shouts out the "Nessie" to enhance her physical strength. She mainly employs this technique to increase the swinging power of her bat (or any slender blunt object) to knock back her target with great force. Seiko formulated this technique in a training session with Momo when her granddaughter was little. She demonstrated the Power of Words by striking a sandbag, propelling it into the air with a swing of her bat while calling out "Nessie", this name being inspired by Momo's assertion of what she believed to be the strongest creature in the world.
Equipment

[v ¬∑ e] Nessie
(„Éç„ÉÉ„Ç∑„Éº, Nesshƒ´?)
Seiko's signature weapon is a bat inscribed with the words "Power of Nessie" („Éç„ÉÉ„Ç∑„Éº„ÅÆÂäõ, Nesshƒ´ no Chikara?). Her formidable strength, along with her use of the Power of Words, allows her to deliver powerful swings. Additionally, the bat is equipped with a retractable pencil tip, which Seiko utilizes for her barrier magic.
Nessie (Bat) Infobox (Anime)
Talisman
Talismans that are capable of casting Seiko's mystical barriers, detecting nearby evil spirits, and perform sealing rituals.

Seiko has positioned talismans in her home as a defense against any invading evil spirits.
Charm Nails

A crystal ball that Seiko uses to perform her divinations.

Jin Enjoji (ÂÜÜ„Åà„ÇìÂüé„Åò„Çá„ÅÜÂØ∫„Åò‰ªÅ„Åò„Çì, Enj≈çji Jin?), also known as Jiji („Ç∏„Ç∏, Jiji?), is one of the main characters of the manga series Dandadan.

He is Momo Ayase's childhood friend (and also unknowingly her first crush) whom he lost touch with after moving away. Years later, he enrolls into Kami High and reunites with her after he came to her grandmother Seiko Ayase for help to rid his house of the Evil Eye haunting him, which leads to him becoming the yokai's vessel. After the Evil Eye is kept under control by Okarun, Jiji becomes one of the few to lend his help to Momo and Okarun as they try to find the latter's kintama.

Appearance

Jiji is a very tall and muscular young man, being even taller than his parents with short auburn hair with bangs that fall down to his eyebrows with only the center of his forehead left exposed and brown eyes. He is recognized by the girls at his school to be quite handsome.

When he was first introduced, Jiji wore a tracksuit with an undershirt.

When at school, Jiji wears a collared shirt with a tie, jeans with a belt and the school's blazer. He also wears dark hoop earrings.
Gallery

Jiji's anime concept art.
Jiji's anime concept art.
Jiji as a child.
Jiji as a child.
Personality

Jiji comes off as being a very hyper-active young man who likes to express himself with dramatic movement and faces. He also has a habit of usually ending his sentences with strange verbal tics such as "Fuuuu" („Éï„Ç•, "Fuuuu"? Viz: Woo) or "Fuuuuwaaaatsu" („Éï„Ç•„ÉØ„ÉÉ, "Fuuuuwaaaatsu"? Viz: Woo-Hoo-Hoo).

To some girls, Jiji is viewed as being funny and charming, which is accompanied by his handsome good looks. On the other hand, others might find him to be annoying. In Seiko Ayase's opinion, Jiji's quirky personality makes him come off as being moronic as she would sarcastically comment on him being a "genius".

Jiji has also been noted to give off a "playboy" vibe. After making his introduction to Momo Ayase's classmates, Jiji immediately asked for a female classmate's cellphone number with enthusiasm after finding her to be cute with just a single glance and acted flirtatious around Momo's friends.

Aside from this, he has proven himself to be good-natured. Upon reuniting with Momo after the two lost touch with each other since they were little, Jiji sincerely apologized for mocking her in the past and jumped in to protect her from an alive anatomical model that was charging towards her.
Background

During his childhood, Jiji used to be friends with Momo Ayase and unknowingly her first crush. However, after Momo started to follow her grandmother Seiko Ayase's instruction in performing a ritual, Jiji rudely mocked her and eventually lost touch with her after he and his parents moved up to the mountains.

At some point, Jiji started to notice strange things happening around his house, but decided to ignore them after his parents failed to take his word for it. However, Jiji is soon confronted by a spirit in his house and found himself seeing it everywhere he went, including in his dreams, resulting in him being sleep-deprived. This encounter then leads to Jiji's parents being hospitalized after coming down with a sickness.

Having no choice, the family decided upon hiring well-known spirit mediums to perform an exorcism but are met with failure after three of the five mediums ultimately committed suicide. After being told from them that hiring Seiko would be a last resort, Jiji contacted her about his situation and became permitted to move into her house until his problem is solved.
Abilities and Powers

Supernatural Abilities

Spiritual Awareness [v ¬∑ e]
Jiji possesses the ability to see spirits after encountering the Evil Eye in his previous house.
Evil eye encounter (anime)
Ki
Jiji possesses incredible reserves of ki that has his spiritual power valued as being extremely rare and desirable for evil spirits to have. Since his training with Seiko, Jiji is able to use his ki to suppress the Evil Eye sealed within him if he comes into contact with anything cold, though he noted that doing so requires him to exert all of his strength, which causes him to become exhausted afterwards.

Techniques
Ha Wave
(Ê≥¢„Éº„ÉÑ, Ha-tsu?)
Emission
Jiji has the spiritual power to let his ki flow out to emit an invisible burst capable of knocking back anything in his path. He does this by first concentrating on channeling his ki to his hands and then thrusting them forward while cupped. The only main strength of the Ha Wave is that the force of the attack is capable of knocking back Jiji's intended target and having him attack from short to long range. As pointed out by Aira, the Ha Wave lacks the attack power to do any major damage to Jiji's opponent.
Evil Gun
(ÈÇ™ÈäÉ, Jagan?)
Evil Gun
A Power of Words enhanced version of the Ha Wave where Jiji utters the words "Evil Gun" to give an increase to its attack power, resulting in a powerful beam of energy being shoot out from the thrust of his hands. It was first used to attack one of the space globalists that was restraining Aira, successfully freeing her.
Power of Words
(Ë®ÄÈúä, Kotodama?)
After learning from Momo that attacks can be amplified using words, Jiji incorporated this effect into his spiritual power, allowing him to increase the attack power that he was initially lacking.

Kami High (Á•ûÈ´ô, Kamik≈ç?) is the high school where the main protagonists, Momo Ayase and Okarun, along with several other main and minor characters, attend. It serves as one of the main settings of Dandadan.

Overview

Kami High is shown to resemble a typical Japanese-style school building with a standard curriculum. Though details about the facility is left vague throughout the series, what can be said so far is that, unbeknownst to the students and faculty, with the exception of the main cast, it serves as dwelling for the anatomical model Taro, specifically in the science classroom, and that it also houses a large number of spirits.

Uniform

Male Uniform Kami High
Rin Sawaki full appearance
The male uniform is a typical gakuran outfit.

The female uniform consists of a navy blue buttoned up blazer with the school emblem located around the left breast and a white-collared long sleeve shirt that is generally worn underneath with a red bow tie. The short skirt worn matches with the color of the blazer. Both male and female students also switch from wearing the shoes they came to school with to black loafers or uwabaki.

Clubs

History and Culture Research Club
Baseball Club
History

Kintama Hunt Saga

Turbo Granny Arc

In front of Kami High, Momo Ayase dramatically broke up with her arrogant boyfriend and headed back to class. Her friends, Miko and Muko, poked fun at her, reminding her they had warned her against dating him. Momo explained that she was drawn to his resemblance to Ken Takakura, a dashing and manly actor. Muko and Miko scoffed, saying guys like that were a thing of the past. As Momo roamed the school, feeling down, she noticed a spectacled male student in Class 2-C being bullied and became prompted to sit next to him and glared at the bullies, causing them to stop their harassment. She then left but was quickly caught up by the male student, who excitedly assumed she must share his interest in the paranormal because of the magazine he was reading catching her eye. When Momo expressed her belief in spirits rather than aliens, the male student mocked her, insisting that spirits were non-existent, and they ended up making a bet to prove which of their beliefs was real.

The day after the duo defeated Turbo Granny, Okarun walked to school, afraid to approach Momo, thinking she might have been a temporary friend due to the situation they were in. As she stood at the entrance, waiting for Okarun, she saw him ignoring her as he passed by, her friend believing that she was not waiting for him. However, she quickly bumped into him, rekindling their friendship and discussing the aliens and spirits they had to fight.

Acrobatic Silky Arc

Momo and Okarun parted ways and attended their respective lessons. Okarun once again faced mockery and insults from his classmates but found himself not minding this due to knowing he finally had a friend. Meanwhile, Momo daydreams in class, causing Miko and Muko to believe she had reconciled with her ex-boyfriend, argued with him, and broken her phone. Momo and Okarun both became eager to discuss the paranormal, and after class had ended, they set off to find each other. However, their paths did not cross as they ventured out to different areas of the school looking for each other. Feeling disheartened while sitting on the benches outside, Okarun assumed Momo was ignoring him because he was boring, while Momo worried she had been too direct and insensitive to Okarun's feelings. Unaware that they were only a few meters away from each other as they prepare to return to class, the two collided and shared an awkward, fleeting kiss. The two then revealed they had been searching for each other and started blushing, until Miko and Muko, who had witnessed the incident, shouted at them, assuming Momo was dating Okarun. To handle the embarrassing confrontation, Momo and Okarun began badmouthing each other and left, though this didn't change Momo's friends' minds.

Okarun headed to the bathroom, feeling bad about what happened, wanting to apologize to Momo. Upon looking down, he suddenly realized in shock that he had regained only part of his anatomy. He then rushed to Class 2-B, where Miko and Muko were informing their classmates about the incident and made a hand gesture indicating his predicament, which only embarrassed Momo further. He begged her to talk to him, insisting it was important, but she kept refusing. Even when Okarun explained he didn't mean what he said earlier and wanted to discuss the paranormal, her classmates continued to poke fun at her. Okarun sadly wondered if she was too embarrassed to be his friend and left, the entire atmosphere shifting as Miko and Muko had never seen Momo act that way before.

Later in the hallway, Okarun bumped into a gorgeous girl named Aira Shiratori, who made cute comments about him, causing him to blush. Momo, still feeling guilty about their earlier encounter, spotted Okarun and Aira chatting. She was surprised, as she didn't expect Okarun to have any friends. Her surprise turned to anger when she overheard Aira belittling Okarun to her friends, saying that worthless guys like him could never talk to a girl and that she was just letting him live his dreams temporarily for fun. Enraged, Momo used her psychokinesis to drop a washbasin on Aira's head. She then latched onto Okarun's arm, complimenting him in front of the girls, and declared that the girls could never understand his charm. Unbeknownst to Momo, Aira had touched Okarun's kintama, activating her spirit sensibility and allowing her to see Momo's powers, which appeared to her as demon wings.

The next day at school, Okarun was approached by a group of male classmates who believed he was dating Momo. When he denied it, they asked Okarun to introduce them to the beautiful Momo, having heard unsavory rumors about her. Furious, Okarun grabbed one of the classmate's, demanding to know who spread the rumor. The classmate, initially thinking Okarun wanted to fight, was quickly intimidated by Okarun's change in attitude and physical size, a result of manifesting Turbo Granny's powers. Okarun then threatened him to never speak ill of Momo again. The transformation took over Okarun's behavior, and he quickly apologized, returning to his desk and hiding behind his paranormal magazines to avoid eye contact. Just then, Turbo Granny, who had been hiding in his backpack, made fun of him. Okarun ran out with her, asking why she wasn't at home with Seiko, fearing someone might spot her. She explained that now powerless, she was no longer a threat, but her powers inside him might cause trouble. Turbo Granny sought permission to enter his body, though Okarun quickly shut her off, insisting she still needed to recover his kintama. After Momo approached Okarun, the latter initially intended to point out that the cat had hidden in his backpack. However, recalling the classmate's words from earlier, he realized how attractive Momo was and decided to keep his distance to conceal his newfound crush, resulting in Momo chasing him around school in demand to have him make eye contact with her. This als ogave Turbo Granny the opportunity scouted the school. Back in class, Momo consulted Miko about Okarun's avoidance. Miko informed her that he had confronted a classmate who badmouthed her due to a malicious rumor. Despite this, Momo couldn't understand why Okarun was avoiding her.

Meanwhile, Aira wandered the hallways, captivating everyone with her beauty, and recalled how she spread a false story about Momo as retribution for yesterday, having witnessed Momo's psychokinesis and believing her to be a hidden devil. As the only one to see this, she felt chosen, especially after picking up Okarun's kintama filled with spiritual energy, which enabled her to perceive the paranormal. Aira interpreted these events as a sign that she was destined to eliminate the "demon" Momo and accepted this mission. While she examined the golden ball, her two friends brought her the crucifix and the exorcism book she had requested, though they were weirded out by her recent behavior. Suddenly, Aira spotted a woman in a red dress on the soccer field; however, the two girls could not see her. Believing it to be Momo's familiar spying on them, Aira hid on the floor but quickly stood up and chatted with a couple of boys to avoid looking out of place, using hand signs to tell her friends to meet her after school for their plan.

On the roof, Okarun and Momo ate their lunch together, with Okarun still avoiding eye contact. She didn't understand why Turbo Granny was at school, and the spirit stated she didn't need their permission. Momo reminded her that they had defeated her, and they started bickering. Momo informed Okarun about the eerie woman since she was looking for his balls, though Momo thought they were unlikely to be at Kami High. Okarun still had a glimmer of hope because a human might have picked it up, not a spirit. The cat informed them that when someone picked up the golden ball, they became spirit-sensitive, which made them stand out to yokai and might lead to attacks, so they had to check after school. In class, Aira's mind raced, considering the unknown strength of Momo potentially ruining her plan, and she noticed the woman in the red dress getting closer and closer.

After the bell rang, Momo, Okarun, and the hidden Turbo Granny left together to search for the eerie woman. Just then, Aira stopped them and pleaded with Momo to talk. Momo feared Aira might have seen her psychokinetic arms, but she didn't want to create bad terms between them. So, she left the other two, and the girls headed to an abandoned building near the school.

Serpo Arc

After recovering one of Okarun's kintama from Aira, he and Momo strolled through the school hallway, pondering the whereabouts of the other missing one. Momo proposed using an online paranormal board as a solution but realized that she no longer had a phone, causing her to consider getting a job to purchase a new one. Okarun was invited to meet with Momo on the school roof for lunch but declined, stating he needed to focus on a school report and wouldn't have time to visit a manga caf√© later. Understanding his situation, Momo decided to have lunch with Miko and Muko, though she couldn't shake the feeling that something was amiss, briefly suspecting Okarun might be seeing Aira.

Meanwhile, Okarun was in the backyard, training to enhance his strength for future battles against monsters while following Seiko's workout tips. Aira discovered him and confessed her feelings, despite believing that their relationship was not meant to be due to her assumption that he was a demon. She attempted to kiss him but was pushed away, leaving her shocked as she had read about such advances in one of his father's adult magazines, which only confused Okarun further. He was astonished by her lack of understanding of romance, especially given her popularity with boys, and tried to keep her at a distance, but she ultimately ended up beneath him, asking for a kiss. Momo's suspicions were unexpectedly confirmed when she caught the two in an uncomfortable situation, prompting her to express her disappointment through an insult before storming off. Okarun attempted to follow her to clarify the misunderstanding, but her perception remained unchanged as she saw him drenched in sweat, interpreting his report as a mere pretext for his affectionate behavior with Aira. Back in class, she slammed her head onto her desk in frustration, neglecting the drinks she had brought for Miko and Muko. During a science lesson focused on mantis shrimps, Momo continued to brood and found herself empathizing with the mantis shrimp in the class fish tank, particularly regarding its punching ability. In an effort to distract herself from the earlier incident, she punched herself, leading Miko and Muko to believe she had been overtaken by the spirit of the mantis shrimp.

Aira Shiratori (ÁôΩÈ≥• ÊÑõÁæÖ, Shiratori Aira?) is one of the main characters of the manga series Dandadan.

She is a former popular student at Kami High who later became one of Momo Ayase and Okarun's main allies whenever the two are faced with the paranormal.

Appearance

Aira is a young woman with short light pink hair that mostly frames the left side of her face and dark-pink eyes. She is recognized as being very attractive by the boys at her school, which she is aware of and greatly takes great pride in.

Her common attire is her school uniform; a dark buttoned up blazer with her school emblem located around the left breast, a collared shirt, a bow, a dark short skirt, long socks and sandals. She also wears a long sleeve sweater that varies underneath her blazer.
Gallery


Personality

Episode 5-1
Aira hiding behind her sweet school girl persona.
Initially, Aira reveled in her social status as the popular girl at Kami High and strove to maintain her reputation. Outwardly, she appeared sweet, innocent, and somewhat air headed. However, internally, she was vain, arrogant, and insensitive. Her beauty became a tool for teasing her male classmates, and she looked down upon them for being easily charmed by her facade. She was also not above committing acts of cruelty when provoked by others, having anonymously spread a nasty rumor about Momo after the latter used her powers to drop a tub on her head as a form of retaliation for making fun of Okarun.

Aira exorcising Momo (Anime)
Aira trying to exorcise Momo.
Upon discovering Okarun's kintama, Aira developed a messiah complex, that her newfound ability to see spirits, triggered by the golden ball, was a divine sign that she was the chosen one destined to protect the world from evil. This grandiose belief was compounded by her vanity, as she considered her beauty to be a key reason for her selection. She labeled Momo as a demon and an adversary after witnessing the manifestation of her psychic abilities, which she referred to as "demon wings". It was then on that Aira made it her mission to defeat Momo. This side of Aira soon faded by the time the Evil Eye became housed within Jiji.

Despite her self-importance and ruthlessness, Aira is not without a guilty conscience. Overcome with guilt for initiating the unpleasant rumor about Momo after her classmates assumed, based off her false story, that the latter was to blame for Aira's humiliation of being exposed in her underwear at school, Aira confessed to her deplorable actions, absolving Momo's name at the expense of her own popularity. She also sincerely apologized to Momo for endangering her with the Evil Eye after accidently splashing her cold beverage on Jiji. Memory of this incident even drove her to continue fighting against the giants summoned by the Music Room Portraits.

Acrobatic Silky goes to heaven (Anime)
Aira helps Acrobatic Silky achieve Nirvana.
She is also capable of experiencing empathy and demonstrating compassion towards others. Despite nearly dying from being swallowed by Acrobatic Silky, Aira felt sorry for the yokai upon learning from Turbo Granny that she would be forgotten by both the living and the dead once her body crumbled away into nothingness without her aura and ensured she achieved Nirvana by embracing her and acknowledging her as her mother. Along with this, she vowed to always remember her and expressed a heartfelt wish for Acrobatic Silky and her child to find peace together in the next life. Upon witnessing Bamora's memories and comprehending the anguish endured by the alien girl at the hands of the Kur, Aira was moved to tears and pledged to vanquish the exosuit aliens in Bamora's honor.

Aira's strictness
Aira being strict with Momo, Jiji, and Mr. Mantis Shrimp for their poor training performance.
After losing her popularity at school, Aira ceased the facade she put on for others. Once she integrated into the social circle formed by Momo and Okarun, she is much more open with her true self, which is marked by pride, sternness, and a tendency to be dismissive. As such, she asserts her position as the de facto leader of the gang and expresses a strong aversion to being left out of their endeavors or whenever someone else takes the lead in their battles. Due to this self-imposed leadership role, she also hosts the most distrust of outsiders to the Family, often barking that new members had to be approved by her first before they could join. She also does not hesitate to speak bluntly when she needs to make her point, such as when she expressed how unfair it was for her, Momo, Okarun, and Seiko to keep monitoring Jiji after he decides to spare the Evil Eye from exorcism. She was also very strict with Momo, Jiji, and Mr. Mantis Shrimp for their poor training performance. Aside from this, Aira cares for them as not only her comrades in arms but as her friends she has grown close to.

Despite her serious disposition, Aira has moments where she can be mischievous and playful. She thought about dropping by Moe Moe Kikoho to tease Momo after learning from Jiji that she works as a maid and poked fun of Momo and Jiji for sleeping close together. She also has a soft spot for things she finds cute. Though she disapproved of Mr. Mantis Shrimp returning to Kamigoe City to become a resident, she immediately changed her mind after meeting Chiquitita, finding him adorable to hug and play with. Enamored by Momo's tiny size, Aira felt the urge to play with her as a doll.

Aira's fantasy date
Aira fantasizing about a date with Okarun.
Touched by Okarun's altruistic nature, which had prompted him to come to her aid during her confrontation with Acrobatic Silky, Aira developed a crush on him that she does not hide. Her demeanor with Okarun is noticeably kinder and warmer compared to her interactions with other classmates, and she often finds herself blushing and enchanted by his presence whenever he is near. Aira is prepared to offer her help to Okarun in any manner possible, holding the belief that a girl who supports his virtuous character is deserving of being his companion. She is also shown to be susceptible to jealousy, as she and Momo tried moving Bamora away from Okarun after she approached him too close, while also reprimanding her for addressing him casually. Aira acknowledges her ignorance on how to deal with her romantic feelings, having never felt such emotions for anyone prior to Okarun. In an effort to find clarity, she consulted her father's "books", which ultimately prompted her to make an impulsive attempt to kiss Okarun.

Aira is also modest, as she has moments of being cautious about her skirt accidently flashing her underwear when fighting. Additionally, she dislikes having her clothes ruined in battle, especially her school uniform.
Background

Around the time she was a little girl, Aira had ran into a strange woman in red on the streets and had mistaken her for her deceased mother. Realizing her mistake, Aira returned to walking with her father, but became unaware that the mysterious woman started to follow her throughout her life.[1]

During her childhood, Aira learned how to play the piano and competed against children her age. After losing against a girl named Kouki Yukishiro, Aira became dedicated to improving her skills until she managed to beat her. However, she soon quit playing right after, having found it tedious.[2]
Abilities and Powers

Supernatural Abilities

Spiritual Power

Spiritual Awareness [v ¬∑ e]
Aira was able to see spirits when she was a child but had lost the ability at some point. Her awareness soon reawakened after coming into contact with one of Okarun's kintama.
Episode 7
Acrobatic Silky Form
After being transferred Acrobatic Silky's aura, Aira subsequently inherited the yokai's powers as a result. When choosing to access Acrobatic Silky's powers, Aira enters a form where her hair increases in volume and gains a mask that resembles the yokai's face; covering all the way down to her neck while leaving her left eye exposed.

By Aira's account, Acrobatic Silky's personality also ends up influencing her, as she explained to Okarun that she inadvertently starts to become foul mouthed to those who show her disrespect (though this could have very well been an excuse to prevent having Okarun look at her differently).

Aira's Acrobatic Silky Form
Enhanced Speed and Agility
Aira dodges Dover Demon
This state grants Aira Acrobatic Silky's extraordinary agility and swiftness to perform graceful acrobatic maneuvers, thus granting her a body that allows balance, flexibility, dexterity, and bodily coordination.
Strengths and Weaknesses
Aira's enhanced body to use Acrobatic Silky's acrobatics allows her to run along walls and execute flips, making her a challenging target to hit. This prowess was evident when she effortlessly evaded all of Mr. Mantis Shrimp's powerful punches and swiftly dodged a Serpo's invisible psychokinetic attack (though only after being hit by it once). In the confrontation with the Music Room Portraits, Aira dodged every explosive musical note, despite the reduced traction on the illusory terrain created by the tulpas. According to Turbo Granny's rhythm analysis, Aira's speed enables her to perform four distinct actions within a single beat, a feat comparable to that of the Evil Eye's speed.

A major weakness is Aira's acrobatic movement being hindered, as she was left vulnerable to Mr. Mantis Shrimp's punches after the Serpo used their psychokinesis to bind her. After being casted into an illusionary paddy field by the Music Room Portraits, Aira could not run or evade attacks effectively as she wanted to due to the terrain causing her feet to sink. Aira's opponents can also make it hard for her to find an opening to counterattack if they have her become too occupied with dodging a barrage of incoming attacks. Attacks that are not made visible to the naked eye prove to be difficult for Aira to evade unless anticipated on time from small hints (such as the name of the attack being called out) or if she is aided by an ally who can see the attack to quickly move her out of the way. Additionally, she cannot evade large-scale attacks from giant opponents.
Enhanced Lower Leg Strength
Aira vs the Dover Demon
Along with incredible speed and reflexes, Acrobatic Silky's power bestows above average physical leg strength to Aira's human body, thus granting her the close quarters combat capabilities to fight against powerful enemies by executing powerful kicks. With a single kick, she was capable of sending Mr. Mantis Shrimp up towards a ceiling.
Enhanced Endurance and Durability
Moreover, Aira has displayed immense levels of physical endurance and durability, as she had recovered shortly after taking a devastating blow from Mr. Mantis Shrimp. In addition, she was able to endure taking on direct attacks from the Serpo Dover Demon Nessie whose large size made Mr. Mantis Shrimp's punches much more powerful. During her confrontation with the Music Room Portraits, Aira was able to remain conscious after taking damage from two giants created by the tulpas and was still on her feet by the time she took them down. Most impressively, Aira remained conscious and did not take heavy damage from a direct attack from the enlarged Sumerian God Exosuit.
Acrobatics
Aira using Acrobatic
Along with the increase in physical ability, the most prominent power Aira is granted is Acrobatic Silky's special ability to elongate her hair to great lengths, with which she can freely manipulate to perform tasks.
Strengths and Weaknesses
Aira lifting cars
The hair is very strong and prehensile, as it can lift people or heavy objects, such as cars, and bind targets. What range limit, if any, there may be for her elongated hair is not known.

While strong enough to pick up heavy objects, the resilience of Aira's hair does not change from how it normally is in her base form, thus causing it to be suspectable to damage, such as it being caught on fire. Aira's hair may also be hindered from reaching her intended target if it is hit by an incoming attack.
Usage
Aira sparring with Mr. Mantis Shrimp
Aira uses Acrobatics for combat. While relying on her enhanced leg strength to execute strong kicks that are coupled with her acrobatic movement, Aira uses the malleability of her hair to reinforce this fighting style and to grab her enemies. Once entangled by her hair, Aira can choose to pull her opponents towards her to close the distance and attack or pull herself towards them to build up enough force behind her kicks. Other purposes include restraining or blinding her enemies, hurling objects at them, or to cover ground by latching onto large constructs and swinging herself to a desire location. All these capabilities make Aira out to be a formidable hand-to-hand combatant.

If choosing to retreat after being at a disadvantage, Aira uses her hair as a diversion by covering herself and her surrounding area, concealing her plan to escape and leave the battlefield unnoticed, along with any nearby allies.

Aira's hair drill leg
After being informed about the Power of Words and Spiral Power from Momo and Okarun, Aira began utilizing these two abilities in conjunction with her yokai powers to improve her offense. Using Spiral Power, Aira shapes her hair into drills around her legs to pierce through her opponents and penetrate tough material, such as suits of armor. The hair drill legs also help to give her further reach. With the Power of Words, Aira is able to execute even stronger attacks with her hair manipulation.

For defensive means, Aira can form a protective dome by wrapping her hair around herself, which can reform if taken damage by a destructive attack.
Techniques
Pirouette Noble Drill
(„Éî„É´„Ç®„ÉÉ„Éà„Åä„Éâ„É™„É´, Piruetto O-Doriru?)
Pirouette Noble Drill
Using Spiral Power, Aira has her elongated hair wrap around herself to form a full body size drill and launches herself towards her opponent to pierce straight through them. While drilling, Aira uses the Power of Words by shouting out the technique's name in order to increase its attack power. It was first used against the missile suit alien, which proved to be strong enough to drill straight through the hardness of the alien's armored suit.

Turbo Granny („Çø„Éº„Éú„Éê„Éê„Ç¢, TƒÅbo BabƒÅ?) is a well-known yokai that was previously within a tunnel located at Shono City until her confrontation with Momo Ayase and Okarun. After having her powers sealed within Okarun, along with her consciousness being trapped inside a stuffed doll, Turbo Granny makes a deal with Momo to help Okarun find his kintama in exchange for having her powers back.

In Dandadan, she served as the primary antagonist during the Turbo Granny Arc but has since become a major supporting character throughout the series.

Appearance

The yokai took on the form of a very elderly woman with reddish brown wrinkled skin, long thick white shaggy hair, wide eyes with a yellow sclera and were stuck looked to the sides. When possessing her targets, she has her victims transform into a mirror image of herself, albeit with a large mouth with teeth that is capable of biting off body parts.

After having her consciousness extracted from Okarun, Turbo Granny is forced to inhabit a maneki-neko doll.
Gallery

Turbo Granny's maneki-neko body anime concept art.
Turbo Granny's maneki-neko body anime concept art.
Turbo Granny's anime concept art.
Turbo Granny's anime concept art.
Personality

Turbo Granny is a yokai that acts cruel, sadistic, and is extremely foul-mouthed. She is also rather somewhat vulgar, as she offered Okarun a chance to suckle on her breasts in exchange for consuming his family jewels. Since she possesses impressive running power, Turbo Granny takes great pride in her speed and refuses to be underestimated. When challenged to prove herself, she is not above using trickery to get her way, having been deceitful with Okarun and Momo in their game of tag by counting irregularly. Despite her negative attitude, she is revealed to have a compassionate side, as Seiko stated that Turbo Granny would most commonly wander off to spirits of girls who died tragically in order to comfort them, which was the reason as to why she fused with the Earthbound Spirit Crab within Shono City.
Background

During modern times, the Turbo Granny was a yokai known as the 100 km/hr Granny (100„Ç≠„É≠„Éê„Éê„Ç¢, 100 Kiro BabƒÅ?) that went around terrorizing the people of Japan. While wandering about, the Turbo Granny comforted the spirits of deceased girls who died horrible deaths and eventually fused with an earthbound spirit within a tunnel in Shono City and would curse those who would dare enter her territory by stealing their reproductive organs.
Abilities and Powers

Statistics [v ¬∑ e]
Attack	
90/100	Turbo Granny's Stats

120/100

90/100

30/100
