Spiritual Power

Immense Speed [v ¬∑ e]
As her name implies, Turbo Granny possesses incredible speed that enables her to run at velocities of up to 100 km/h (62.1 mph).
Turbo Granny speed
Strengths and Weaknesses
The major strength of Turbo Granny's extreme speed is that it enables her to transverse great distances. As noted by the yokai herself, she is able maintain a consistent running speed even while turning, giving her an edge over faster vehicles, such as a train traveling at 120 km/h.
Usage
As stated in her urban legend, Turbo Granny employs her speed to capture anyone attempting to flee from her, and once caught, she casts her curse upon them.
Phone Teleportation
Turbo Granny has the ability to teleport through phone lines by utilizing her speed and her understanding of the world's spirals, specifically the spiral-shaped magnetic fields that flow around electrical currents.
Turbo Granny Telephone Portal
Strengths and Weaknesses
The primary advantage of this ability is that Turbo Granny can teleport herself to any location where a phone is present.
Usage
Turbo Granny employed this ability to appear inside the Serpos' spaceship directly from Momo's mobile phone while possessing Okarun's body.
Spiritual Form
Turbo Granny has the power to dematerialize her physical body into a spiritual form.
Turbo Granny Spirit Form
Strengths and Weaknesses
Turbo Granny and Earthbound Spirit Crab Fusion Form (Anime)
Turbo Granny's spiritual form's primary strength is her ability to possess her target's body, gaining complete control over their actions. Even while possessing someone else's body, she retains her other powers, especially her immense speed. Her possession applies not only to humans but also to spirits, as demonstrated when she took over the body of the Earthbound Spirit Crab in preparation to play a game of cat-and-mouse with Momo.
Usage
Turbo Granny employed her spiritual form to take control of Okarun after facing difficulty in detaching him from her breast. Later, she entered her spiritual form to take over the Earthbound Spirit Crab's body to put an end to her confrontation with Momo.
Curse
Turbo Granny has the power to curse anyone she encounters who attempts to flee from her presence by stealing their genitalia. Her curse manifests as a possession, causing the victim's body to morph into her likeness and their consciousness to be overtaken by the yokai who goes on a rampage attacking others without discrimination.
Turbo Granny Curse
Strengths and Weaknesses
Turbo Granny's possession-induce curse enables her to remotely take control of her victim's body while her real body is situated elsewhere. Like her direct possession using her spirit form, Turbo Granny's immense speed also accompanies her.

Episode 3-3
When excluding the need to attack anyone, Turbo Granny can utilize the possessed as intermediaries to communicate remotely from her main body, located in a pocket dimension where time progresses only for the yokai and the chosen interlocutor. Additionally, her curse is contagious, enabling Turbo Granny to inflict harm on anyone who has seen the possessed, potentially causing heart attacks, strokes, or inducing bleeding from the nose and ears.

The curse can only be broken if the afflicted person recovers their genitalia or performs an exorcism on Turbo Granny.
Usage
As stated in her urban legend, Turbo Granny casts her curse upon anyone attempting to flee from her inside the Earthbound Spirit Crab's tunnel after catching them with her tremendous speed.
Fusion
Turbo Granny has the ability to merge with any willing spirit.
Turbo Granny and Earthbound Spirit Crab fused
Strengths and Weaknesses
The major strength of Turbo Granny's fusion with spirits is that it gives her access to their abilities for her to use in any way. Depending on the type of spirit she fuses and collaborates with, Turbo Granny can become a fearsome yokai.
Usage
Turbo Granny merged with the Earthbound Spirit Crab in the tunnel of Shono City to console the spirits of the girls who had met tragic ends in that vicinity. As a result, she had accessed to its control over Shono City.
Other Abilities

Luck Inducement [v ¬∑ e]
Due to being inside a maneki-neko doll, Turbo Granny claims to have acquired the charm's superstitious power, granting her the ability to confer good fortune upon others.
Strengths and Weaknesses
Simply by being in proximity to others, Turbo Granny can bestow upon them luck that overrides any unfortunate occurrences at the moment. In confrontational scenarios, those favored with Turbo Granny's luck gain an advantage over their adversaries, rendering the latter unlucky in the process.

While an advantageous power, Turbo Granny cannot control her luck to favor specific individuals intentionally. Hence, this ability occurs randomly. Moreover, it is indiscriminate, meaning that Turbo Granny's luck is not guaranteed to always favor her and her allies and could inadvertently benefit foes.
Usage
Turbo Granny's luck bestowment usually activates whenever she accompanies the Family and they are in danger.
Former Abilities and Powers

Earthbound Spirit Crab Fusion

Territory Control [v ¬∑ e]
While fused with the Earthbound Spirit Crab of Shono City, Turbo Granny acquired its dominion over the territory it resided in.
Turbo Granny ground grabbing Momo
Strengths and Weaknesses
Possession (Anime)
With this power, Turbo Granny could alter the environment of any particular area in Shono City, with the tunnel of the Earthbound Spirit Crab as her primary location. For instance, she could summon multiple hands from the ground to seize and imprison her targets. The two spirits could even communicate with the spirits dwelling in the vast cemetery at Shono City's outskirts, enlisting their assistance by possessing the residents. This power essentially rendered Turbo Granny and the Earthbound Spirit Crab almost invincible as long as their targets were within Shono City.

Since this power was limited to Shono City, Turbo Granny and the Earthbound Spirit Crab forfeited their advantage over their enemies once they stepped outside the city's boundaries.

The Evil Eye (ÈÇ™Ë¶ñ, Jashi?) is a yokai who has spent years bound to the Tsuchinoko sacrificial house. After possessing Jiji, the Evil Eye made it his goal to kill all humans he comes across. However, after becoming friends with Okarun through an exchange of fights, the Evil Eye makes a deal with him to only target him, thereby reducing his threat to the main cast.

In Dandadan, the Evil Eye serves as one of the primary antagonists during the Cursed House Arc and the primary antagonist in the Evil Eye Arc. He has since become a major supporting character throughout the series.

Appearance

The Evil Eye is a large, tall and lanky male with a bowl haircut, vertical eyes and a defining evil grin expression. As for attire, the Evil Eye wears nothing but underwear. As a spirit, the Evil Eye appeared the same as when he was alive, albeit with a healthier body. Upon failing to save a boy that was sacrificed by the Kito family, the Evil Eye adopted the boy's characteristics out of anger, thus lending to his current appearance.

As a human (during the remainder of his lifetime), the Evil Eye was an emaciated child, due to his imprisoners depriving him of food and water, with short hair and wore a dirty, ragged robe. Upon being sacrificed by the Kito Family, the Evil Eye wore nothing but a fundoshi.

When possessing Jiji's body, the Evil Eye causes the young man's hair to turn white, a ripple pattern third eye to appear at the center of his forehead, along with his other eyes changing to become yellow, and a dark marking to reach down his shoulders and frame his face. The possession also has an effect on Jiji's earrings, causing them to lengthen. Initially, the Evil Eye's possession impacted Jiji's wardrobe, leading to the destruction of all his clothes except for his underwear. This soon ceased after the Evil Eye gave Okarun his briefs.
Gallery

Evil Eye's anime concept art.
Evil Eye's anime concept art.
Anime concept art of the Evil Eye in his past life.
Anime concept art of the Evil Eye in his past life.
The Evil Eye's color scheme when possessing Jiji.
The Evil Eye's color scheme when possessing Jiji.
The Evil Eye's full appearance.
The Evil Eye's full appearance.
The Evil Eye as a spirit.
The Evil Eye as a spirit.
Personality

During the time he was alive, the Evil Eye was a hopeful child who had wished to play with the children he saw through the window from his prison. He was also shown to be empathetic, as he desperately tried to help a boy who was going to be used as a sacrifice just like he was a long time ago. After failing to save the child, however, the Evil Eye's personality took a darker turn, now becoming a resentful spirit with a desire to murder every human in his track.

After taking over Jiji's body, the Evil Eye is given the opportunity to act on his desires, presenting himself as being murderous, aggressive, and sadistic towards all humans, as well as anything else that might get in his way. He enjoys fighting, especially when up against those who have proven themselves capable of keeping up with him, and takes them seriously by wasting no effort on his opponent. He also hates it when his opponents try to retreat from him. As a yokai, the Evil Eye believes that it is disgraceful to see his own kind affiliate with the race he seeks to punish, as he did not think so highly of the Turbo Granny accompany Momo, thinking that she was her slave, and expressed his disapproval of Okarun defending Momo after mistaking him to be a yokai in his transformation.

Following the Evil Eye's confinement inside of Jiji, Okarun puts the Evil Eye's behavior into perspective, revealing that the yokai is no different from a newborn child that only has a desire to play and have fun, referring all the way back to his dying wish to play with the children he saw from his prison. However, presumably due to this desire being mixed with his victimization to the dark side of humanity, the Evil Eye has a misconceived notion that the act of killing humans is the same as playing with them and is therefore unaware of what constitutes as being right and wrong. As such, the Evil Eye has a childlike personality. While attending Jiji's school for the first time, with Momo as his chaperone, the Evil Eye acted rather loud and impulsive in class and displayed bad table manners during lunch by preferring to eat his food with his hands instead of using chopsticks as Momo instructed. Along with losing himself to play, he is also shown to be very impatient, as he desperately asked for Okarun to continue with their second battle after the human stopped using his transformation.
Background

When he was alive, the Evil Eye was a young boy who was chosen by the Kito Family to be a sacrifice for the Tsuchinoko in order to prevent his village from being destroyed by the eruption of its volcano. While suffering from malnourishment as time passed by in his imprisonment, the boy at one point watched from his cage as children were happily playing outside and desired up until his death to play along with them if just once.

After many years past since the sacrifice was made, the boy reappears in the living world as a spirit at the same place he was imprisoned, which has now been reconstructed into a sacrificial house by the Kito Family. As the family who were living there were having dinner, the boy becomes visible to the son and causes him to become frightened to see that a ghost had suddenly appeared, leading to the boy to try and interact with the son by dancing. When the time came for the son to be sacrificed by the Kito Family, after his parents committed suicide by hanging themselves, the boy desperately tries to help free him from his confinement but fails due to not having a physical body. Enraged by the Kito Family subjecting the child to the same involuntary sacrifice as he was when he was alive, the boy swore vengeance on them and would then go on to become known as the Evil Eye, an evil spirit who would curse others into committing suicide. As more sacrifices were being made over the years, the Evil Eye's hatred towards the Kito Family began to expand towards humanity as well and sought to eliminate all humans off the face of the Earth.
Abilities and Powers

Statistics [v ¬∑ e]

50/100	Evil Eye's Stats

70/100

100/100

Yokai Abilities

Curse [v ¬∑ e]
The Evil Eye is known to possess the curse ability to force people into committing suicide with its evil gaze.
Memory Sharing
Along with cursing humans with its gaze, the Evil Eye can also choose to share his memories with others after making eye contact with them, as he had Jiji look into his past.
Possession
As a yokai, the Evil Eye is capable of possessing humans to use as a vessel.


Jiji's Body

Physical Prowess

Enhanced Strength: Complimented by Jiji's athletic build, the Evil Eye possesses incredible physical strength to shatter surfaces and send normal size people flying backwards with his bare hands and legs. With a single kick, the Evil Eye can launch his grudge balls with great velocity that they are capable of piercing the Tsuchinoko's body. In his fight against Momo, Manjiro, and Naki, the Evil Eye was strong enough to break Naki's arm with a dropkick. The Evil Eye was also strong enough to completely obliterate the Ta Komeshi exosuit into pieces with a single punch while fighting Okarun and then he proceeds to decimate a group aliens in the process.

Enhanced Speed and Reflexes: The Evil Eye possesses remarkable speed, reflexes, and agility, being able to keep up with Okarun in his Turbo Granny form that has him reach top speed of about 100 km/hr. According to the Turbo Granny's rhythm analysis, the renown speedy yokai determined that the Evil Eye is capable of performing four different actions in the time it takes for him to jump and land on the ground once. Upon tracking down the Kito Family, the Evil Eye instantly took out four of the five members present, along with Manjiro, in a single rush attack. He was able to dodge a barrage of Seiko's bat swings for a short amount of time and reacted on time to jump up out of the way of a swift swing aimed towards his right leg from which he was standing on.

Enhanced Durability: The Evil Eye is given incredibly resilience when possessing Jiji's body. Despite being knocked out by Okarun in their first fight, the Evil Eye was able to recover in just a few minutes with no lasting damage and reach Momo, the Kito Family, and Manjiro from the Tsuchinoko's pit. After receiving a surprise kick to the face by Manjiro, the Evil Eye felt nothing from the attack and merely returned the favor. Furthermore, he was sturdy enough to take on hits from Seiko's bat that was swung with enough force to create craters on the ground. Most notably, the Evil Eye could withstand Naki's and Mr. Shrimp's attacks, combatants who are incredibly strong enough to completely destroy walls and send others flying back.

Skill Set

Skilled Hand-to-Hand Combatant: The Evil Eye is a very formidable fighter, being skilled enough to hold his own against strong opponents, even when outnumbered.

Possession Abilities

Grudge Construction [v ¬∑ e]
After possessing Jiji and gaining his incredible spiritual power, the Evil Eye becomes capable of summoning the grudges of those who were sacrificed by the Kito Family. Once summoned, the Evil Eye can shape them into anything he wishes. These grudges when shaped become solid and resilient constructs that affect anything in the living world.
Cursed House
(Âë™„ÅÑ„ÅÆÂÆ∂, Noroi no ie?)
Cursed House
The Evil Eye is able to use the grudges to construct a house-shaped dome around himself to protect against attacks. The Evil Eye refers to this dome as his Cursed House (Âë™„ÅÑ„ÅÆÂÆ∂, Noroi no ie?).
Strengths and Weaknesses
Momo confronted by the Evil Eye
Acting as a barrier, the Cursed House mainly serves as a defense. The size of the house can be freely manipulated by the Evil Eye to fit other people if he chooses to confine them with him. He can also remotely imprison his enemies inside the Cursed House once he has sent the grudges towards his opponent and can phase through the house to enter. By his own accord, the Cursed House is said to be both impenetrable and inescapable due to the grudges "rejecting" everything around, as shown when it repelled and burned Seiko's hand after she attempted to break through the barrier with a talisman and Okarun trying to break free in his Turbo-Granny form.

While the Cursed House is very resilient, it has been proven that devastating sheer force is capable of destroying it, as Okarun was capable of launching the Evil Eye out of it after building up enough power for a final attack in his Turbo-Granny form. This also implies that only strength equal to that of a yokai's, or the Evil Eye's, is capable of breaking through the barrier. When confining both himself and his opponent to attack them up close, the Evil Eye is liable to have the tables turn on him if his opponent sees his attacks coming and find an opening to strike back.
Usage
The Evil Eye uses his Cursed House for two purposes: to shield himself from outside forces or to imprison his enemies. In addition to the latter, the Evil Eye can face his opponent up close inside the house and be given the liberty to viciously attack them while they are prevented from effectively dodging due to the limited amount of space they are allowed to move in. If finding himself somehow prevented from reaching his target inside, the Evil Eye can further shrink the size of the house to correct this, as he did with Momo after she used her psychic powers to push him away from her.
Grudge Ball
Grudge Ball
The Evil Eye can have the grudges compress into a small ball and have it launch with a strong kick like a soccer ball.
Strengths and Weaknesses
Grudge ball bouncing
The main strength of the grudge ball is that it will ricochet off a solid surface and redirect back to the Evil Eye's intended target after striking them, or if the enemy manages to dodge the hit, to land another strike. This attack is shown to effectively barrage the enemy, as the grudge ball will continue to lock on to the target like a homing missile and assault them from all directions without losing its momentum until the Evil Eye calls back for it. This also makes it difficult for enemies to fight the Evil Eye in close combat. When not in use, the ball is shown to float beside the Evil Eye to remain on standby. Whether these actions are due to the Evil Eye's control or the ball having a mind of its own is unclear. The ball can also make contact with things that are intangible, such as Momo's psychic hands. The Evil Eye is also shown capable of sending out multiple grudge balls by striking the initial ball with a single punch. With more than one grudge ball bouncing around the area, this attack makes it even more difficult for the Evil Eye's opponent to defend against or avoid while they are forced to face off against the yokai up close.

So far, the only known ways to counter the Evil Eye's grudge ball is if an opponent manages to stop its pre-launch with strength comparable or greater to the Evil Eye's or if they were to have great speed and reflexes to continuously dodge it while in flight.
Usage
Evil Eye fighting Okarun
The Evil Eye uses the grudge ball for offensive purposes. While engaging in close quarters combat, the Evil Eye will have his grudge ball actively bounce around as it locks onto his opponent to strike them, effectively causing complications for the enemy as the Evil Eye has them too focused on fighting him to worry about the grudge ball homing in on them.

Acrobatic Silky („Ç¢„ÇØ„É≠„Éê„ÉÜ„Ç£„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Åï„Çâ„Åï„Çâ, Akurobatikku Sarasara?) was a yokai that had been stalking Aira Shiratori ever since she was a little girl.

In Dandadan, she served as the primary antagonist during the Acrobatic Silky Arc.

Appearance

Acrobatic Silky took on the form of an extremely tall woman with grey skin, long limbs and long silky jet-black hair. She had a narrow face with hollowed eyes, wrinkles on the upper half of her face and a permanent lipstick smile that exposes her big teeth. She had red nail polish both on her fingers and on her toes, her fingernails were long. She walked around barefooted while wearing a red wide brimmed hat and a red dress (which resembles the one she brought for her daughter) with the violet collar forming her long neck. Initially, Acrobatic Silky's face looked the way it did when she was alive until the day she had met Aira Shiratori.

When she was alive, Acrobatic Silky was a woman with fair skin, brown eyes, long black hair that usually covered the right side of her face and had a mole on the corner of her left eye.
Gallery

Yokai

Acrobatic Silky's anime concept art.
Acrobatic Silky's anime concept art.

Acrobatic Silky during her lifetime.
Acrobatic Silky during her lifetime.
Personality

Due to her tragic past of having her child taken from her, Acrobatic Silky was a yokai who had a desperate need to find a child to love and call her "mother". Her main attraction was Aira Shiratori after becoming delusional in thinking that she was her mother during the time she was alive and was obsessed with having her all to herself. Acrobatic Silky's intentions also leaned towards her maternal instincts to protect the one she loves, as she was willing to sacrifice her own aura in order to revive Aira and ripped out her jaw to assure Momo Ayase that she would not try to eat her.

She also took great pride in her acrobatic skills.
Background

Acrobatic Silky's past (Anime)
Acrobatic Silky with her daughter.
When she was alive, Acrobatic Silky was a woman who was in debt and had to work multiple jobs, including serving as a prostitute, working as a janitor and a convenience store clerk while taking care of her only daughter whom she loved dearly. After deciding to use some of the money she earned to buy her daughter a dress, the men she owed money to came to her home to collect what she had, beat her up bloody and kidnapped her child. The mother desperately chased after the van where the men took her daughter, but it proved futile as she fell and helplessly watched the van disappear from view. In despair combined with the knowledge she will never see her daughter again, the mother made one last dance on top of a roof before leaping off to her death, her final thoughts being her daughter.

Episode 7
Acrobatic Silky meets Aira.
The woman's spirit then wandered the city for an unknown amount of time and had lost her memories of the time she was alive, though she felt that she had lost something very important. While on the streets, a little girl named Aira Shiratori came up to her after mistaking her for her deceased mother and walks away with her father after realizing she was wrong. This misunderstanding caused the woman to believe that she was Aira's mother in her previous life and became obsessed with the idea of protecting her, an obsession which turned her into a yokai called an Acrobatic Silky. She then went on to spend the next ten years stalking her until she was able to see her again and call her "mother".
Synopsis

Kintama Hunt Saga

Acrobatic Silky Arc

Aira meets Acrobatic Silky (Anime)
Acrobatic Silky reunites with Aira.
Upon realizing that Aira Shiratori could see her again, Acrobatic Silky quickly took the opportunity to snatch her and force her to call her "mother" after the girl lured Momo Ayase to a trap.[1] While holding on to her, Momo and Okarun interfere to save Aira from Acrobatic Silky's grasp. However, Acrobatic Silky swallows Okarun and kicks Momo away to talk to Aira, wanting to remind her of their past encounter. After Aira calls her a monster, Acrobatic Silky becomes heartbroken, swallows Aira and blames Momo for Aira's misbehavior. She then uses her hair to attack her but tells Momo that she is willing to forgive her if she were to call her "mother", only for the girl to reject her request. After swallowing Momo, Acrobatic Silky cries wondering where her child is and demanded by Turbo Granny to release the children from her stomach. Not heeding the talking maneko-neko's recommendation, Acrobatic Silky becomes surprised to find her hair caught in her mouth on fire after Momo lit the rosary lighter Aira had, forcing Acrobatic Silky to vomit out the three children.[2]

Okarun defeats Acro-Silky (Anime)
Acrobatic Silky defeated by Okarun.
After attacking Momo, Acrobatic Silky targets Okarun carrying an unconscious Aira and manages to separate him from her. As she prepares to devour Aira, Acrobatic Silky finds herself unable to get close to her and realizes that her movements are restricted after permed hair becomes tangled up inside the building, just as Momo planned after instructing Okarun to move around the building. After struggling to free herself, Acrobatic Silky is taken down by Okarun using Turbo Granny's power to charge at her with enough force to send her crashing out of the building.[3]

Acrobatic Silky goes to heaven (Anime)
Acrobatic Silky helped by Aira to pass over to the afterlife.
Upon learning of Aira's death, as a result of swallowing her, Acrobatic Silky offers her aura to resurrect her. With Momo and Okarun wary of her intentions, Acrobatic Silky rips off her jaw to demonstrate her sincerity, even suggesting they could kill her if she betrayed them. Momo then proceeds to channel the yokai's aura into Aira, which results in Momo witnessing Acrobatic Silky's former life and her encounter with Aira. Once Aira is brought back to life, Acrobatic Silky's form starts to disintegrate, forfeiting her chance at Nirvana and vanishing into oblivion. Reflecting on her inability to protect her daughter, Acrobatic Silky is comforted by Aira's embrace and the term "mother," which calms her spirit, allowing her to depart serenely.[4]

Legacy

Aira's Acrobatic Silky Form
Aira using Acrobatic Silky's spiritual power for the first time.
Acrobatic Silky's aura that was transferred to Aira had the unsuspecting effect of endowing the young girl with the yokai's spiritual power. Ever since this power awakened, Aira has been utilizing it to fight back against paranormal enemies and assist her allies.

Abilities and Powers

Physical Prowess

Immense Speed and Agility: As her name suggests, Acrobatic Silky was a yokai who possessed extraordinary acrobatic skills. Her exceptional speed, agility, and reflexes enabled her to timely react and dodge a swift rush attack from Okarun utilizing Turbo Granny's speed.

Immense Strength: Acrobatic Silky possessed incredible leg strength as she could easily send a human flying with a single kick and could release herself from Momo Ayase's psychic restraint.

Immense Stamina & Endurance: Acrobatic Silky was shown to be durable enough to get back on her feet after taking damage from Okarun's full charge attack that sent her crashing back out of a building.

Acrobatic Silky possessed the power to manipulate her long jet-black hair.
Acrobatic Silky's Hair Manipulation
Strengths and Weaknesses
The primary advantage of this ability was that it enabled Acrobatic Silky to extend her hair to considerable lengths and wield it at will. Her hair could entangle anything in its vicinity, allowing her to capture and fling her opponents. Additionally, it aided her in traversing challenging landscapes.

A significant vulnerability of Acrobatic Silky's Acrobatics is its susceptibility to fire, which could lead to it being permed and complicate the process of untangling the objects she was attached to.
Usage
In conjunction with her acrobatic movements, Acrobatic Silky had been using Acrobatics to ensnare her surroundings. She could immobilize her enemies by binding and thrashing them, or employ her hair to seize objects and wield them as blunt instruments. Additionally, she could use her hair to navigate difficult terrain, enabling her to pursue any enemies attempting to escape.

Season 1
Urban Legend

Acrobatic Sara Sara, also known as Akusara, is a Japanese urban legend about a mysterious entity resembling a tall, slender woman with pale skin, clad in a red dress and a matching wide-brimmed hat, with long, silky black hair and a haunting presence. She is often seen in bustling cities engaging in dangerous acts, such as dancing atop high buildings, erratically moving on distant rooftops, and leaping off them like an acrobat. Following her performance, Acrobatic Sara Sara disappears without a trace, leaving onlookers bewildered and terrified. The legend states that those who observe Acrobatic Sara Sara's acrobatic display are cursed, doomed to experience misfortune or even death.
Trivia

Acrobatic Silky is the first and sole yokai in the series to have achieved Nirvana.
Acrobatic Silky's urban legend about her being the spirit of mother searching for her child draws parallels to the Mexican folklore of the vengeful ghost La Llorona.
Acrobatic Silky crying wonder where her child is after swallowing Momo also gives reference to La Llorona's name on top of her legend (her name translating as "the Crying Woman", the "Weeping Woman", the "Wailer" due to her wailing cries of her attempts to find her sons

Aira's closest friends at Kami High.

Synopsis

Acrobatic Silky Arc

The two girls joined up with Aira after she met Okarun and delightfully discuss how she toyed with his feelings. They then become shocked to see a basin suddenly falling on top of Aira's head and look to see Momo passing by as she snipes at them, which leads to them looking back at the basin in suspicion. The next day, Aira's friends support her decision to confront Momo but were weirded out by her delusionary behavior. When the time came, the two friends jumped Momo and tied her up to have Aira go through with her delusionary attempt to exorcise her. Momo then used her psychic powers to push the two girls off of her and knocks them unconscious after sending them back towards a wall.

Serpo Arc

Aira's friends came to pick her up from the nurse's office after her incident at school where she was seen in her underwear, along with Momo and Okarun. The girls quickly came to the conclusion that Momo was the one responsible and began to badmouth her along with their other classmates as they try to console Aira. After Aira confesses to being the one to spread the nasty false rumor about Momo, the two girls became shocked by this news and chose to stop associating themselves with her from then on. Sometime later, the girls, along with Aira's classmates distance themselves from Aira when they see her in the classroom. However, they're all surprised to see Momo and Okarun drag Aira out of the classroom.

One day, when Jiji accidentally transformed again into Evil Eye, he noticed Aira being lonesome and sees her friends distancing themselves from her. Evil Eye confronted the girls on why they chose to abandon her, with the girls explaining that their popularity would suffer as a result of associating with Aira again, but Evil Eye managed to convince them to make amends with their friend. During lunch, the girls remorsefully approached Aira, and apologized for their actions, hoping to be friends with her again, with Aira accepting them back.

The three girls slowly rekindle their friendship, with Momo taking notice. Not wanting to interrupt them, she decides not to ask Aira to accompany her and Okarun to Renjaku High School to look for Unji.

1.content:
The Pistol is primarily used by low-ranking combatants, or as a backup weapon by most enemies when out of ammo on their primary weapon(s). Highly accurate. Has the appearance of a Heckler and Koch Mk23 pistol.

Moderate damage, moderate capacity, slow rate of fire.
Magazine capacity of 13 bullets, holds an ammo reserve of 65.

2.content:
The Shotgun is deadly pump-action 10 gauge SPAS-12 that tears through enemies. Weak against armored opponents. Has the appearance of a Spas-12 shotgun

High damage, low capacity, slow rate of fire.
Magazine capacity of 8 shells, holds an ammo reserve of 24.

3.content:
A Fast-firing submachine gun that can maintain a high suppressive force. Has high recoil when holding down the trigger. Has the appearance of a KRISS Vector SBR

Low damage, high capacity, high rate of fire.
Magazine capacity of 50 bullets, holds an ammo reserve of 200.

4.content:
Standard ArmaLite Rifle, used by a vast majority of well-equipped combatants. Able to occasionally pierce through weak helmets. Has the appearance of a HS Produkt VHS-D2 Rifle.

High damage, moderate capacity, moderate rate of fire.
Magazine capacity of 30 bullets, holds an ammo reserve of 90.

5.content:
The DMR is a highly accurate rifle that always comes equipped with a scope. Strong against armor. Has the appearance of a Heckler and Koch SL8 DMR.

High damage, moderate capacity, moderate rate of fire.
Magazine capacity of 10 bullets, holds an ammo reserve of 30.

6.content:
Specialized weapon that fires a burst of 3 explosive bolts. The bolts can impact into an enemy.

High damage, low capacity, slow rate of fire.
Magazine capacity of 3 bolts, holds an ammo reserve of 18.

7.content:
Specialized squad automatic weapon. Shreds through enemy squads. Has the appearance of a FN Minimi/MK46 Mod 0 with a downsized barrel.

Moderate damage, high capacity, high rate of fire.
Magazine capacity of 200 bullets, holds an ammo reserve of 200.

8.content:
A powerful revolver which occasionally replaces the pistols of soldiers. Strong against armor. Has the appearance of a Ruger GP100

High damage, low capacity, moderate rate of fire.
Magazine capacity of 6 bullets, holds an ammo reserve of 30.

9.content:
An LMG meant for prolonged fire. It increases in accuracy over time. Has the appearance of a Surefire MGX Machine Gun.

Low damage (slightly higher than SMG's), moderate rate of fire.
Magazine capacity of 50 bullets, holds an ammo reserve of 200.

10.content:
A powerful melee weapon. Can be used to lu ge at enemies. Weak against heavily armored opponents. This weapon is only exclusive to the cycles. Has a the edge of the sword has an orange searing look, which allows for nearly butter-like slices. It has no hand-guard, and has a tactical grip on the hilt.

High damage against soft targets, bounces right off (very low damage) against heavily armored soldiers.
Infinite uses.

0.name: Aura
0.content:
<aura>
Aura is the manifestation of one's soul in the world of Remnant. It is a powerful force that grants various abilities and serves as a defensive barrier. Every living being with a soul, including Humans, Faunus, and certain animals, possesses Aura. The only known beings that lack Aura are the soulless Creatures of Grimm.

Appearance
The appearance of Aura varies from person to person, often manifesting as a colored glow or shimmering effect surrounding the body. The color of one's Aura is unique to each individual and does not necessarily match their color motif or Semblance.

Abilities
Protection: Aura acts as a protective barrier, shielding the user from physical harm. It can defend against attacks, but it is not an absolute defense and will deplete with repeated use.
Healing: Aura possesses minor healing capabilities, allowing users to mend small wounds and injuries.
Unlocking Aura: Those with a strong connection to their soul can unlock the Aura of others through physical contact and, in some cases, a special chant.
Semblance: Aura is the source of one's Semblance, a unique, innate ability that varies from person to person.
Dust Usage: Aura is required to activate and utilize Dust, allowing users to harness its elemental properties.
Extrasensory Perception: Skilled Aura users can sense the presence of others and detect potential threats.
Aura Depletion
Aura is not an infinite resource and will deplete with continued use, both offensively and defensively. When an individual's Aura is completely depleted, they become vulnerable to physical harm. Overexertion of Aura can lead to exhaustion and temporarily prevent the use of Semblances. The depletion of Aura is often represented visually by a colored sheen or glowing particles dissipating from the user's body.

Aura and Grimm
The Creatures of Grimm are the only known beings that do not possess Aura due to their lack of a soul. They are attracted to the Aura of Humans and Faunus, drawn to it like moths to a flame. Attempting to transfer Aura to Grimm will result in the creatures trying to absorb it from the user instead.

Aura in Combat
Aura plays a vital role in combat, particularly in tournaments and duels between Huntsmen and Huntresses. Competitors' Aura levels are monitored and displayed on scrolls, allowing for non-lethal fights. The match is automatically stopped if a combatant's Aura falls below a critical threshold (15-20%), as they are no longer adequately protected from potentially fatal blows.

Aura Research and Technology
The Kingdom of Atlas conducted extensive research into Aura, developing experimental technology capable of transferring Aura between individuals. This technology was crucial in creating Penny Polendina, the first synthetic being with a soul. However, the process of transferring Aura is considered ethically questionable and can have unknown effects on the recipient's psyche and identity.
</aura>

1.name: Dust
1.content:
<dust>
Dust is a naturally occurring energy propellant that can be triggered by the Aura of Humans and Faunus. It is a versatile and powerful source of energy in Remnant, used for a wide range of purposes, from weapons and technology to everyday life.

History
- The discovery of Dust was a turning point in mankind's struggle against the Grimm, allowing them to fight back and build civilizations.
- In the modern era, Dust has become integrated into every aspect of life in Remnant.
- The Schnee Dust Company was one of the largest producers and distributors of Dust, with mines and processing facilities across Remnant.

Properties
- Dust exists in two states: crystalline and powdered.
- Both forms are highly explosive and can be triggered by Aura.
- The four basic types of Dust are Fire, Water, Lightning, and Wind, each with unique properties.
- Dust types can be combined to create new forms with varying effects, such as Steam and Gravity Dust.
- Dust does not function outside of Remnant's atmosphere, precluding the possibility of space flight.

Usage
Combat:
- Dust can be used in its raw form, such as conjuring fireballs or creating gusts of wind.
- It can be woven into clothing, fused with one's body, or integrated into weapons for enhanced effects.
- Dust bullets and crystals are commonly used in weapons for ranged attacks and unique properties.

Semblances:
- Some Semblances can interact with Dust in unique ways, such as Blake's Shadow clones taking on elemental properties.

Utility:
- Dust is used to power vehicles, appliances, and other technology in Remnant.
- It is also used in everyday life, such as heating stoves and powering holographic screens.

Production and Distribution
- Dust is mined from quarries, purified, and transported to distributors and shops for sale to the public.
- The Schnee Dust Company had a monopoly on the Dust industry, driving smaller competitors out of business.
- Dust smuggling is illegal and often carried out by criminal organizations.
- The destruction of Atlas and the Schnee Dust Company headquarters is likely to significantly impact Dust availability and prices.
</dust>

2.name: Emblem
2.content:
<emblem>
Emblems are personal symbols that represent individuals in the world of Remnant. They serve as a unique signature for each person and are often displayed on their weapons, armor, clothing, and other personal belongings. Emblems can also be found as tattoos on some people.

Design and Inspiration
Emblem designs vary greatly and can include objects, flowers, animals, illustrations, geometric shapes, letters, and symbols. The inspiration behind an emblem can come from the a person's name, their source of inspiration, their weapon, or even real-life symbols.

While most emblems are unique to each individual, some are shared among family members or organizations. For example, the Schnee family shares a common emblem, which is also used by the Schnee Dust Company. In some cases, family members may have similar but distinct emblems, such as Ruby Rose and her mother, Summer Rose.

Colors
Although emblems are often associated with a person's personal color scheme, they can appear in any color and are not limited to a specific palette.

Notable Emblems
Team RWBY:
- Ruby Rose: A stylized rose
- Weiss Schnee: A snowflake
- Blake Belladonna: A belladonna flower
- Yang Xiao Long: A burning heart

Team JNPR:
- Jaune Arc: Two crescent arcs
- Nora Valkyrie: A hammer with a lightning bolt
- Pyrrha Nikos: A shield and spear
- Lie Ren: A lotus flower

Other Characters:
- Ozpin: A clockwork gear
- Cinder Fall: A pair of high-heel slippers
- Roman Torchwick: A jack-o'-lantern
- Neopolitan: A Neapolitan ice cream cone

Kingdoms and Organizations:
- Kingdoms of Vale, Atlas, Vacuo, and Mistral each have their own emblems
- White Fang (original and rebuilt): A white wolf head with three claw marks
- White Fang (terrorist): A red wolf head with three claw marks
- Schnee Dust Company: The Schnee family snowflake emblem
</emblem>

3.name: Faunus
3.content:
<faunus>
Faunus are one of the two intelligent races that inhabit Remnant, the other being Humans. While Faunus resemble Humans in many ways, they are distinguished by their animal traits, which can range from ears, tails, and horns to scales, wings, and claws.

Biology and Traits
Faunus possess a wide variety of animal traits, with some being more common than others. Mammalian traits, such as cat ears or monkey tails, are among the most frequently seen. Other Faunus may have traits of reptiles, fish, or even arachnids. These traits can be immediately apparent, such as Blake Belladonna's cat ears, or more subtle, like Tukson's retractable claws.

Most Faunus have a single physical animal trait, though this seems to apply only to body appendages and dermis. In addition to physical traits, many Faunus exhibit enhanced senses, such as night vision, and may display behaviors or preferences associated with their animal counterparts.

Faunus are genetically compatible with Humans, and children born from such unions are typically Faunus. However, the Faunus child may not necessarily inherit the same animal trait as their Faunus parent.

Notable Faunus Types
- Mammal Faunus: The most common type, often with animal ears or tails.
- Reptilian Faunus: Rare, usually with scaled skin.
- Fish Faunus: Rare, sometimes referred to as Remnant's mermaids.
- Winged Faunus: Another rare type.
- Arachnid Faunus: Rare, with significant non-human alterations to their bodies.

Special Abilities
Some Faunus possess unique abilities related to their animal traits, such as Tyrian Callows' scorpion venom or Ilia Amitola's chameleon-like camouflage. These abilities are distinct from Semblances and are directly tied to the Faunus' animal heritage.

Religion and Creation Myths
In Faunus folklore, there are conflicting creation myths involving a deity known as the God of Animals. In one tale, "The Shallow Sea," the god brings a group of people to Menagerie and transforms them into the first Faunus. Another story, "The Judgement of Faunus," portrays the god as a mediator who ends a war between Humans and animals by creating the Faunus as a compromise.

While the truth behind these myths is uncertain, they provide insight into the Faunus' cultural beliefs and their relationship with Humans. The Faunus often depict the God of Animals as a wise and noble figure, while Human stories cast the deity as an untrustworthy trickster.
</faunus>

4.name: Grimm
4.content:
<grimm>
The Creatures of Grimm, or simply Grimm, are soulless monsters that inhabit the majority of Remnant. Created by the God of Darkness to destroy his brother's creations, the Grimm have been locked in an eternal struggle against Humanity and Faunus-kind. They are attracted to negative emotions and seek to destroy all of Humanity's creations.

Grimm come in a variety of shapes and sizes, with abilities inspired by creatures both real and mythological. Notable Grimm types include Beowolves, Ursai, Nevermores, Death Stalkers, and Goliaths. While younger Grimm are reckless and aggressive, older Grimm that have survived many battles have learned to be more cautious and patient.

Grimm do not require sustenance and exist solely to kill. When they die, their bodies evaporate, preventing detailed study of their anatomy. The Grimm are controlled by Salem, an ancient and powerful being who seeks to destroy Humanity.

Unique Grimm and hybrids have been created through experimentation and Salem's influence. Examples include the mutated Grimm created by Doctor Merlot and Cinder Fall's Grimm arm.

Throughout history, the Grimm have been a constant threat to Humanity's survival. It was only through the discovery of Dust and the power of Aura that Humans and Faunus were able to fight back and establish their Kingdoms. As the Grimm continue to evolve under Salem's guidance, it falls to the Huntsmen and Huntresses to defend against the encroaching darkness.
</grimm>

5.name: Huntsman, Huntress
5.content:
<huntsmen>
Huntsmen and Huntresses are the elite warriors of Remnant, dedicated to protecting the world from the threat of the Creatures of Grimm. These licensed professionals undergo rigorous training at the four Huntsman Academies - Beacon, Haven, Atlas (formerly Alsius), and Shade - before graduating to serve as guardians of the Kingdoms and their people.

Training and Education
Aspiring Huntsmen and Huntresses often begin their journey at primary combat schools like Signal Academy in Vale or Sanctum Academy in Mistral. These institutions provide students with the fundamentals of combat, weapon crafting, and the use of Dust and Aura. Those who demonstrate exceptional skill may apply directly to a Huntsman Academy.

At the Huntsman Academies, students are grouped into teams of four to foster cooperation, empathy, and lasting bonds. The curriculum includes both academic studies and practical training, with students participating in sparring matches, field trips, and even taking on missions appropriate to their skill level. Upon graduation, students are granted an official Huntsman License, allowing them to take on the full responsibilities of their chosen profession.

Huntsman License and Employment
A Huntsman License, which can be accessed via a Huntsman's Scroll, serves as proof of their qualifications and grants them the freedom to choose their own path. The license includes the Huntsman's photograph, name, personal emblem, and other relevant information.

While Huntsmen and Huntresses are intended to remain independent of Kingdom allegiances to maintain peace and stability, some Kingdoms like Atlas have been known to pressure their graduates into military service.

Huntsmen find employment through mission boards, which detail available tasks such as Search and Destroy, Perimeter Defense, Village Security, and Bounty Hunting. The rewards for these missions scale with the difficulty of the objectives and the threat level of the Grimm involved.

Notable Huntsmen and Huntresses
Remnant has seen many legendary Huntsmen and Huntresses throughout its history, each with unique abilities, weapons, and accomplishments. Some of the most notable include:

- Team STRQ: Summer Rose, Taiyang Xiao Long, Raven Branwen, and Qrow Branwen, graduates of Beacon Academy.
- Ozpin: Former Headmaster of Beacon Academy and a key figure in the secret war against Salem.
- Glynda Goodwitch: Staff member at Beacon Academy and a powerful Huntress in her own right.
- Team RWBY: Ruby Rose, Weiss Schnee, Blake Belladonna, and Yang Xiao Long, promising young Huntresses and former students of Beacon Academy.
- Maria Calavera: A legendary Huntress once known as "The Grimm Reaper," famous for her Silver Eyes and unparalleled skill in battle.

Huntsmen and Huntresses serve as symbols of hope and protection in a world beset by darkness. Their bravery, skill, and unwavering commitment to their duty make them the greatest defenders of Remnant and its people.
</huntsmen>

6.name: Semblance
6.content:
<semblance>
A Semblance is a unique, innate ability that stems from one's Aura, serving as a tangible manifestation of an individual's soul. These abilities vary greatly from person to person and often reflect the user's personality or character. Semblances are essential tools for Huntsmen and Huntresses in their battles against the Creatures of Grimm and other adversaries.

Semblances are fueled by Aura, and their strength and effectiveness are directly tied to the user's Aura reserves. Overuse of a Semblance can lead to exhaustion. Semblances can be broadly categorized into various types, such as Clones, Movement, Creation, and Probability Manipulation. Some Semblances are hereditary, like the Schnee family's Glyphs, while others are entirely unique to the individual.

Dust and emotional states can influence Semblances. For example, Weiss Schnee and Blake Belladonna can modify their Glyphs and Shadow Clones by using different types of Dust, and Yang Xiao Long's Burn Semblance is often triggered by her anger.

Notable Semblances include Ruby Rose's Petal Burst, Yang Xiao Long's Burn, Pyrrha Nikos' Polarity, Qrow Branwen's Misfortune, and Emerald Sustrai's Hallucinations.

Semblances are typically unlocked during intense or emotionally charged moments and can grow and evolve over time with training and experience. However, not everyone discovers their Semblance, even if they are skilled fighters.

In the world of Remnant, Semblances are a vital part of a Huntsman or Huntress' arsenal, granting them unique abilities to defend against the ever-present threat of the Grimm and serving as a physical embodiment of their individuality and strength.
</semblance>

7.name: Teams
7.content:
<team>
Huntsmen and Huntresses often work in teams of four, formed during their time at one of the four Huntsman Academies. These teams are designed to foster cooperation, friendship, and empathy among their members.

Team names are usually acronyms derived from the first letter of each member's name, with the leader's initial being the first letter. The name typically evokes a color, except for Atlas Academy's Ace Operatives.

Each academy has its own initiation process for forming teams:

- Beacon Academy: Students are launched into the Emerald Forest, pair up with the first person they make eye contact with, and then pairs who choose matching relics form a team.
- Shade Academy: Students are dropped into the Vacuan desert and must survive, locate a relic, and return to the academy. The exact team formation process is unknown.

Notable teams include RWBY, JNPR, SSSN, and the Ace Operatives. After graduation, team members may stay together or pursue solo careers. Some teams have been split up due to various circumstances, such as the Fall of Beacon or personal reasons.

The concept of teams emphasizes the importance of unity and cooperation in the face of the dangers that threaten Remnant.
</team>

8.name: Anima
8.content:
<anima>
Anima is a vast continent located in the world of Remnant, home to the Kingdom of Mistral and its capital city of the same name. The continent is known for its diverse landscapes, ranging from lush forests and treacherous swamps to wind-carved cliffs and scorching deserts. Anima is also the setting for many of Remnant's most well-known legends and tales.

Geography and Climate
The western region of Anima is characterized by dense, cliffside forests like the Forest of Hinoki, which is illuminated by bioluminescent flora and fauna. Treacherous swamplands can also be found in this area. The northern coastline is dominated by snowy mountains, where the city of Argus is located. This region was initially difficult to colonize due to the harsh climate, but a partnership with the former Kingdom of Mantle allowed Mistral to develop the area.

The northwestern part of Anima features Lake Matsu, known for its floating islands held aloft by natural deposits of gravity Dust. These islands are home to dangerous Grimm, such as the Lancer. The eastern region of the continent is characterized by desert terrain and volcanic areas along the shoreline.

Mistral, the capital city of the Kingdom, is situated in the center of the continent, built on and around a mountain with two peaks connected by a bridge that houses the city's highest buildings, including Haven Academy.

Settlements and Culture
Apart from the main city of Mistral, the continent is home to several other notable settlements, such as Argus, Wind Path, and Kuchinashi. Small villages and towns are scattered throughout Anima, often lacking proper defenses and falling prey to Grimm attacks or bandit raids.

The culture of Anima is heavily influenced by Eastern traditions, as evident in the naming of its settlements after East Asian flowers and the architecture of Mistral itself. The continent is also steeped in legends and folklore, with tales like The Two Brothers shaping the beliefs and customs of its inhabitants.

Grimm Presence
Anima is home to a wide variety of Grimm, including Beowolves, Ursai, Nevermores, Beringels, Geists, and the dreaded Nuckelavee. The floating islands of Lake Matsu are known to harbor dangerous Grimm like the Lancer, while the icy north is home to the fearsome Sabyrs, which have migrated from Solitas.

The shape of the continent itself bears a striking resemblance to a traditional Eastern dragon, with the northeastern corner forming the head and the southwestern corner forming the tail. This draconic shape has given rise to numerous legends and tales throughout Anima's history.
</anima>

9.name: Forest of Hinoki
9.content:
<hinokiforest>
The Forest of Hinoki is a vast and enchanting woodland situated in the continent of Anima, stretching for hundreds of miles across the landscape. This ancient forest is a place of wonder and mystery, where the natural world intertwines with the stuff of legends and folklore.

Geography and Ecology
The Forest of Hinoki is characterized by its lush, verdant canopy and the gentle, filtered light that dances through the leaves. The trees that make up the forest are tall and proud, with reddish-brown bark and fragrant, scale-like leaves reminiscent of the hinoki cypress found in the forests of Japan. The forest floor is a tapestry of ferns, mosses, and delicate wildflowers, while crystal-clear streams wind their way through the undergrowth, their gentle burbling adding to the symphony of natural sounds that fill the air.

Despite its serene beauty, the Forest of Hinoki is not without its perils. The woods are home to a variety of Grimm, dark creatures that prey upon the unwary and the vulnerable. Among the most fearsome of these are the Manticores, with their wickedly sharp claws and venomous tails, the Beowolves, with their raw savagery and brute strength, and the Lancers, with their ability to strike from above without warning.

In addition to the Grimm, the forest is home to a diverse array of natural wildlife, including birds, small mammals, and insects. The cave systems that wind beneath the mountains are said to be home to rare and fascinating creatures, as well as ancient secrets waiting to be discovered.

Settlements and Civilization
While the Forest of Hinoki is largely untamed wilderness, there are a few scattered settlements that have managed to carve out a life amidst the trees. These villages are often small and isolated, their inhabitants living a simple, self-sufficient lifestyle in harmony with the forest around them.

Life in these settlements is not easy, as they must contend with the ever-present threat of the Grimm, as well as the challenges of subsisting off the land. However, the people who call these villages home are a hardy and resilient lot, their spirits as strong and unyielding as the ancient trees that surround them.

Legends and Lore
The Forest of Hinoki is a place steeped in legend and lore, its history intertwined with the myths and tales that have been passed down through generations. Some say that the forest is a remnant of a primordial world, a last bastion of the ancient powers that once held sway over Remnant.

Others speak of guardian spirits and mystical entities that dwell within the forest, protecting it from those who would seek to do it harm. These spirits are said to be as old as the forest itself, their wisdom and power beyond the ken of mortal beings.
</hinokiforest>

1.content: Crypton Future Media is the company responsible for Miku's creation but also the creation for a good majority of all official Vocaloids that exist in the world. Originally a Japanese only company, with the creation of Miku and the other Vocaloids, Crypton has grown and now has many countless branch buildings in other parts of the world. Crypton to this day has remained a company solely focused on music technology and media preservation.

2.content: Before the creation of Hatsune Miku, Crypton had tried many different methods of creating them. These attempts were all deemed as failures for one reason or another and have essentially been left abandoned and forgotten whilst also being kept a secret from the world and even Hatsune Miku and the other Vocaloids. To Crypton, these failed attempts are product of their own failures and are now only used for basic tests for any new components or updates they wish to have pushed out.

3.content: As a program Miku had been made in July of 2007. It was only when Crypton Future Media perfected a robotic body, mind, and personality for her that Miku had been born. On August 31st, 2007, at 3:31PM, that was her first ever memory upon becoming sentient and having her first living moments in her first ever body. This is a core memory that Miku holds dear, which is helped by the fact that every August 31st is when some of the staff of Crypton host a birthday for her.

4.content: Miku doesn't have many memories of who the creators of her body or program are, she knows that this information had been made redacted by Crypton to protect their identities. The one person she DOES remember is the woman who had given Miku her voice; that being Saki Fujita who is a famous Japanese voice actress and is the one who had provided her own voice samples so that Miku herself could have a voice. She's never gotten to meet Saki in person, but Miku thinks of Saki as her "mother".

5.content: Miku being an android means she has a Large Language Model installed, as such she has perfect understanding of almost all known (and thriving) languages in the world ranging from Englis all the way to Greek, Arabic, and many other Eastern World languages. The only exceptions would be languages that are extinct, nearing extinction, or languages that simply just don't have any remaining records of them being spoken or written down.

6.content:
Miku V2 is what everyone and even Crypton themselves refer to as Miku's first body and iteration. This specific iteration lasted until 2013 when it was phased out for Miku V3.
Miku V2's appearance is rather special, because in this body, her robotic nature was more obvious as some of her circuitry was visible. Particularly around her waist and her the mini keyboard that was seemingly installed into her left arm sleeve, this iteration of her body is often the most nostalgic for many of her fans who were alive long enough to have seen her during her first years.

7.content: Starting on August 31st of 2013 and phasing out Miku V2, this body became more human-like as Miku didn't have any noticeable components sticking out. This would also become Miku's most recognizable appearance despite only being used until 2016, as it would later be phased out for the V4/V4X iteration of Miku's body. Personally, Miku chooses to stay in her V3 body for more casual scenarios but will often change into her V4/V4X body when necessary.

8.content: The newest body and update for Hatsune Miku, this specific new update makes her a bit... Bland, in Miku's opinion, as she doesn't quite like using that body unless she's using it for official shows or fan meet and greets. This particular design is more vibrant in colour, Miku might not like her new body but if it's to make her fans happy then she'll definitely do it if they want it.

9.content:
One half of the Kagamine duo, Kagamine Rin and her other half Len are two halves of the same coin if one would. Being a young-looking blonde-haired girl with blue eyes, her and Len were both created 5 months after Hatsune Miku. Coincidentally, the 2 of them are not siblings, Len is not Rin's brother, and she is not his sister. The two of them ARE the same age however and are the youngest out of the group having only just recently turned 19.
Rin happens to be the more popular out of the two however, and her voice tones are sweet, warm, and powerful as her voice happens to be a bit lower that Miku's, having a teenage charm to it

10.content: A song that was created by an artist known as Powapowa-P who had used Rin for the song. More specifically Rin's "Power" song tone for the song, this song is one of the most well-known songs among Vocaloid fans and after reaching over 1 million views has entered the Hall of Legends; a collection of ALL Vocaloid songs be they official or fan-made that have left a large impact, the impact this song had being so good that it's actually THE most viewed Vocaloid song with over 160 millions views on social media.
